story:
It's here! OCCUPY! The White House Sprites just released their first stand alone music video:

DON THE CON

Featuring The White House Sprites of OCCUPY! 

 

PILOT EPISODE - Which Hunt?!  Part 1

 

OCCUPY! The White House Sprites

This project will be a series of short sketch & music videos with puppets speaking truth to power.  Its main characters, three wise, musical sprites, live in the Oval Office and come out of the woodwork whenever the White House ain't workin' the way that it should work. The project takes aim at the U.S. executive branch of government, often rendering the President's actual words and actions in puppetry.  In acerbic, yet accessible song and satire, the White House Sprites school the President and entertain audiences with lessons in civics and ethics, gleefully reminding us all of the truths we still hold to be self-evident.

OCCUPY!  The White House Sprites seeks to:

  • Build community through comedy 
  • Offer fun, accessible lessons in civics and ethics
  • Transform outrage into laughter and action
  • Boldly go where no live-action satire has gone before
  • Spread good karma and engage new audiences

The support you pledge will enable us to produce four episodes, gather a following of viewers like you, and advance the project toward a revenue stream from partnerships with companies like YouTube, Funny or Die, Netflix, Hulu, or Amazon.  

Check back for Part 1 of our pilot episode Which Hunt?!, as well as  OCCUPY! The White House Sprites' music video Don the Con to be posted here soon!

OCCUPY! The White House Sprites considers team diversity behind and in front of the cameras an essential part of this project's growth and success, not to mention its raison d'etre.

We are asking you to BE A PART OF OUR TEAM. Please contribute now and share our campaign!

 

WHO WE ARE

 

Founders

BJORN THORSTAD and RICH MEITIN have over 50 years combined experience producing music, audio, video and live theatre in New York City.  They met in 2002 for an improvised recording session at Rich's studio. Out of that comedy jam came a half-hour political satire album and 15 years (and counting) of creative collaboration. 

RICH  has been an award-winning producer, composer and engineer of music and audio since 1985. His work has been recognized with a Cannes Lion and multiple London International Awards. He has worked with various artists ranging from Billy Joel to the London Philharmonic, and for clients including NBC, ABC, CBS, Coke and IBM. He is a leader in the Indivisible and Sister District Trump opposition groups. In his early career years, he was a chief legislative aide and attorney.

BJORN is an award-winning actor, director and producer across multiple media platforms.  As an Artistic Director for Stage 13, Bjorn produced two Off-Broadway premiers directed by Tony winners Dan Fogler and Sam Gold.  He starred at Radio City Music Hall in a national tour for Warner Bros., and appears regularly in theatre, film and television. Bjorn is a leader in community activism, and serves on the board of directors for The Millay Colony for the Arts.

 

Creative Team

JENNIFER BARNHART is an award-winning puppeteer, actress, and voiceover artist. She was part of the original Tony Award-winning musical Avenue Q for its entire six-year run on Broadway. She has puppeteered for PBS's Between the Lions, Julie's Greenroom with Julie Andrews, and Disney's Johnny and the Sprites, among others. She recently took over the role of ZOE on Sesame Street, where she is in her seventeenth season as a Muppeteer. Jennifer's "human" appearances on television include House of Cards, As the World Turns, and various episodes of Law & Order: SVU (in one of which she played a puppeteer!) 

JANICE PENDARVIS is an elegant, world-class singer of R&B, pop, jazz, reggae, rock and avant-garde music.   She has worked with artists including David Bowie, Sting, Steely Dan, Roberta Flack, The Rolling Stones, Aaron Neville, Barry White, and many others. You may have seen Janice featured on tour with Sting, on Letterman and "SNL" shows, and in countless commercials, TV shows  and films. She also has a distinguished career in voiceovers. www.janicependarvis.com

KEITH ANTHONY FLUITT has worked globally as a vocalist with luminaries like Roberta Flack, Diana Ross, Celine Dion and Cee Lo Green. He cowrote "I Met An Angel on Christmas Day" for Celine Dion and was a vocal arranger for The Pet Shop Boys "Nightlife Tour" tour. He has a #1 dance song (produced by Grammy winner DJ David Morales) and another release planned his year.  www.keithanthonyfluitt.com

JENN HARRIS  is a New York-based actress, writer and producer. Her web series NEW YORK IS DEAD, which she co-wrote, co-starred and produced, premiered at The TriBeCa Film Festival's N.O.W. program in 2017. She won Lortel and Theatre World Awards for her performance in the Off-Broadway play MODERN ORTHODOX, and is credited with stage and film productions in New York City and regionally.

DAVE DROXLER is a Drama Desk-nominated New York actor and writer who recently appeared Off-Broadway in Sweetee, directed by Pat Birch at The Signature Theatre, and Candide under the direction of Hal Prince for The New York City Opera. Dave was featured in the film Limitless, TV's How to Get Away with Murder, and is the voice of Nick Jr.’s Sunny Day.  www.davedroxler.com

LYNNE MARIE ROSENBERG is an actor and writer living in Brooklyn, NY. She is best known for her work as DINAH on HBO’s High Maintenance. Lynne has written for Howlround, Backstage, and The Huffington Post and is the curator of CastAndLoose.tumblr.com, and the creator, producer, and host of the popular Joe’s Pub show, CastAndLoose Live! www.lynnemarierosenberg.com

 

Only Together

Only together can we:

  • Build a community of friendship and laughter
  • Preserve democracy and dignity
  • Disrupt corruption
  • Hold our representatives accountable
  • Remain aware and vigilant
  • Speak truth to power

As astute observers have noted, Trump's Achilles heel is ridicule. He is powerless in the face of laughter. Let's serve it up abundantly together!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Producing quality programming with the finest talent and technology is never cheap. Some of the expenses are obvious: writers, composers, actors, puppeteers, musicians, video and audio engineers and editors, etc., but the hidden expenses are just as essential: Legal, accounting, graphic design, props, set, platform and credit card fees, taxes, social media, production management, and much more. In short, initial set-up fees run $9-15,000 and per-episode costs are about $6,000. Our budget spreadsheet is available upon request.

What's in it for YOU?! For starters: the chance to build a vibrant, creative response and a one-of-a-kind, positive community.  Plus, you can choose from a basketful of fun perks, including: advance copies of music and behind-the-scenes production access; a red carpet launch party; eavesdropping on a writing session,  recording session or video shoot; a build-a puppet workshop; and puppet lessons from our celebrity puppeteer. Not to mention screen credits and even a back-end piece of the action.

Impact

Wouldn't you like stick-it-to-the-man? Turn your rage into laughter? Build a fresh, informed, optimistic community? Reach potential new friends and allies? Feel more hopeful and positive about the future? Strike a blow for decency and restore dignity to the Presidency? We sure would.

We are lifelong, successful professionals in the New York creative community and we are undertaking these goals as a labor of love, on your behalf.

 

Risks & Challenges

Turning a project like this into, say, a network TV series may be an ambitious challenge, yet right now other creators are developing ideas that will soon be on your home screens. Why not OTWHS? Why not us?

Our project is entirely within the range of our team's talent, experience and expertise, and is exactly what needs to happen on the way to an ongoing web or cable series.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also assist just as critically by:

  • ENGAGING OTHERS - Sharing our campaign with your family, friends and online communities on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram to help expand our fundraising reach!
  • SHARING OUR CONTENT - Clicks = Dollars
    • If OCCUPY! The White House Sprites attains 10K YouTube Subscribers, YouTube will provide production studio time and resources to us for free!
  • KEEPING US CURRENT - Let us know of any political, press, creative or other organizations that might like to find out about what we’re doing, and help us make some noise!

story:
...so now what?!

Because of your kick ass support, we EXCEEDED our crowdfunding goal (!!!!) ... which means that we are able to KEEP RAISING FUNDS! How cool is that?!

If you weren't in a position to donate during our official campaign window, you can still support us moving forward! And you can keep harassing your friends and family to get on board. Ain't that fun?! 

In the meantime, our team is busy fulfilling your perks (get ready!) .We'll be posting updates here, but to stay completely in the loop, be sure to follow us on social media:

  • TWITTER: @bingetheseries
  • INSTAGRAM: @bingetheseries
  • FACEBOOK: @bingeseries

And holy shit, we FUCKING LOVE YOU. Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

IT'S 2018 AND WE'RE MAKING BULIMIA OUR BITCH! 

 

 

BINGE is a darkly comedic webseries inspired by Angela Gulner's decade-long battle with bulimia, and her ultimate recovery via treatment at a Partial Hospitalization Clinic. It explores the under-represented world of eating disorders in way that is authentic, moving... and a hell of a lot of fun.

Last year, we released the Pilot episode of Angela's story. The response was out of this world.

Not only did we garner over half a million views on YouTube and write-ups in major publications like IndieWire, Elite Daily, Bustle, Bust, and Buzzfeed, but we’ve also received thousands (and we mean thousands) of emails and comments from individuals all over the world who responded to this pilot and wanted to see more of it.  

Which brings us to this campaign...



The outpouring of support for this series has been too loud to ignore. We've got something special on our hands, and we're so eager to continue telling this story with you. So, get ready... we're making a full season of this show, together! 

Great question. 

Over 30 million people in the United States alone suffer from eating disorders. In other countries around the world, people suffer in silence because there is no talk of these illnesses at all. Eating disorders have the highest mortality rates of all mental illnesses, and yet very few films and television shows get them right.

This population, this community, is severely under-serviced by the entertainment industry and it’s time for that to change.

During this season of giving, we are asking you to support content that bolsters, inspires, and connects a community. Entertainment shapes our culture - so let’s shape entertainment.

Join us in changing the world.

But after that? Pizza.

We are raising funds to make five additional 22-minute episodes. And while most half-hour television comedies have budgets of around $300,000 per episode, we will work long hours, call in all of our favors, and fight our damnedest to make this show the best it can be. We produced a premium-quality pilot for next-to-nothing... image what we can do with your support!

Here’s what your hard-earned cash will provide us:

  • Begin shooting in early 2018.
  • Release the full season by the end of 2018/early 2019.
  • Pay our amazing cast and crew a little bit to for their time and overwhelming commitment to the project. They volunteered on the pilot, and we don’t want this project to doom them to a lifetime of living in cardboard boxes… unless, you know, they prefer that.
  • Feed our cast and crew (which seems kinda sorta important, as we are making content about eating disorders...)
  • Secure bigger and more visually interesting locations. Locations are one of the bigger costs in filmmaking, and since the majority of this project is set an a treatment clinic, we’ll need to afford a location that can tell that story.
  • A few celebrity guest stars!
  • Rent high end equipment that will allow for greater production value, and make this project really shine.
  • Edit the project before we’re dead. Post-production is a lot of work, and our editor, Dashiell, needs an adequate number of pudding cups in order to work. 

*FUN FACT: If everyone who viewed the pilot donated $1, we would have over $600,000 to produce this show. EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS. For real. No donation is too small. You’re part of an army! LET’S ROAR!

Happy Little Guillotine Studios has been on the forefront of digital entertainment since 2006. Having created one of the very first web series, the successful Break a Leg, the boutique production company has helped shape how digital content is created.

Above all, HLG Studios is known for two things: high-end storytelling and their ability to create high-quality content on digital budgets.

We strongly believe in BINGE and will lean heavily on our industry connections, on amazing TV and film actors who love the show and are excited to guest star, on our tireless crews and our managers and agents who will fight to help get this show made.

Shows like Broad City, High Maintenance and Insecure started here too. We believe we can repeat their success. This story needs to be told and we’re going to put all our blood, sweat and tears into making sure that it is.

    *DISCLAIMER:  If donating to this campaign will in any way impede or take funds from eating disorder treatment… do not donate. Your health, your wellness, and your recovery should be tended to first. There are other ways to show your support. We love you. Please, seek treatment. 

    Still need convincing?

    View the pilot episode of BINGE: 

     

     The short film prequel THE BLIND GIRL:  

     

    And our interview series to see for yourself how special and necessary this series is:

     

    You glorious fighters. You loud, proud, brave, and vibrant heroes. You warriors. Thank you.
    From the bottom of our hearts. Your unwavering support has inspired us to buck the slow-moving Hollywood machine and GET BACK TO IT! This show has always been about community. Now, we are producing it as a community.

    This show is as much yours as it is ours. We can’t wait to make it with you.

    This team of badass individuals has been working tirelessly and selflessly to spread the word about BINGE. They’re the best of the best, and we couldn’t do this without them.

    Take a moment to gaze upon their beautiful faces with wonder here.

    IF YOU OR ANYONE YOU KNOW IS STRUGGLING...

    Help is out there, and recovery is possible. Keep fighting, you're worth it.

    The National Eating Disorder Hotline (NEDA): 1-800-931-2237

    Suicide Prevention Hotline: 1-800-273-8255

    And check out our RESOURCE LIST -- and add to it with your favorite places for support!

story:
Under the Bridge is... a series that follows recently homeless, Casey, who stumbles upon Daisy's Pocket, a small homeless community on the outskirts of NYC. Casey connects with her new campmates over shared feelings of guilt, shame, and anger towards the world and themselves. She learns that these people are more than the “hopeless fool” or the “victim of unfortunate circumstances" that they stereotypically represent. They become her companions because sometimes all you need at rock bottom are people who understand what it’s like being there.

Under the Bridge is NOT... another one of those super depressing shows that make you question the meaning of everything. It's funny! It's a dark comedy series filmed in the style of "The Office" that also uses a mix of surreal and satirical elements to tell its stranger than fiction story. It'll make you laugh and it'll make you cry, but most importantly it will make the subject of homelessness more accessible to the masses by relating to its characters who we generally don't see.

Homelessness is... an issue that affects over 100 million people worldwide and millions of Americans are just one paycheck away from becoming part of that statistic. We want Under the Bridge to give people a reason to talk about this often overlooked issue and we need YOU to make it happen. We will also be donating 10% of the total funds raised to The Coalition for the Homeless, the nation’s oldest advocacy and direct service organization helping homeless men, women, and children in New York City.

Over the past 3 years developing this series, we’ve seen hate attempt to take hold of our world. But, the movements that have formed out of the need for acceptance and change, have shown us the power of unity. We've seen that real change can happen when we don’t let our differences overcome our capacity to love. But, in our daily lives, we see a huge disconnect from this, without the support of a group of people, we see people going back to ignoring what and who is in front of them.

We want people really see the person they pass on the street, to understand that they have a story- a reason for being where they are right now. We want people to know that a stranger without a roof over their head isn’t worth any less than we are and hey, maybe they’re not even that “strange.” If we can get even just one person to realize that the homeless are deserving of as much love and acceptance as anyone else, we think we’ll all have a little more hope.  

We plan to tell these stories over three seasons of eight to ten episodes but before we get ahead of ourselves, let’s focus on getting this off the ground. This Indiegogo campaign will allow us to hit the record button for our first episode (our proof-of-concept) and deliver it to you as a digital download before we get the series picked up.  At the same time, we’ll be completing our business plan and conceptual synopsis for the seven to nine subsequent episodes and we’ll keep you in the loop throughout the whole process! Then we’re really going for it–pitching to cable, network and streaming channels and participating in next year’s festival circuit.

 

When Lee Schatzman, our actor/writer/producer, moved to NYC in 2015, he settled down in an illegal hostel for a few months. The experiences he had during this time inspired the creation of Under the Bridge.

“The place was cheap. You could pay by the day so you'd see faces come and go. We'd sleep in a small room with 9 bunk beds–hardly any space to call your own. Needless to say, I got to know some of these guys really well–most of them were homeless and could only afford to stay in the hostel maybe one or two nights and then they'd be out on the streets for the rest of the week. It was sad when they had to go. I generally took them out with the money that I had saved. Sometimes they shared their stories and sometimes they were too ashamed. We'd drink our fill then they'd go on their way. Sometimes they'd come back and other times you'd never see them again.

It was around that time that I had noticed a pattern in some of my friend's lives who couldn't seem to climb out of the ruts they were stuck in. It was the shame that held them down and kept them prisoner and we provided them with it.

Often times we fail to see the full picture when we're confronted by something we don't understand. We hope this will help more people see the person in front of them, not a mistake. ” 

 

Haunted by the deaths of her children who tragically perished in an apartment fire, Daisy became terribly addicted to crack cocaine to cope with her grief. She was eventually able to rise above her tribulations and founded a small corner of the shanty village under the bridge that it's members call "Daisy's Pocket." Daisy took BlockHead, Pop-Pop, and Jonesey under her wing there, and is driven by the need to find a place for them to live clean and healthy lives.

 

Not much is known about BlockHead's life other than the fact that he's a runaway. He's the youngest member of the community and looks up to a lot of the guys in it which also makes him very susceptible to peer pressure and he often finds himself in trouble because of this. He's not the sharpest tool in the shed, which is why he’s been dubbed BlockHead, but he makes up for it by wearing his heart on his sleeve. 

 

The longest living member of the shanty village under the bridge, Lump was once the heir to a powerful titan of the textile industry. Not wishing to follow in his father's footsteps, Lump went off the grid and walked away from it all. He is now is in search of inner peace.

 

A greedy scoundrel and self-declared "king under the bridge." Roach was once just an average guy who became a drifter at a very early age. This eventually lead him under the bridge, where he finally became the leader he always saw himself as. He also thinks he's a distant cousin of the Queen of England.

Watch Roach as he tries to raise money for the campaign.

Check out this hilarious "Telethon Promo" that takes place within the world of Under the Bridge:

 
 

The newest resident in "Daisy’s Pocket," Casey stumbled upon the community after getting kicked out of her apartment a week ago. She’s running from a life of conformity and is determined to forge her own path.

We have the script locked down, an LLC set up, locations selected, and bought a bunch of cool props and costumes. Right now, we are finalizing casting and acquiring location permits and insurance. 

We're almost ready to get the cameras rolling, BUT WE WOULDN’T WANT TO (ok, wouldn’t be able to..) DO IT WITHOUT YOU! No rush though, we’ve waited 3 years now, take some time to review where your funds will go, first.

 

Cast & Crew: We gotta pay our talented team!
Food: And we have to feed them.
Equipment: Sony A7S II Camera, Canon L Series 200mm 2.8, Metabones Adapter, Lavalier microphones, Rode NTG-3 Shotgun Microphone, Ikan IB508-v2 Bi-Color LED  3-Light Studio Kit, Movo MFF400 Shoulder Rig and more! 
Insurance: General Liability Insurance to protect the team. 
Location Fees & Permits: Permit to film at Gateway National Recreation Area and monitoring fees for supervision from the park ranger.
Transportation: Trucks and vans to move cast, crew, equipment, transport food, and pay for gas and tolls.
Coalition for the Homeless: A portion of every contribution we receive will support the people this project is for. The Coalition for the Homeless is the nation’s oldest advocacy and direct service organization helping homeless men, women, and children in New York City.

In addition to your new favorite show and supporting to an amazing organization, The Coalition for the Homeless, here’s what else your contributions will get you:

$1: Our love and a portion of your donation will support The Coalition for the Homeless
$10: ↑ + a shout out on Under The Bridge’s Facebook and one of our cast & crew's social channels
$25 Perk: ↑↑ + some cool character pins and a digital download of the pilot!
$50 Perk: ↑↑↑ + your name in the credits and an invite to our super cool screening party in NYC
$100 Perk:↑↑↑↑ + original signed copy of the script
$500 Perk: ↑↑↑↑↑ + a  custom illustration of yourself by Lee Schatzman. (He drew all the character cartoons in the main photo section above!)
$1500 Perk: ↑↑↑↑↑↑ + Associate Producer credit in the series and on IMDB
$5000 Perk: ↑↑↑↑↑ + Executive producer credit in the series and on IMDB  

Want to be IN the episode? We have a special perk for those living in NYC or willing to travel (at their own expense). A $500 contribution will make you 1/5 extras in the episode, list you in the credits and IMDB, and you get everything in the tiers below, too.

We’re a tight-knit group of friends and we are dedicated to seeing this project through to the end. We’ve worked together and over the past 4 years and have completed over 50 + projects.

 

Lee Schatzman

Producer, Writer, and Roach​​

 

Lee has worked in the industry over the past five years both in front of the camera and behind. He has filled the roles of assistant editor, assistant camera, and production supervisor working on the television series Penny Dreadful, TIME  web series American Voices, and feature-length films Goat, Patti Cake$ and Assholes. 

Check him out on IMDb, Vimeo, Facebook, and Instagram. 

Greg Kase

Writer and Director

Greg has worked in the entertainment industry for the past nine years and has experience as a stagehand, costume production assistant, stand-up comedy producer, and as a locations manager. He started his career in Scott Rudin’s production office and has since then worked on projects such as Amazon Prime’s Sneaky Pete, Netflix’s Seven Seconds, HBO’s Succession, Nextflix’s Friends from College, NBC’s Manifest and CBS’s Tell Me a Story. 

Say "Hi!" to him on: Facebook and Instagram.

Brady Schatzman

Creator, Writer, and Ranger Dan

 

Say "Hi!" to him on: Facebook.

Nicholas Motyka

Cinematographer

 

Nicholas began his career studying film at SUNY Purchase, he later partnered with Ideal Glass Studio in the heart of the East Village. He has worked on music videos, performance art films, documentaries, live event videos and a trilogy of avant-garde short films. 

Check him out on Vimeo and Facebook.

We want to share the passion that we have for this project with you. We appreciate every contribution whether it be a donation, like, or share– you are helping this project get made.

Even if you can’t contribute any funds for our project right now, here are some other ways you can help:

Visit Coalition for the Homeless online

Follow us on Facebook and Like us on Instagram

Share this YouTube video and Facebook post.

Share our campaign with your friends. Here's a short link: https://igg.me/at/UnderTheBridge

Your support means the world to us and we can’t wait to have you join the team!
story_txt:
Under the Bridge is... a series that follows recently homeless, Casey, who stumbles upon Daisy's Pocket, a small homeless community on the outskirts of NYC. Casey connects with her new campmates over shared feelings of guilt, shame, and anger towards the world and themselves. She learns that these people are more than the “hopeless fool” or the “victim of unfortunate circumstances" that they stereotypically represent. They become her companions because sometimes all you need at rock bottom are people who understand what it’s like being there.Under the Bridge is NOT... another one of those super depressing shows that make you question the meaning of everything. It's funny! It's a dark comedy series filmed in the style of "The Office" that also uses a mix of surreal and satirical elements to tell its stranger than fiction story. It'll make you laugh and it'll make you cry, but most importantly it will make the subject of homelessness more accessible to the masses by relating to its characters who we generally don't see.Homelessness is... an issue that affects over 100 million people worldwide and millions of Americans are just one paycheck away from becoming part of that statistic. We want Under the Bridge to give people a reason to talk about this often overlooked issue and we need YOU to make it happen. story:
• Hi everyone! I'm Vaggelis Karadimas and I'm an animator. I animate in 2D (traditional, tradigital, digital puppetry and a bit stop motion). I 've studied history and archaeology and I have a PhD in history of modern Greek education. I'm disabled - because of an adamantinoma (I'm cured of the cancer though) - but I assure you that this only motivated me more to become an animator! I'm "running" vktoons.
  • I collaborate with mabrida studio (it participated in "Loving Vincent" - look at the ending titles) in a project named "The Treasure at the roots of the Tree of Earth". It is a digital puppetry (or 2D CGI) animated web-series for children starring an Elf named Flower (Anthos in Greek) , a kalikantzaros  (a Greek kind of goblin) named Pimply (Spithourakias in Greek), a devil who hears in the name Seir, an angel named Omael and ancient Greek god Pan! They all try to find the Tree that keeps Earth at her place, each one for his very reasons. But that won't be that easy! The must solve problems on their way there, help some people, animals and several other creatures to keep on looking fot the Tree! Not only that, but they must overcome the obstacles that the great kalikantzaros Mantrakoukos, the archangel Gabriel and the great devil Foras will put on their way! The voice of Greek legendary voice actor Argyris Pavlidis will be heard there, along with the voices of his troupe. It will be consisted from 17 episodes of 7 minutes duration each.

Those who will help us, will not only allow us make the series a reality, but they will also open wide roads to a series of wonderful things that may happen;

  1. We will take advantage of the internet, which is the present and the future of tv.
  2. We will bring children in Greece closer to animation both as educated viewers and as future creators!
  3. We will push some positive messages via a humorist animated web-series to children around the globe! 
  4. We will persuade companies in Greece to invest in Greek animation!
  5. We will contribute to create a culture of collaboration between Greek animators and between the Greek animation community and other departments related to animation industry worldwide! In general, someone who helps us, helps creating a greater market for animation productions where there was not one!
  6. We will open roads for collaboration with companies and studios outside Greece!
  7. Success to that project will give us courage to try to make it to Annecy Animation Festival, to work on more series and to think about starting a web tv dedicated to kids!

So, you've reached here, so you think that perhaps it's worth to help us. "Yes, but.. what will they do with the money and what will I get in return"?

  • The amount of money we ask for is really nothing for an animated series. We want to collect 30.600$. It is the amount of money we need to start and finish the series, even if the work we'll put in costs a lot more.  

  1. The animator will get 7.350$
  2. The amount of about 2.450$ will go to a heavy duty desktop computer.
  3. 2450€ will be spend for the payments of the voice actors.
  4. 1500€ will go to subtitle the series in Greek (for those with hearing problems), German and English.
  5. 1225$ will go to 3D prints and models (mostly for perks but also for general merchandise purposes)
  6. 3675$ will go to  preparing the merchandise of the series (we will collaborate with pjb brand for such a case)
  7. 610$ will go to three really handmade and amazing books
  8. 1835$ will go to text editing.
  9. 3675$ will be spend for ads and events and
  10. the rest of the money will go for the other perks, taxes, fees etc.
  11. If we manage to get more money than we ask, this will make our life easier; These will go to hire more animators, buy additional software licences for the same reason and for educating them on the software! We will also get payed in a more appropriate wya for the effort we will put in!

We also have these great perks for you! Most of them are about getting to know us better ad helping us see who our backers are! It's mostly about human connection! But we also offer some great stuff! Posters, yourselves animated (!) and with your voice on it(!!!) and you can get up to become a co-producer. In any case, your name will be immortalized on our social media accounts ;)

 

  • "And what if you don't get the money you are asking for"? In that case, we'll still continue to catch the dream. Hopefully it will be enough money to pay the actors, the text editing and everyone else need to get paid, but the animator - that's me. Then come's the next step: I really believe in the power of that project and I believe it can go to Annecy Animation Forum via asifa hellas. And I believe that there will get noticed and get fully financed. But, I really believe that we'll make here too!!!

You might think that this is just another animated series. Well, that's not a lie, but...In this case is more than a series. It can open the gates to a whole new situation in the field of animation in Greece and change the lives of Greek animators, create opportunities for collaborations with studios outside Greece and even trigger a boost to economy, since animation is still not getting the attention it should in Greece (imagine the potentials)!

  • You can push the Greek market to take animation seriously. Greek animators would not have to migrate to get a job. Greek companies would finally understand that animation makes money for them too! More young people would find in animation a working opportunity. Collaborations with companies and studios outside Greece would help a better connection between different cultures. A new and vivid market would connect three continents and many cultures. Internet projects will gain points in the market of Greece and that means that it will also gain a global audience. And all these are in your power to become real! Your donation will change lives and the industry in a country and will affect animation world in many aspects!
  • We have a team full of great people to achieve that. Mabrida Studio of the Sofianos Family is a well known studio in Greece and abroad (they are famous in Germany), mainly for its puppet theater and tv productions for kids and grown-ups. Recently it participated in the project of Oscar nominated "Loving Vincent". ​Argyris Pavlidis is the most known voice actors in Greece since decades and his troupe the best one we have in Greece. He and all the other actors have given the Greek voice to the most known cartoon characters (Candy Candy, Pokemon, TMNT, Cloudy with a chance of meatballs etc). One f my web projects - "In the dungeons" - was mentioned as a prime example of modern Greek animated satire in February's 2016 issue of Animation Magazine.
  • With such a team, we think it is certain the success of the series in Greece and wherever Greeks are found and we believe that it is something that will gain the love of children in the rest of world too!

As I already mentioned, Greece is a hard place to animate, for several reasons. Me and my collaborators are trying to "break" these walls and persuade companies, animators and the Greek audience that we can successfully animate in Greece!

  • We've struggled with these difficulties and we can say we are winners. We are determined and we fully support the project. We're experienced, we know that kids already love the show (they've watched the older versions) and we include them in our team as "special collaborators" (as you can understand, we cannot show them to you). There is international recognition, the mabrida studio participated in a great project, so not only we have what it takes to make this series a success, but we can start thinking of the future possibilities and opportunities.
  • We are a strong team, but not as big as those of foreign big studios. That means that we will have to put more effort to face difficulties that others solve with less effort.
  • The fact that Greece is a small market provides a great opportunity; To create a market in an almost virgin ground! To educate children on animation as viewers and as creators, and that has an economic potential. Also, to "educate" the companies and studios in Greece to have a better look in animation and its potentials. And that can lead once again to international collaborations. After all, it is a field which is connected directly with technology and animation today applies almost to everything! In our case, it can also help children get a solid ethical base tat will help them in their lives!
  • The threats are that the economic crisis might have create a psychology to the Greek market, avoiding to take the risks needed for such an industry to become real. So, there comes you! It is your strong message - supporting this campaign - that will persuade him about the potentials!

Well, we understand that...We live in Greece you see!

  • Yet, you can help us big time! Spread our campaign via your social media account (use those great indiegogo tools for that)!
  • Perhaps a person who owns a company or works in one, might be interested in funding our project! Talk to him person to person!
  • Do you know someone in your local media that would find our series and our campaign interesting? Ask him to come in touch with us!

Now, let's go and find that Treasure!

1500€ will go to subtitle the series in Greek (for those with hearing problems), German and English.
1225$ will go to 3D prints and models (mostly for perks but also for general merchandise purposes)
3675$ will go to  preparing the merchandise of the series (we will collaborate with pjb brand for such a case)
610$ will go to three really handmade and amazing books
1835$ will go to text editing.
3675$ will be spend for ads and events and
the rest of the money will go for the other perks, taxes, fees etc.
If we manage to get more money than we ask, this will make our life easier; These will go to hire more animators, buy additional software licences for the same reason and for educating them on the software! We will also get payed in a more appropriate wya for the effort we will put in!


We also have these great perks for you! Most of them are about getting to know us better ad helping us see who our backers are! It's mostly about human connection! But we also offer some great stuff! Posters, yourselves animated (!) and with your voice on it(!!!) and you can get up to become a co-producer. In any case, your name will be immortalized on our social media accounts ;)















 

"And what if you don't get the money you are asking for"? In that case, we'll still continue to catch the dream. Hopefully it will be enough money to pay the actors, the text editing and everyone else need to get paid, but the animator - that's me. Then come's the next step: I really believe in the power of that project and I believe it can go to Annecy Animation Forum via asifa hellas. And I believe that there will get noticed and get fully financed. But, I really believe that we'll make here too!!!


You might think that this is just another animated series. Well, that's not a lie, but...In this case is more than a series. It can open the gates to a whole new situation in the field of animation in Greece and change the lives of Greek animators, create opportunities for collaborations with studios outside Greece and even trigger a boost to economy, since animation is still not getting the attention it should in Greece (imagine the potentials)!

You can push the Greek market to take animation seriously. Greek animators would not have to migrate to get a job. Greek companies would finally understand that animation makes money for them too! More young people would find in animation a working opportunity. Collaborations with companies and studios outside Greece would help a better connection between different cultures. A new and vivid market would connect three continents and many cultures. Internet projects will gain points in the market of Greece and that means that it will also gain a global audience. And all these are in your power to become real! Your donation will change lives and the industry in a country and will affect animation world in many aspects!

We have a team full of great people to achieve that. Mabrida Studio of the Sofianos Family is a well known studio in Greece and abroad (they are famous in Germany), mainly for its puppet theater and tv productions for kids and grown-ups. Recently it participated in the project of Oscar nominated "Loving Vincent". ​Argyris Pavlidis is the most known voice actors in Greece since decades and his troupe the best one we have in Greece. He and all the other actors have given the Greek voice to the most known cartoon characters (Candy Candy, Pokemon, TMNT, Cloudy with a chance of meatballs etc). One f my web projects - "In the dungeons" - was mentioned as a prime example of modern Greek animated satire in February's 2016 issue of Animation Magazine.

With such a team, we think it is certain the success of the series in Greece and wherever Greeks are found and we believe that it is something that will gain the love of children in the rest of world too!



As I already mentioned, Greece is a hard place to animate, for several reasons. Me and my collaborators are trying to "break" these walls and persuade companies, animators and the Greek audience that we can successfully animate in Greece!


We've struggled with these difficulties and we can say we are winners. We are determined and we fully support the project. We're experienced, we know that kids already love the show (they've watched the older versions) and we include them in our team as "special collaborators" (as you can understand, we cannot show them to you). There is international recognition, the mabrida studio participated in a great project, so not only we have what it takes to make this series a success, but we can start thinking of the future possibilities and opportunities.

We are a strong team, but not as big as those of foreign big studios. That means that we will have to put more effort to face difficulties that others solve with less effort.
The fact that Greece is a small market provides a great opportunity; To create a market in an almost virgin ground! To educate children on animation as viewers and as creators, and that has an economic potential. Also, to "educate" the companies and studios in Greece to have a better look in animation and its potentials. And that can lead once again to international collaborations. After all, it is a field which is connected directly with technology and animation today applies almost to everything! In our case, it can also help children get a solid ethical base tat will help them in their lives!

The threats are that the economic crisis might have create a psychology to the Greek market, avoiding to take the risks needed for such an industry to become real. So, there comes you! It is your strong message - supporting this campaign - that will persuade him about the potentials!




Well, we understand that...We live in Greece you see!

Yet, you can help us big time! Spread our campaign via your social media account (use those great indiegogo tools for that)!

Perhaps a person who owns a company or works in one, might be interested in funding our project! Talk to him person to person!
Do you know someone in your local media that would find our series and our campaign interesting? Ask him to come in touch with us!


Now, let's go and find that Treasure!

story:
Hi!! Thanks for being here!!
We're Rob & Emily!

We're the creators of the promo you just watched! 

We're actors living in NYC! Oh, yeah, and we're married! 


that's us on our wedding day :)

"Cute! But...what is The Emily Spinach Show?"

The Emily Spinach Show is a talk/variety show with guests, musical performances, segments, games, and a kooky cast of characters for children of all ages!

The Emily Spinach Show values empathy, kindness, inclusion, vulnerability, feelings, and joy!

"What would an episode look like?"

I thought you'd never ask!!!

On our show, with your donations, we're gonna have...

1. Guests!

The audience of The Emily Spinach Show should feel represented by the the guests we hire to join Emily Spinach up onstage. The guests and the crew/artists/writers/creators (employed by your very donations!) will provide perspectives, experiences, and identities that differ from our, the creators, own. 
We will use our positions of leadership to make The Emily Spinach Show a platform for traditionally under-represented voices and vocations. This is imperative to the success, growth, and impact of our show.

vocations like...

dancers, actors, poets, musicians, writers, artists, animators, city officials, custodial workers, doctors, lawmakers, teachers, scientists, caregivers, designers, therapists, managers, activists, electricians, physicians, technicians, counselors, & more!

2. Interviews!

 Emily Spinach will get the chance to sit down with every guest in an interview. Questions posed by Ms. Spinach will range from, “How do you deal with bullies?” to "What are you very, very afraid of?" to “If you got to eat free pizza every single day for the rest of your life, but you’d also burp every two minutes, and also your burps would come out kinda purple-y...would you?”
(the answer to that is yes, obviously)

3. Storytelling!

Before actual filming begins, we’ll ask our guests for a childhood anecdote or lesson they would like to see come to life on The Emily Spinach Show.  With contribution from hired artists when the storytelling calls for it, we'll craft a film, animation, skit, etc., that retells said story in a creative, fun, and accessible way. 

 Each episode will revolve around one or two concrete "themes," based on the stories that we write and collect from our guests. A "theme" could be something like, "Why It's Very, Very Okay To Cry No Matter Who You Are," "Animals and Plants and Why We Love Them So Much!!!" or "Things  That Scare Us A Lot or A Little!"

 

4. Segments! 

Segments like  “Emily Spinach Interviews The Squirrels In Central Park," or "Emily Spinach Tries To Get To Know Every Dog That She Sees In The Span of Ten Minutes" or "Emily Spinach Dances Around Like A Joyful Muppet"  or "Emily Spinach Calls You About Your Car's Extended Warranty" will get Emily Spinach out of the studio and into New York City!

5. Characters!

 Characters like "Carmichael the Mouse", "Chicken," and "The Mime" will star in
 short skits and sketches, filling out the world of Emily Spinach!


 FUN FACT ALERT!
Carmichael is highly regarded in the Underground Comedy Scene!
(Very underground)
(It's...it's literally underground)


6. Games!

The games played by Emily Spinach and her guests will all rely heavily on “kid logic.” These games are for giggles and for making Ms. Spinach and her grown-up guests look extremely goofy,  of course. 


Don't mind us, just being flirty backstage! <3

 

7. Music!

Every episode will have a musical guest -  a real band or musician that we hire to play a kid-friendly song. Imagine a Broadway performer belting out an original piece about the importance of asking for help on one's math homework,  a very cool punk band singing about making friends in the cafeteria, or a talented violinist who gives a rousing rendition of “Itsy, Bitsy, Spider.” 

"What ages is this for, exactly?"

Well... all ages! 

If you're under 6 years old, you're going to love the larger-than-life characters, fluffy stuffed animals, and the bright and warm aesthetic of Emily Spinach's world. Also, the music, games, silly skits, and storytelling. 

If you're between 6 and 12, you'll really like the cool animation, the humor, the music, and the stories. You'll be old enough to dig some of the bigger themes of the show, and may even be starting to think about what you want to be when you grow up! You may be interested to learn about careers you've never seen up close, like, Historian or Playwright.

If you're between 12 and 18,  you're going to like learning about the wide variety of things you can do and you can be. You'll like the younger musicians and artists we invite on the show, and, you'll appreciate the dry delivery and unrelenting over-confidence of Emily Spinach.  

If you're 18 - 100, yeah, here's what's up, you're ALSO going to love it! We bet you'll actually sit down with your kids and watch with them!

And if there aren't little ones around to give you an excuse to sit down and indulge in some joyful silliness, it's all good. Go ahead and join the club! We're doing this for you, too!

"That reminds me, what's up with all the stuffed animals?"

Just like Emily Spinach has her co-host Alice The Snake by her side, every guest/grown-up on The Emily Spinach Show will be accompanied by their very own stuffed animal "friend." They are extremely good actors to have on set. Very committed!

   

"Adorable! And... who's Emily Spinach?"

 Emily Spinach is the host of The Emily Spinach Show, of course! ; )

Emily Spinach is kooky, confident, uncoordinated, and over-the-top. Most importantly, she's a good listener, and treats everyone who joins her onstage as the most exciting, important person she's ever met - because they are!

The name "Emily Spinach" is a nod to Alice Roosevelt,  a rule-breaking socialite and gifted writer. Alice was President Roosevelt's daughter, infamous for proudly ignoring the gendered expectations put on her by high society. Basically, she was a very cool broad!

            https://thoughtcatalog.com/jeremy-london/2019/0...

"Alice Roosevelt was known for antics like smoking on the White House roof, carrying a snake in her purse, and betting at horse races. Her parents swallowed their aggravation because the public clearly adored her." 
(http://drdeereallifesuperheroes.blogspot.com/)

That snake in her purse was her pet, named Emily Spinach, a fact that delighted us so much we knew we had to incorporate it somehow into our show. To round out our homage to Ms. Roosevelt, we have named Emily Spinach's co-host, Alice The Snake. The ol' swap-a-roo!

 https://thoughtcatalog.com/jeremy-london/2019/0...

"Sweet! But, can I just ask...why are you making this?"

We want to collaborate on something "big" by using our own skills and training 
to change the world. 

...and this world needs changing, baby!
Photo Cred: Alice The Snake (from her NASA days)

We also happen think that there is something missing from the overwhelming landscape of children's television, as two "grown-up kids" who were raised with programming like Mister Rogers. He imagined and then realized a space for children to understand the chaos of the outside world, all within the gentle confines of his neighborhood. The Emily Spinach Show will take that concept and run with it (literally, and all throughout New York City, I've heard! ) to create programming that is inclusive, fun, and creative for audiences in 2021 (and beyond!)

Mister Rogers, LeVar Burton, Bill Nye, Shari Lewis, and Jim Henson paved the way.
Will you help us add Emily Spinach to the list?

"Okay, I'm in, how can I help?"

We need to raise $30,000 during this 60 day campaign.

"Why 30k?"

$30,000 is the amount of money it'll cost to produce the pilot episode
of The Emily Spinach Show.

"What will my donation contribute to?"

2 - 3 Guest Contracts + Band
Lodging For Any Out-of-Town Talent
Full Crew Hires
Space Rental
Props/Costumes/Set
Food/Supplies
Merchandising
Legal Fees
 

"Are there perks if I donate? I love perks!"

YES! Our perks are designed by the amazing Kat Schober! 



You could put this tote right there on your floor @ home
(right next to your fav single sunflower & green shoes!!!)

 

"So, you raise the money, then what?"

Then, we film the pilot! And dance around! Wahoo!
We are aiming to shoot in Late summer/Fall 2021!

After we film the pilot, we'll put it in front of folks in the industry who could potentially give it a platform or a network!! Again, wahoo!

If no one is interested at that level, that's fine, because we're going to make it anyway! We'll release the pilot online and use ad revenue and merchandise sales to continue producing episodes, establishing our show as a web series. 

"What if...you DON'T raise the money?"

  Well, we'll probably dance less, but we're still going to do it anyway!

If we don't raise the full 30k, we'll use what we do raise and continue saving our own pennies until we have the $30,000 needed to produce a well-made pilot. 

Basically, we're going to make this happen no matter what!

But with your help, we can produce an amazing pilot that much sooner, employ more artists and writers, and really nurture an exciting future for The Emily Spinach Show. 

"I'm not able to donate money right now. How else can I help?"

Share!!! Share our campaign, share about us on social media, share with your friends and family and coworkers and vague acquaintances! We need to get the word out, and we need your help to do that! Tell your kids, tell your neighbor, tell your mom! 

FOLLOW US for more Emily Spinach content/updates & casting announcements! 

Instagram:  @emilyspinachshow

 

Meet The Folks Behind Our Promo!

We couldn't have even BEGUN this campaign without the help, focus, knowledge, and collaboration of these remarkable artists and creators: 

Joe Fusco, Director, Editor, Collaborator


"What a groovy guy!" - you, probably

"...Joe founded Fusco Productions to provide access to world-class marketing to brands of all sizes. In a few short years, Fusco Productions has generated millions of dollars in value for businesses across a range of verticals." 

For more info on our friend Joe and his talents, find him on Instagram @joefusco.nyc

& his fabulously talented crew members:
DOP: Sawyer Gaunt
Gaffer: Evan Wilkins 
Cam OP: David Kong
Sound: Francisco Latorre 

"

 

Brianna Chin, Hair & Makeup Artist



"Hi there! I'm Brianna, and I've had the pleasure of working with Emily and Rob on this incredible project. Though my main crafts include makeup and hair, my background is in costume design for theater- so I very much enjoy themes, characters, and storytelling! I live and work mainly in New York City and I'm always interested in taking on new projects and meeting new people! If you'd like to see more of my work or follow my adventures, my website is briannaashleychin.com and my Instagram is @makeupwithchinny."


Our crew was enthusiastic, creative, and FUN! We love them!!! 

Kat Schober, Graphic Designer


The genius behind our logos/merchandise!

"Kat Schober is a graphic designer and handletterer in Austin, TX who stares at colors and letters all day like a sesame street character, and will do just about anything if you buy her boba tea."

You can see her work on IG (@katchulaa) and katschober.com

 

Rob Tendy, Actor/Writer/Director/Producer/Editor 

Rob Tendy is an actor, teacher, and voiceover artist living in NYC with his cat and wife, listed in no particular order. He'll help bring our world to life by portraying all of the crew, characters, and cast of the Emily Spinach Show!

 IG: @therealrobtendy
roberttendy.com

 

Emily Fury Daly, Actor/Writer/Producer

Emily Fury Daly is an actor and writer living in NYC with her husband and cat, Hippo. By night, she may be Emily Spinach, but by day, she works in childcare! She loves coffee, Dolly Parton, and classifies "The Muppets Take Manhattan" as a cinematic masterpiece. 

 IG: @emilyfurydaly
emilyfurydaly.com 

 


"Founded in 2003, The Tank is a multi-disciplinary non-profit arts presenter and producer, which provides a home to emerging artists working across all disciplines, including theater, comedy, dance, film, music, puppetry, and storytelling." 
https://thetanknyc.org/

 Their 98 seat Theater proved to be the perfect backdrop for The Emily Spinach Show!

Thank you so much to Meghan Finn, Artistic Director & Danielle King, Managing Producer
and a special thank you to 
Rodrigo Fischer, Technical Manager

We're not done!!
"Merci Beaucoup!!" to these folks, too:

Alex Jenison, Promo Photographer 
IG: @alexjenison
Dmitriy Arbatov, Select Drone Footage
https://www.youtube.com/user/DmitriyArbatov
Mason Williams, Music 
"Classical Gas" -  The Mason Williams Phonograph Record
and, of course, 
Our families & friends for their love and support! 

 

 

***THE SET OF THE EMILY SPINACH SHOW PROMO COMPLIED WITH COVID-19 SAFETY REGULATIONS AND SOCIAL DISTANCING BY ENSURING SANITATION STATIONS WERE ON SET, ACTORS WERE VACCINATED, AND MASKS WERE ONLY REMOVED WHEN THE CAMERA WAS ROLLING. MEMBERS OF THE CREW WERE FULLY-MASKED, AND NEGATIVE RAPID TESTS WERE REQUIRED OF ALL INVOLVED BEFORE SHOOTING DAYS. WE TAKE OUR RESPONSIBILITY TO KEEP EVERYONE HEALTHY VERY SERIOUSLY. ANY FURTHER QUESTIONS CAN BE DIRECTED TO EITHER EMILY OR ROB.***

Our crew was enthusiastic, creative, and FUN! We love them!!! 

Kat Schober, Graphic Designer
The genius behind our logos/merchandise!"Kat Schober is a graphic designer and handletterer in Austin, TX who stares at colors and letters all day like a sesame street character, and will do just about anything if you buy her boba tea."
You can see her work on IG (@katchulaa) and katschober.com
 
Rob Tendy, Actor/Writer/Director/Producer/Editor 

Rob Tendy is an actor, teacher, and voiceover artist living in NYC with his cat and wife, listed in no particular order. He'll help bring our world to life by portraying all of the crew, characters, and cast of the Emily Spinach Show!
 IG: @therealrobtendyroberttendy.com
 
Emily Fury Daly, Actor/Writer/Producer

Emily Fury Daly is an actor and writer living in NYC with her husband and cat, Hippo. By night, she may be Emily Spinach, but by day, she works in childcare! She loves coffee, Dolly Parton, and classifies "The Muppets Take Manhattan" as a cinematic masterpiece.  IG: @emilyfurydalyemilyfurydaly.com 
 

"Founded in 2003, The Tank is a multi-disciplinary non-profit arts presenter and producer, which provides a home to emerging artists working across all disciplines, including theater, comedy, dance, film, music, puppetry, and storytelling." https://thetanknyc.org/
 Their 98 seat Theater proved to be the perfect backdrop for The Emily Spinach Show!
Thank you so much to Meghan Finn, Artistic Director & Danielle King, Managing Producerand a special thank you to Rodrigo Fischer, Technical Manager


We're not done!!"Merci Beaucoup!!" to these folks, too:

Alex Jenison, Promo Photographer IG: @alexjenisonDmitriy Arbatov, Select Drone Footagehttps://www.youtube.com/user/DmitriyArbatovMason Williams, Music "Classical Gas" -  The Mason Williams Phonograph Recordand, of course, Our families & friends for their love and support!  

 
***THE SET OF THE EMILY SPINACH SHOW PROMO COMPLIED WITH COVID-19 SAFETY REGULATIONS AND SOCIAL DISTANCING BY ENSURING SANITATION STATIONS WERE ON SET, ACTORS WERE VACCINATED, AND MASKS WERE ONLY REMOVED WHEN THE CAMERA WAS ROLLING. MEMBERS OF THE CREW WERE FULLY-MASKED, AND NEGATIVE RAPID TESTS WERE REQUIRED OF ALL INVOLVED BEFORE SHOOTING DAYS. WE TAKE OUR RESPONSIBILITY TO KEEP EVERYONE HEALTHY VERY SERIOUSLY. ANY FURTHER QUESTIONS CAN BE DIRECTED TO EITHER EMILY OR ROB.***

story:
Short Summary

SWEAT:  a serial comedy written by Robert Christophe and Kim Waldauer, the creators of the hit web series Cube News 1  and the Adventures of Cube Girl.

Welcome to the SWEAT Indiegogo campaign. This show is a passion project for us for two reasons: the first is that we have worked in the fitness business, been athletes, and presently own and operate a gym in Burbank CA.  It's a subject that we know inside and out because we've lived it. The second reason is that as artists we both feel a need to make people laugh right now and to create joy rather than fear. So we're going to tell a story about 5 very different people with different politics, values, and desires that are essentially in the SAME BOAT and have to find a way to keep their boat afloat.  That boat is a neighborhood gym on the brink of failure. The gyms' owner, Rose, is a personal trainer to a Hollywood star. He's on his fourth come back and needs rehab more than exercise.  Her Latin dance instructor is on the run from ICE and her father who runs a  Mexican Cartel. Her yoga instructor is an extreme right-wing yogi.  The gym's head weight trainer came to Los Angeles to be a rock star -- 40 years too late.  And finally, the guy she bought the gym from still hasn't left, but he is spending her money on his empty karate classes. Add a host of Los Angeles narcissists, steroid overdosing muscle-heads, and badass Zumba seniors and you get a hilarious story about a group of people who work really hard to almost make their dreams come true.  Our goal for the first season is to raise $50,000.  Reaching this goal will allow us to shoot eight 10-minute episodes and introduce a cast of incredibly funny actors to the world.  Please support us by choosing a perk and following our show. 

IF WE DON"T REACH OUR GOAL?

The short answer is we'll keep going until we do, or we shoot with whatever we raise, but we are making this series because we believe it's truly a great show.

Our motto is:  Invenimus viam aut faciemus (We will either find a way or make one.)

When we reach our goal the money will go mostly to production costs:
Camera Equipment, production sound, props, art, lights and paying actors a stipend.

We've projected a budget of $5000 per episode,

We'll hold $5000 for post services (paying the editors)  and $5000 for marketing (paying the webmaster) which will largely be carried out through social media.                                                          

Here are some other ways you can show your support:

  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word --
  • Like us on Facebook.
  • Ask 10 friends to like us on Facebook.
  • Follow us on Instagram.
  • Ask 10 friends to follow us on Instagram.
  • Write to us, if you have a funny gym story (it may wind up in a storyline).
  • If you like what we're creating tell us! We love approval :)
  • WATCH OUR SHOW!
  • Really? Don't you have $50 bucks to spare? Then how about $5000? It's cool...it's cool. 

And that's all there is to it.

story:
**Update: This campaign has been cancelled due to COVID-19 pandemic. We will postpone this initative until a lter time. All early supporters will still recieve their perks, 

Help us create the #VngleRV!

Hi, I'm Blake Stoner and I'm the founder of Vngle.

You can learn more about me here.

Vngle is a grassroots news media organization focused on sharing "various angles" of on-the-ground coverage on communities across America. 

This is not a Political Action Committee.

I'm crowdfunding to expand Vngle's founding series called "Where We Are Now", by renovating an RV into a mobile production office to continue covering America from coast to coast. 

"Where We Are Now" is a cross-country online series all about understanding how far America has come and how the nation's culture has changed. We are reflecting America through cross-cultural perspectives from people across every region of the United States. So far, we've covered 20 cities and our focus for 2020 is covering America's swing states before the November elections.

**Contributors to this campaign are playing a critical role in helping to establish a movement to bring needed attention to communities across America's swing states and spotlight marginalized voices in the USA before votes are casts in November. 

 

Our Goal

We're trying to bring America together. We're doing so by making America more transparent for everyone. Our "Where We Are Now" work is focused on bringing the under-addressed and hyper-local needs people have to the American masses. We seek to bring people out of silos to better understand the realities other Americans are facing across the country.

Since 2020 is a huge year that will help decide the future of the United States, we are making it our goal to engage the nation around the needs, issues, and concerns people are facing in the nation's most critical areas this year, America's swing states. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

To cover the swing states and better support an agile team, I am raising $23,000 to renovate an RV into Vngle's mobile production office (including in-vehicle studio, office, living / sleeping quarters, tech-journalism lab, along with work on the vehicle).

For supporting Vngle with the expansion of our "Where We Are Now" series, contributors will get everything from swag, 2020 memorabilia, behind the scenes footage, in-person experiences with the RV, and early access to our grassroots news platform. 

Also, top backers will get a credit in the full-length "Where We Are Now" in America documentary at the end of the journey. 

 

 

The Impact: What to Expect

The truth is many parts of America go underrepresented and because of this, much of the public goes without a fully comprehensive understanding of what all is happening across America. Given this is an election year, it is imperative to help Americans get on the same page and understand the pressing concerns people face in different areas of America. 

We're focusing on the swing states to give America insight into what has and hasn't changed in the key states in America. 

Our Where We Are Now swing state coverage will focus on 3 areas:

- Understanding the cross-cultural overview of issues facing the state.

- Insight into what has changed over the last over the years from different perspectives across the state. 

- Giving a general direction of consensus on how people want to move forward (in regards to in their state vs in regards to in America). 

 

Overall, through the "Where We Are Now" series, we want to help end an era of divisiveness in America. To do so, we're making communities across America transparent, to allow the public to understand the common themes of concerns and not so well know experiences different parts of America are facing.

 

Transparency & Contingencies

I am renovating a 1989 Fleetwood Pace Arrow RV that has been idle for 15+ years. 

In the case that I face unexpected challenges with the RV, I will use the funds raised to buy a comparable vehicle. Also, in the case that unforeseen circumstance raises the cost of parts or needed work, I will sell my 1991 Ford F-150 to cover the costs (I originally sold my Jeep to get the RV in late 2018). 

If for some reason I do not meet my campaign goal, I will be using the funds raised to get started on the RV and use the proven demand from the crowdfund results to apply for grants to show that people want to see this happen.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Please share on social media and help spread the word with friends and family!

2. *Do you live in a swing state? Interested in getting involved? We would love to hear your advice on creating our national coverage strategy.  Please send us a note at tips@vngle.com

or fill out this form.

3. As of now, I am 100% all-in on this work. I am also accepting personal donations to help support myself as I travel and continue promoting this work. (My Cash app is $BlakeStoner and my Venmo is  @BlakeStoner).

story:
Summary

 It is an anti-hero TV show. This means throughout the show you are going to be rooting for a bad guy. The story is about a 16-year-old living alone in a van. his life changes when he helps a Russian out of a tight situation in an alleyway.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Being only Student, we do not have much money in our pockets. Even if you just donate a dollar, you can help us so much. we need money to help pay for, food on set, gear, software, etc.

The Impact

TV series will be a huge help to us. because we are very young, this film will help us later in life because we can put this in our portfolio. it also helps us learn from the experience.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Being young, we don't have as much knowledge as people that have been making films longer than us. We would love to listen to advise you may have for us.

story:
Q U E E R I N G is a story told with a full female cast. The creator, Leticia De Bortoli, is a queer Brazilian filmmaker trying to boost the number of queer female characters in quality content out there.

We were able to pull off shooting season one in four days because of our talented and dedicated cast and crew. That same A team is coming back for Season 2!

Meet our team:

Sophia Grasso (Harper) 

Susan Gallagher (Val) 

Diana Oh (Devon)

Ana Stan(Brit)

Emelie Pla (Wica)

Eileen Weisinger(Carol)

Molly McCluskey(Mickie) 

Director of Photography: Tulio Ferreira 

Line Producer/ Production Designer: Angelica Abe

Costume Designer: Carol DeeLay 

Make up Artist: Bianca Duarte

1AC: Andy Pulido

2AC: Ryan Welch

Sound Mixer: Maaike Snoep

Editor: Leticia De Bortoli

Colorist: Tulio Ferreira

BTS: Lee Landell

Casting Director/ Co-Writer: Caitlin Graham 

Sound Designer: Roni Pillischer

Original Music: Nacho Gonzalez 

Title Animation: Matthew Watkins 

 

 

We will continue working at the speed of light for Season 2. If we reach our goal, we plan to premiere Season 2 in November of 2018, and film at least 8 episodes with more of Harper, Val and Devon. (Plus new characters!)

 

 

If you related with Q U E E R I N G, had a good time watching, or were able to see more of yourself represented in some way with Season 1, consider supporting us with Season 2!  We can't make this happen without your support: "The ball is in your court."

 

How are we using the money?

We want to keep the production value and quality you loved on season 1

 

 

Message us if you have any questions!
