story:
HistoryHit.TV is a new kind of global history channel

Hello! My name is Dan Snow and I'm one of the Founders of HistoryHit.

History is my life. I’ve been lucky enough to make TV history documentaries for the past 15 years and my shows have been watched 100s of millions of times across the world on channels such as the BBC, PBS, History Channel, Discovery and National Geographic. Together with the HistoryHit team I also started the HistoryHit Podcast which is a ‘Best of iTunes 2015 & 2016 award winning History show that's downloaded 1 million times a month.

We'd love to invite you to become a Founder Member of HistoryHit.TV and play an important role in our mission to preserve the future of great history storytelling.


Pictured with Sir David Attenborough and Michael Palin CBE

Pledge to get early access, great perks and discounted subscriptions!

 

Intelligent Documentaries for Intelligent Viewers Around The World

Traditional broadcast TV, by the nature of its broad audience, has a challenge when it comes to making intelligent documentaries for people with a passion for history. The need for these channels to make films for a wide audience who often have little background knowledge of historical events results in documentaries that can often appear dumbed down to those with a deeper interest in history. As a channel dedicated to high quality, intelligent programming, we will deliver a level of documentary better suited to our audience - and without the need to chase ratings.

 

Distinctive, Deeper and Definitive

 

As a video-on-demand service we won’t be restrained by schedules and programme lengths that traditional TV has to conform to.  This means we can approach history subjects in new and exciting ways.

We want to take topics and themes and cover them in richer and more comprehensive detail than any TV channel has ever done before.  

We’ll be able to show films of varying lengths featuring in-depth interviews with world experts and historical communicators, as well as giving behind the scenes access to incredible locations, historical events and festivals, alongside traditional 60-minute documentaries. 

This will allow us to offer a far greater level of historical knowledge on screen than has been available on TV up to now - helping us achieve our goal of becoming the ultimate documentary resource for historical content.

 

Great Documentaries and Fantastic Original Seasons

HistoryHit will have both new and original documentaries as well as great documentaries from recent years that are no longer available to see.

We’ll be carefully curating these in a number of different ways: 

  • by asking our Founder Members about the subjects they’d like featured on HistoryHit;
  • by putting the HistoryHit team’s favourite documentaries and subjects on HistoryHit;
  • and finally, by asking our favourite historians to choose films they’d like to share with you.

Alongside and accompanying the licensed documentaries and new programmes, there will be a range of additional films that allow us to expand beyond the traditional 60-minute documentary 

We will be using the funds you pledge to make sure that we have the best possible history films for you to see – and by pledging and becoming a Founder Member, you’ll have a direct influence on the documentaries on the channel.

 

A Channel That Listens to its Members

Mainstream broadcasters operate a commissioning system where one or two people decide what they think you want to watch. We think this is old fashioned and ripe for disruption. One of our core pledges is that we will work with you, our Founder Members, to find out which periods/themes of history you’d like us to cover, and the types of documentaries that you’d like to see. We promise to talk with you and listen to what you are interested in.

With the help of you, the future HistoryHit founder members, we will be able to produce, commission and licence the highest quality history content possible and provide the fascinating, intelligent history content that we know you all love and want to see.

 

Here's what the Press say about us

 

Mobile Friendly & Responsive

We are building HistoryHit to work on any platform: from your Desktop, iPhone, iPad or Android device. HistoryHit will launch as a fully responsive web app so it will work just about anywhere.

 

Meet Ups and Events

We are going to produce a series of Exclusive Live Events throughout the year. We hope to see you at as many of them as possible. If you can't make it to these events, many of them will be available to view on the channel. Our first event around the launch of the channel is HistoryHit Live! on October 18th at London's Bush Hall where we'll be raising money for Age Unlimited, a charity that helps young people with literacy.

 

What Have We Done So Far? 

We’ve spent the last 12 months preparing the groundwork for the launch of HistoryHit.TV. Firstly, we've met up with the major providers of video-on-demand technology to ensure that we have a robust video platform for our channel. Secondly, we've met the major distributors of global history programming to do deals on their catalogues. Thirdly, we're in advanced talks with a range of brilliant producers and talent to discuss commissioning new seasons and new shows.

 

Why We Need Your Help With Funding

The more funds we get, the more great documentaries we’ll be able to licence, commission and produce.  If we don’t reach our goal, we’ll still be launching the channel, but we'll have less budget for films at launch. We'll still get to the same place, but it will just take us a bit longer to get there.

Development Timeline for HistoryHit

We'll have a special beta version of HistoryHit.TV for Founder Members to use in October 2017. We'll get feedback from you and implement changes and suggestions and follow up with a full public release in November 2017. All backers will get early access ahead of a public release.

 

 

Rewards & Perks for Your Support

 

In return for your support we’ve put together some great rewards and perks, including huge discounts, lifetime membership options, and history related swag.

 

Meet The Team

Our team is based in the United Kingdom and has over a century of experience in digital, production and broadcasting.

We've also got a fantastic team of talented programme-makers, writers, producers, event organisers and researchers working on the channel. We’re all totally in love with history, and want to create the world’s best history channel for everyone around the world who shares our passion. 

 

Our Risks And Challenges

Launching a channel and producing and licensing content is an expensive business – but you’ll be glad to know that a lot of the heavy lifting has already been completed.  The HistoryHit team is uniquely experienced to be able to successfully deliver great history content – as well as all of the other technical and creative aspects of this project.  We’re going to make the funds we receive stretch as far as possible to launch with the best documentaries we can.

 

Other than contributing, how can I help?

Whether or not you’re in a position to make a financial pledge at the moment, we’d still really value your help in getting the message out about the channel, and this crowdfunding campaign.  You can do this by sharing this page via social media, or mentioning HistoryHit to friends who you know are interested in history.

Thank you so much for taking the time to read this. We all really appreciate it.

 

FAQ

How much will it cost?
The channel is projected to cost £5.99-a-month in the UK (US$6.99 in the USA/Rest of the World).

I have questions, how can I reach your team?
For questions related to the Indiegogo campaign, feel free to email us at indiegogo@historyhit.com. Otherwise, you can always reach us at gazette@historyhit.com.

Will you carry advertising on the channel?
No. We think that if you are paying for a subscription, you shouldn’t get ads.

Will You tell stories from around the world?
Absolutely yes. We want this to be a truly global history channel that’s interested in history in every country in the world. You will be able to get HistoryHit.TV on any device anywhere on the planet!

Will the channel be available globally?
Yes, the channel will be available to access from anywhere in the world.

Will your podcast network remain free?
We will continue to give away our new podcasts for free, however we may make some of the older shows exclusive to our HistoryHit subscribers.

What happens if you don't reach your target?

We will still launch the channel but with a reduced number of documentaries.

Can I get a refund if I change my mind?

Yes of course. You can get a refund at any time during the campaign. You can initiate the refund directly from your confirmation email or Indiegogo account. We are unable to issue refunds after the campaign has ended.

CAMPAIGN UPDATE

We made it to our main goal, and filming has begun on The Last Airship Series One! However as we have expanded the script and during filming to improve the series, we are keeping the crowdfunding open for new backers to come onboard and help improve the post-production and promotion side of things, to make the series the best it can possibly be, and to allow us to get the series seen by as many people as possible.

Any additional equipment will not go to waste - the main cast and crew are already in discussions for a second series to be shot in 2018...

 

 

Getting Airborne 

 

Welcome to 'The Last Airship', a Steampunk comedy-adventure webseries following Captain Morstan and his crew, Lupo and Volpa, as they attempt to prove that airships can compete with high powered steamships when crossing the Atlantic, in an attempt to keep the age of dirigible travel alive! Along the way they face difficulties - often self inflicted owing to a combination of clumsiness and bickering, but the result is always exciting and fun to watch!

That is the goal! That is the short webseries which we will be releasing in the Autumn of 2017, but we need help to get the production levels way up into the air! 

We already have the script, written by myself, Greg Chapman, a professional comedy performer, writer and videomaker, and I'll be directing, doing the majority of the edit and effects, and also playing the role of Lupo.

I'm joined by Patrick Barry and Felicity Hawthorn, who have agreed to give up their time to co-star in this project, and we are honoured that the fabulous Steampunk band 'Kiss Like Ether' have allowed us to use their song, 'Flight to Fall' as our title track. Even more amazing for me, as it was this song that originally inspired the writing of this series. I have also had a number of other people from the Steampunk community volunteer to fill some of the vital guest-star roles!

So we have a lot of what we need to make the series, and I am going to put all the time in to make sure that we have a fabulous series at the end of the project. However, we really need to improve some of our equipment to really get the best results from the talent who have offered their time to us!

 

What We Need & What You Get

The money from our initial goal will be going into three main places, camera, greenscreen and studio space. While I have certain equipment which I have used to film my Condensed Histories Webseries over a number of years, this equipment is getting old, and lacks the image quality and definition which I see needed for a webseries of this nature. With a lot of editing and effects work needed, we need a better quality of camcorder and a larger greenscreen, as well as hiring a space to set these up in.

While £1050 may sound a lot, this is nothing in the world of budgets for a series, but we are going to be shooting inexpensively while keeping the production values as high as possible, which is why currently the plan is to shoot almost entirely on greenscreen with a combination of miniature and CGI sets, and a few location shoots.

If we exceed this initial target, the next step will be to start looking at building physical sets for some of the main locations, such as the interiors of the Airship, which would be our ultimate goal - if not for the first six-part series, then for other series down the line!

We decided to crowdfund so that we can create the best quality series, but still release it for free at the end of the process. Also we wanted to be sure our crowdfunders get to be a part of the creative process - not just through updates and videos on here, but also by offering at almost every level of 'Perk' the chance for you to appear within the series in some form or another. A lot of projects like this just allow for names to be listed in the credits - but we'd want our supporters to actually have the chance to spot their faces within the final series!

 

If we exceed our goals, if we hit £1500 we can vastly improve the sound recording of the series, and if we reach £2000 that would allow us to build physical sets for some of the main locations in the series!

Following the shoot, any equipment or sets will be used to help on other video projects including the Condensed Histories Webseries, as well as being used to hopefully create a second series of 'The Last Airship'!

 

Help Us Fly!

We will be making this series, and we really want it to stand up as a great, fun series to watch, but also as an option to point to when people ask the ever present question 'What is Steampunk?'. 

Once the series is out I will be pushing and promoting it as much as possible, to really let as many people as possible around the world get a chance to see it - and so I want to have made the best possible series to showcase a genre and style that I am particularly fond of - and in particular pushing how much fun it can be, and how inclusive!

Risks & Challenges

Making a webseries is hard work, and will take time. My biggest risk is a delay in this series coming out - if we don't get all of the funding then I will be spending a lot longer in the edit to get the best out of the footage we have.

However, this series will get made! I have a fabulous team behind me, and I am used to producing shows and videos on a deadline, and a budget! I have a strong cast, fine music, and the time and ability we need, so even if we miss our goal, you will still see the finished series by the end of 2017!

Of course, with luck we will exceed our goals, and the webseries will be better than any of us dare hope!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like the sound of our series, but can't afford to help us out right now, then don't worry - there is still something you can do!

TELL EVERYONE! Whether that be your friends, your fans on social media, or random strangers on the street, just help us get the word out about our project!

story:
Concept:

The Thespians is a dark comedy about four dysfunctional actor friends who attempt to climb their way to stardom despite their various social and mental disorders which cause them to perpetually fail, and ruin the lives of those around them.


Similar Shows:

_ Parks and Rec

_ It’s Always Sunny In Philadelphia

_ Curb Your Enthusiasm

 


“What makes earth hell is the expectation that it should be like heaven”

-Chuck Palahniuk

 

Your contribution goes towards:

Lighting

Audio

Sets/Locations

Prosthetics/Makeup/Blood/Gore/All That Fun Stuff

Crew- we are looking at a 10-15 person crew per episode and all of them need to eat and pay their rent.

Philosophy:

The Thespians is first and foremost a dark cringe comedy but also aims to talk about how people attempt relate to one another amidst their own personal desires and finding the comedy in the absurdity of our own social interactions. It is also an opportunity for the audience to make an intimate, self aware examination of how intelligent animals deal with suffering and failure, all the while laughing at these characters in light of ourselves and our own demands and expectations.

We have written the first season, we just need funding to produce the rest of the season!

story:
THE CAMPAIGN

MINTY FRESH PRODUCTIONS is a team of media production students who aim to make comedic content. You could say it's their hobby. As for Carter and Taylor, they don't get out much aside from the occasional bar, and as far as hobbies go... well... They don't have any. Lucky for you they're about to change that!

Using what they've learned from their media degrees, Carter and Taylor are now going to blow their comfort zones into tiny little pieces...and then blow those pieces into even tinier pieces, and then put it on the INTERNET!! Why? For your entertainment!

Welcome to the art of Extreme Hobbying!

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

Despite the hard work, blood, sweat and tears that we’ve put into this project, we're still students, and being a student means being broke, hungry,...and sad. We want this project to be good, and being good means finding the most interesting, comical, and best quality ways to make Taylor and Carter’s hobby-fuelled journey more enticing. But we truly CANNOT do this without your help.

You may ask: But how can I help? What should I donate? Why should I care about this? Who am I?

These are all valid questions, but really anything counts! If you have five, ten, twenty, one hundred dollars - anything you can spare will go a long way in helping Hobbyists reach it’s full potential. In return, you will be compensated with an eternal, unconditional appreciation from our team, and perhaps maybe something a bit more tangible. So check out the perks section to see what you may get your hands on if you DONATE!

And hey, thank you!

THE SHOW

The hosts will be followed by a camera crew as they seek out GTA residents with unusual, interesting, or adrenaline-fuelled hobbies with the promise to attempt them. Carter and Taylor will provide the entertaining and contrasting personalities that will bring the show to its comedic potential. We want to inspire viewers to break out of their own strict routines and live life to the fullest - while reminding them that it’s okay to look foolish while doing so.

Each episode of Hobbyists will be relatively standalone and centred on a single hobby, consisting of three segments: The Interview, The Prep, and The Attempt . While this is an exciting adventure and opportunity for growth between friends, there is also an element of competition that must be exploited. 

Will Carter's physical strength intimidate Taylor? Will Taylor's cunningness dupe Carter into failure?

Will Carter's neuroticism get in the way of his ability to perform? Will Taylor's vanity distract him from his goal? 

Will Carter forget to wear pants? Will Taylor wet himself?

Only time will tell... But the equally mischievous crew is there to catch every sweet, scary, gross and crazy moment that goes down. 

This is reality folks, and anything is possible on HOBBYISTS!

THE TEAM

We're small, but we're mighty!

Carter Pinkowski - Host  /  Project Manager  

Taylor Patterson - Host  /  Marketing Lead

Ben Ball - Director

Cara Pomanti - Producer

Sonya Proehl - Creative  Lead

Aaron De La Cruz - Director of Photography

*Good-looking Asian Boy who always has a vape in hand*
(Aaron hates photos, but you get the gist)

Harry Whitaker - Assistant Director of Photography


RISKS & CHALLENGES

Did your mom ever plan a super fun birthday party for you and your friends that involved surprises and games and entertainment galore? That's kind of what we're doing - but for every episode shoot. On top of that is the actual filming so that everyone else can enjoy it, not just us!

As you can imagine, that's a lot of activities, locations, transportation, and equipment that we have to organize and pay for. We're very crafty, and can stretch a dollar, but after flipping our couch cushions, dumping our wallets, and diving into public fountains - we still need FUNDS!!!

story:
WHAT THE PILOT IS ABOUT

Being immortal isn't easy, especially with a family like this one. Meet the Olympians, all-powerful gods from Greek mythology with all the problems of a modern family. 

What We Need & What You Get

Let's break it down!

  • We need $2500 to help animate a short clip from the unaired pilot. Animation is very expensive and it costs a whole lot more to animate the entire thing. A five minute clip is enough time to help show the clip to pitch meetings!
  • Every time we reach a goal, we'll release different exciting things, like concept art, sketches, and soon an audio drama since we can't animate the entire project. 
  • If we don't meet our goal, the money can still help aid any Kinda Awesome Productions project or film for the future.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help at all, that's fine! Spread the word and use IndieGogo's share tools to share the fundraiser! We need your help in any way possible!

story:
People are quarantined, families are split up, and economies begin to crash as a seemingly incurable virus spreads across the globe. In a desperate attempt to save the human race, NASA sends a team of 8 astronauts on a mission to set up a moon base, in order to allow the transportation of virus-free people off the planet.

On the spaceship Persephone, Nate Thompson serves as a biology mission specialist alongside seven other crew members: Commander Laura Lancast, Pilot Stewart Pierce, Communications Officer/Technician Zachary Prenner, Medic Liz Caplan, Engineer Jade Cunningham, Chemist Derek Cunningham, and Architect Emma Meyers. The series follows Nate and his wife, Adina, on diverging plot lines of survival and the struggles of the human condition. To save the human race, their mission to set up a moon base is thrown drastically off course due to a serious engine malfunction.

Will the virus be cured?

Will the astronauts find a way to get home?

Will we be able to survive this mass extinction?

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt7904868/reference

This is a large-scale science fiction show that we have already begun pitching to production companies, but we need your help! The team is putting together a pitch binder that will include the scripts of all ten episodes of the first season, along with concept art, breakdowns and all other pre-production necessities. The final pieces to the puzzle are the teaser trailer, opening title sequence, and first three scenes of the pilot episode, all of which will be filmed in February 2018. This is where you come in. 

We are looking to raise $12,000 to fund the three proof-of-concept videos listed above. The budget is broken down as follows:

 

This show revolves around two characters, Nate and Adina, who want nothing more than to be together. Even though it's large in scope with sixteen primary characters in the first season, it heavily centers around them and their struggles. 

Because it's based a few years in the future, this show incorporates a lot of science. The science-fiction aspect is balanced out by the more realistic portrayal of using the scientific method to find answers, discussing scientific facts, and other facets of their world and ship. Everything that can be based on real science is heavily researched so we can be as accurate as possible.

We have already spent several months working on pre-production, with just over a month to go. The set builds and overall production design requires a lot of work and the production schedule is tight, at just six days of principal photography. The biggest challenge right now is allocating the budget and building an audience. With several UCF professors supporting and guiding us, we feel confident that we can pull it off.

Check out this article written about us! 

and so many more!

  1. Donate to our campaign and get some sweet perks. 

Help us bring the season straight to you!

   2. Share the campaign with your family and friends. 

Help us spread the word so we can get this show off the ground! (launch pun intended)

   3. Follow the show on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.

Connect with us, we wanna hear from you!

Thank you so much for your support and don't forget to check out our website www.contingencyplanshow.com

-The Contingency Plan Team

story:
Meet the Co-Creators of Apartment 101

Heather Elaine Abbott  graduated from Stephen F. Austin State University with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Theatre Performance. Before her college experience, she studied film all four years of high school. She is a Kamp Hollywood alum and working on Apartment 101 has reignited her love for filmmaking. Heather is also active in the Chicago comedy community. 

Breanna Benedict  graduated from Columbia College Chicago with a Bachelor of Arts in Acting. Growing up, she was always performing on the stage. Then in college, she caught the screen acting bug. While working on Apartment 101, Breanna developed a passion for directing. She cannot get enough of the camera, whether she is in front of it or behind.

 

Apartment 101 started out as an inside joke. Then, Heather and Breanna took that joke and made it a reality. One year later, they are embarking on a whole new journey - creating and producing a second season. Like all sequels, they are determined to outdo the original. That means more characters, more locations, more costumes, more props, and more MORE. To bring all that more to you, Heather and Breanna need, you guessed it, MORE money!

 

Our goal is to raise $5,000. This will allow us to pay for venue rentals, costumes, props, music, and food for our actors while still being able to make rent. 

 

If you donate, here are the special perks:

$10- You get a handwritten thank you card from the creators of the show. Oh my! 

$25- You get that handwritten thank you and an official Apartment 101 button. A BUTTON. You can slap that right on your hip jean jacket.

$50- You get that personalized handwritten thank you, a hip, cool, groovy button, AND access to Genevieve's Guru Guide video where she imparts all of her sage wisdom. 

$75- Here we go. You get that handwritten thank you, snazzy button, Genevieve's Guru Guide video, and exclusive access to a special episode of Margo's Morgue, the hottest, new True Crime podcast.

$150- You know the drill. Handwritten thank you, one of a kind button, Genevieve's Guru Guide video, Margo's podcast, BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE! Ever wanted a character named after you? Well you're in luck! One character with your name and a very special thanks in every episode.  

$250- And now for the biggie. Not only will you get that handwritten thank you, a button, Genevieve's Guru Guide, Margo's Morgue Podcast, that character named after none other than you, that special thanks, BUT ALSO an Associate Producer Credit. That's right! You'll officially be in show business, baby. That's some serious bragging rights.

 

After you donate, tag us on social media to spread the word! 

Give us a follow to stay up to date with behind the scenes extras and links to the show when it airs.

Twitter: @apt101show

Instagram: @apartment101show

Facebook: www.facebook.com/ProfessionalFromHereUp

 

Check out the official Apartment 101 website at www.apartment101show.com and catch up on the first season!
story_txt: Meet the Co-Creators of Apartment 101Heather Elaine Abbott  graduated from Stephen F. Austin State University with a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Theatre Performance. Before her college experience, she studied film all four years of high school. She is a Kamp Hollywood alum and working on Apartment 101 has reignited her love for filmmaking. Heather is also active in the Chicago comedy community. Breanna Benedict  graduated from Columbia College Chicago with a Bachelor of Arts in Acting. Growing up, she was always performing on the stage. Then in college, she caught the screen acting bug. While working on Apartment 101, Breanna developed a passion for directing. She cannot get enough of the camera, whether she is in front of it or behind. Apartment 101 started out as an inside joke. Then, Heather and Breanna took that joke and made it a reality. One year later, they are embarking on a whole new journey - creating and producing a second season. Like all sequels, they are determined to outdo the original. That means more characters, more locations, more costumes, more props, and more MORE. To bring all that more to you, Heather and Breanna need, you guessed it, MORE money! Our goal is to raise $5,000. This will allow us to pay for venue rentals, costumes, props, music, and food for our actors while still being able to make rent.  If you donate, here are the special perks:$10- You get a handwritten thank you card from the creators of the show. Oh my! $25- You get that handwritten thank you and an official Apartment 101 button. A BUTTON. You can slap that right on your hip jean jacket.$50- You get that personalized handwritten thank you, a hip, cool, groovy button, AND access to Genevieve's Guru Guide video where she imparts all of her sage wisdom. $75- Here we go. You get that handwritten thank you, snazzy button, Genevieve's Guru Guide video, and exclusive access to a special episode of Margo's Morgue, the hottest, new True Crime podcast.$150- You know the drill. Handwritten thank you, one of a kind button, Genevieve's Guru Guide video, Margo's podcast, BUT WAIT, THERE'S MORE! Ever wanted a character named after you? Well you're in luck! One character with your name and a very special thanks in every episode.  $250- And now for the biggie. Not only will you get that handwritten thank you, a button, Genevieve's Guru Guide, Margo's Morgue Podcast, that character named after none other than you, that special thanks, BUT ALSO an Associate Producer Credit. That's right! You'll officially be in show business, baby. That's some serious bragging rights. After you donate, tag us on social media to spread the word! Give us a follow to stay up to date with behind the scenes extras and links to the show when it airs.Twitter: @apt101showInstagram: @apartment101showFacebook: www.facebook.com/ProfessionalFromHereUp Check out the official Apartment 101 website at www.apartment101show.com and catch up on the first season!

story:
Sexy. Sunny. Shitty.

Los Angeles has established itself as a mecca for dream-seekers. That's where fame and fortune are to be made, right? The Statue of Liberty is on the wrong coast, right?

For some, maybe. Not if you're one of the millions whose experience has been a little more Blade Runner than La La Land. Not if you've felt like a small, pale guppy in a sea of tanned barracudas. And certainly not if you've sat in @#$%ing hours of traffic for that lame, blink-and-you-miss-it audition.

WE FEEL YOU.

I Hate LA is about trying to make a life when it feels like life isn't loving you back. It is for every dreamer dealing with reality: every aspiring artist with a day job, every bad flirt looking for romance, and of course, everyone who's ever had a shitty roommate. 

But most of all, it's about making those dreams happen in the end - one way or another.

The Creators

Angie Campbell is an actress, writer, and Diet Coke connoisseur currently residing in the "Hollywood" of the Midwest--Milwaukee, Wisconsin. She tried living in California 3 different times and failed miserably, the third time most notably. The three weeks (yes, you read that correctly) she resided there the third time inspired her to do what all great writers do: turn her pain into entertainment for the rest of the world. Thus, I Hate LA was born. 

Emma Baker is an actress, writer, and pogo stick aficionado living in the Midwest's glitziest and windiest city. She likes to think she's killing it at life far more often than she really does, and dreams of owning a pet hedgehog named Fernando. She's been to LA once, but went rogue at Warner Brothers Studios and sat in a lot of traffic, so she feels like she gets the idea.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are hoping to raise $8,000. What does this pay for, you ask? Equipment, crew, and post-production! It took 27 hours to shoot the first episode - and that doesn't include pre- or post-production! So far, our cast and crew have kindly donated that time, but they are incredibly skilled people who could be commanding a day rate for their work. We want to at least offer them a stipend for their services! We also borrowed several thousand dollars' worth of equipment to film - likewise, we would like to give our generous lenders something in return.
  • Also, people on film sets eat a lot. 
  • Let us reward your generosity! Check out some of our perks on offer. What do you hate most about L.A?

The Impact

We're going to honest with you: we're not saving lives here. (This is not the some genius sleep apnea treatment, or the RompHim.) But here's what we're about:

  • Female filmmakers. Our director, writers, producers, and editor are all ladies. Can we get a hell yeah for tipping the ratio in the film industry?
  • The struggle. L.A. is known for chewing people up and spitting them out, but navigating life is rough no matter where you live. This show celebrates the fortitude of dreamers: those who get up every day and need the encouragement to go on just one more audition, write one more song, run one more mile, go on one more interview, make one more student loan payment. (Just kidding. We'll all be making student loan payments forever.)
  • The laughter. Everything right now seems so damn dire. (And, in many ways, it is.) But being an activist/anarchist/revolutionary is exhausting, and so is watching murder after murder on Law and Order. So we humbly present you with a restorative: delightful awkwardness. (Not British-level, but, like, pretty up there.)

In short, we want to have a good time, tell weird, funny stories, and make you feel better about how badly your last date went. And also world peace.

Risks & Challenges

There are a lot of voices struggling to be heard. (We mean artistically and people who just want to bitch in general.) Given all the contenders, it's understandable that not everyone gets to rise above the crowd, and of course, that may be the case here. But (but, we say!), the next Broad City/Eragon/Tommy Wiseau has to come from somewhere, and we sure as hell can't see why it shouldn't be us. (Our parents taught us that if you believe, you can do anything, and it almost worked that time we tried to fly from jumping off the roof, so we're going off precedent here.)

Other Ways You Can Help

We would appreciate any and all help we can get - and not just financially-speaking! If you're willing, please share/follow on Facebook, Twitter (@ihatela_show), Intstagram (@i_hate_la_show), your Tumblr, MySpace, etc. 

 

*Disclaimer: This series is *mainly* about the weird trials and tribulations of life, not a total "Dear-Darla-I-hate-your-stinkin'-guts" note to Los Angeles. To all our West Coast friends, we love you! And we totally had a blast that time we visited and you kindly took us to Runyon Canyon and Grauman's Chinese Theater and that awesome brunch place.

story:
KATHY GARVER IS BACK and better than ever!

Kathy Garver, who played the iconic role of "Cissy" on one of the most popular TV sitcoms of all time, "Family Affair" is back!  Yes she is, but now she's back as Cissy Travis in "Aunt Cissy"

Join us for the new adventures of "Cissy"

"Cissy" hit the big time as a teenager in New York City, becoming one of the top models and actresses of her generation. Now she lives in Los Angeles, and is about to retire from show biz in order to live a new, adventurous life roaming the world with her fiance, hot shot film producer, Robert, when who should show up on her doorstep but her twin niece and nephew, needing a place to stay! Will she leave town and lead a life of adventure, or will she give up her plans and stay with her family?

Also starring Emmy Award winner Patrika Darbo (Days of Our Lives & The Bay) and Renee Lawless (Tyler Perry’s “The Have and The Have Not’s”)  as Cissy's two best-friends, Danny Arroyo (Sangre Negra) as her hot Latin housekeeper and Miles Tagtmeyer (Broken) & brilliant newcomer, Madison Young  as Cissy's niece and nephew.  

Created and Produced by Scott Travis, Directed by Emmy Nominated Billy Clift (A Long Road to Freedom) and Written by Michael Vaccaro (Child of the '70s).

We have a great cast, a great script, a great crew and now all we need is you. With your help funding the project, we can bring "Aunt Cissy" to the world.  The exceptional cast are chomping at the bit to start production. And to top it off, we have some great perks on our campaign that are sure to entice you.

story:
The Story

Black Girl Single is the story of thirty something Adrienne Walters. She has a great life, but the one thing she dreams of eludes her-- a healthy and lasting relationship. Adrienne keeps meeting the wrong men. At thirty-two most of her friends are married and as the lone single she's wondering where she went wrong. 

Adrienne's story isn't new--finding love is never easy. But dating in a town where women outnumber the men, guys date the way people channel surf, and a woman's value is found not only in her good looks, but in where she works and went to school, the competition is fierce. And in the age of online dating and social media, Adrienne is seeing firsthand how frustrating dating can be when you're searching for "the one". As Adrienne embarks on a series of crazy dates and comical disappointments, she begins to consider that her prayers will continue to go unanswered and she begins to question God and whether he has a plan for her life. Feeling like she's reached wits end,  Adrienne makes a decision, one that could make or break her chances of ever finding love. 

Black Girl Single will definitely make you laugh out loud and remember your own dating experiences, but it also works to build a larger conversation about holding on to your faith when life doesn't go as planned. We hope Black Girl Single promotes the idea of waiting for God's best and living your best life while you wait.

Another story about being a single woman? Why?

Adrienne's story is more than just a retelling of the hilarious stories women share with their friends over wine. It's an exploration of what it means to be a woman of color in a world where options often feel limited. It's a nod to women who make their own rules. It's a statement about how the sexes interact in a culture that's gender biased. And it's an experiment on what can happen when we make drastic changes in the most important parts of our lives.

This story is important because we're constantly bombarded with negative images of Black women, warnings that Black women are destined to be alone, statistics that show most of us as unmarried single mothers, and countless articles that tell us we'd better move to Europe if we ever want to find love. Is anyone else sick of this narrative? Whether those narratives are real or not, Black Girl Single is about growth, independence, and the faith to press forward and shake things up to get what you ultimately want. 

And on a lighter note, this series a great illustration of just how crazy these streets are when it comes to dating while Black in the DMV! 

Why support independent productions?

We get it. You have bills. You have hobbies. You have things you want and need to spend money on, and while you'd love to support other people's projects, it's just not at the forefront of your mind. We've been there too. But when you support independent projects led by women and people of color, you're supporting an era of film and television production that puts the audience in control of what they see, where they see it, and how they're represented in the mainstream. You're saying that these stories and these experiences have value and can resonate with anyone.

You've heard the statistics. But just to jog your memory:

A 2014 study by PBS showed that roughly one quarter of actors in mainstream films were people of color.

According to the Sundance Institute and Women in Film, "across the 1,300 top-grossing films from 2002 to 2014, only 4.1 percent of all directors were female".

Of 600 films studied by the Annenberg Center for Communication and Journalism, Black directors make up only 6%, with only two Black women directors on that list. 

With those kinds of numbers, it’s no wonder we're out here trying to make this series on our own. Without the backing of big networks and studios, making a quality production is virtually impossible-- unless there's support from backers like you. 

How we'll spend money

Your support will help us to finish production and post production which are extremely expensive. While we've already started to shoot the project, there's still more to be done. In addition to production, we'll need to edit, do color correction, sound mixing, marketing, and hold screeners. Without your backing, this project is nothing more than a cool idea that gets lost in the world of old Youtube videos no one will ever see.

What's in it for you?

While this is an independent production, we want supporters to know how much they're appreciated. We want to see you at the premiere and see your name in lights. Check out all of the great perks we offer. We hope these gestures of appreciation get you excited and feeling like you're part of this special project— because you are!

How we got here

Black Girl Single is the brainchild of Ashley Gordon, a filmmaker based in Washington, DC. As a DMV native and thirty-something single, Ashley has some stories! After years of dating in one of the country's most popular "chocolate" cities, Ashley admits to having a host of comical and frustrating dating experiences. After much urging from friends and family to see her turn these stories into a film, Ashley chose to take their advice and write the Black Girl Single series. She hopes the series makes singles, female and male, laugh, relate, and rethink their approach to dating and finding love.

story:
Short Summary

Rent a Friend follows Fran, the newest hire at Friend inDeed, an app serving NYC’s needy, high strung people.

In Season 1 you met Fran, Jo, some needy clients, and other staff and Friends for hire at Friend inDeed.

In Season 2 you'll meet some more clients, and get to know existing characters a little bit better ;)

The Team

Sophie's background is in graphics & editing. She studied animation at California College of the Arts and has since worked for some of New York's top post-production houses. When she's not cutting spots for web & TV, you can probably find her creating breathtaking illustrations. 

Emily's background is in performance and comedic writing. After attending a performing arts high school, she went on to study French literature, digital filmmaking, and women's and gender studies. She studied at UCB and has performed stand up, improv & sketch comedy all over New York City. In 2014 she wrote her own show, Slam Up, which had over 100 performances across the US & Canada. 

Our first collaboration together was a music video for Emily's performance project. We bonded over how much we each enjoy storytelling in our respective mediums. Since then, business and pleasure have merged and we are so excited to make the most out of a concept that can truly go anywhere.

What We Need & What You Get

Your donations will help us fund the filming and postproduction of 3 more episodes for Season 2, and put us in a competitive place to find a distributor down the line.

Our goal of $13K will go towards paying for:

*Actors & production crew 

*Transportation costs, equipment, & costume rentals

*Music production, mixing, & licensing

*Representation at the NAPTE conference in January 2019, where we will try and find a distributor for the project. 

The Impact

You'll help two ladies get a bit closer to reaching their dreams. This show is written by, directed by, and filmed by women and we are very proud of that!

Risks & Challenges

We learned a lot in the filming of Season 1. We are so proud of the professional quality work we produced, and learned so much along the way. There are always risks and challenges when producing a show, but we're feeling confident with Season 1 under our belts.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone is able to donate $, but you can still contribute by helping us spread the word and by signing up for project updates!

*Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign!

*Sign up for emails, so you can see how we're doing down the line!

story:
Enginella is a live action preschool television show about an eight-year-old aspiring engineer and her adventures. Engineer Ella uses her talents and problem-solving skills to save the day and help her friends in need. With Enginella, we aspire to spark an interest in engineering for young girls and to encourage creative thinking and teamwork. 

We are producing three 7-minute episodes focusing on Ella's adventures. Ella is a clever and charismatic eight-year-old girl who has one dream: to become an engineer. She has a knack for problem-solving and always helps her friends and neighbours out of sticky situations. On a typical day when Ella is at home or at school, she encounters a friend who is in need of her help. She then makes a call to an Engineer Professional and asks for guidance on how to solve the situation. Ella is often accompanied by her two Puppet best friends, Felix and Chloe, who possess special engineering skills and join Ella on her adventures. Ella also seeks the assistance of the viewing audience, allowing them to think and learn while solving problems related to shapes, numbers and patterns. Once the problem is solved, Ella adds a photograph of the day to her Engineer’s Scrapbook and reveals the lesson that the experience has taught her. 

Petit Nuage Productions is a fourth-year all female practicum production group at Ryerson University’s RTA School of Media striving to make a positive difference in the children's television industry. 

Producer: Klaudia Rekas

Klaudia is a fourth year Media Production student in the RTA School of Media at Ryerson University. Currently specializing in television production and children’s programming, she aspires for a career in development and producing. With a strong background in multi-camera and single camera production, she has worked on documentaries, children’s shows and narrative short films as a writer, art director and cinematographer. Klaudia strives to deliver positive, honest messages to a young audience with interactive storytelling and engaging characters.

Director: Felisha Liu

Felisha is in her fourth year at Ryerson University’s RTA School of Media studying Media Production and specializing in television & video, children’s programming, and live event production. She strives to create fun, happy, and meaningful content for everyone’s inner child. When Felisha’s not on set, she’s teaching preschoolers how to be little ballerinas and mini taekwondo martial artists.

Marketing Director: Kelsey-Ann Rattansey 

Kelsey-Ann is in her fourth year at Ryerson University’s RTA School of Media studying Media Production and specializing in television and video, children’s programming and media business. Through diverse and rewarding projects, Kelsey-Ann has acquired a strong foundation in multi-camera productions, social media, and event planning. Understanding how media can have a negative impact on young individuals, Kelsey-Ann strives to use various media platforms to inspire and bring a positive change.

Production Manager: Tia Morrison 

Tia is a fourth year Media Production student in the RTA School of Media at Ryerson University. Currently specializing in video editing, television production, and children's programming, she aspires for a career in directing and post-production. With a background in design and single-camera production, she has worked on scripted reality shows, documentaries and narrative shorts as a production assistant, junior film editor and director.  Through her work, Tia hopes she can inspire at least one person to make a difference in their life. When Tia's not working, she practises taekwondo, trains her puppy, creates YouTube videos and writes stories about the future.

 

A sample storyboard from Enginella Episode 1: "Are You Afraid Of The Dark?"

 

Sample Floor Plans / where we will be shooting all 3 Enginella episodes 

 

We would love it if you shared our project along with your friends and family. To stay up to date with the development of Enginella, follow us on our social media: 

Facebook: @Enginella

Twitter: @ThisIsEnginella 

Instagram: @ThisIsEnginella

Our Website: Enginella.com

Feel free to email us with any questions and comments to petitnuageproductions@gmail.com! Thank you so much for taking the time to learn about our story, we really appreciate it!

story:
Short Summary

Reigns of Regions is a 2-6 minute comedy web series that focuses on Kara, an obsessed fan girl and her equally obsessed roommates, Lea and Ethan, all fans of the fictional popular fantasy drama series, Reigns of Regions, a Game of Thrones like series. Each episode focuses on Kara and her roommates, trying something new, something different, such as, trying to lead a more active social life, finding love, doing volunteer work, etc. However, with Kara being socially awkward and her roommates just being plain weird, things are bound to go wrong for the three.

 

 

What We Need 

This is a low budget project, so something about $1500 should do. I've already self funded the pilot and is available on YouTube, if you are interested in viewing, the link is below. I just need the money to be able shoot the second episode/the second part of the pilot and possibly future  episodes. I am trying to pitch the series to production companies, hoping it'll get picked up as well as to try and gain more funding resources through crowdfunding and grants.

UPDATE: I have reached $550 and have reached my flexible fund. Thank you to all who have contributed.

The Perks & Rewards

Anyone who contributes $50 or more will receive a signed copy of the Reigns of Regions screenplay. Anyone who contributes $100 or more will receive producing credit on the series. This is your chance to receive IMDB credit, if you're interested. 

The Impact

We're creating a series, where fans from any fandom can come across and enjoy this series, whether they are a fan of Game of Thrones, Doctor Who, Star Wars, Marvel, etc. As this series is a satire on the daily lives of hardcore fans. It’s also a series for anyone that isn’t apart of any fandom. It's pretty much a series that anyone enjoy.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, then that's okay. Please get the word out to your friends, thank you.

story:
Rencontres la série

 

Nous faisons une série en langue française à Toronto, et nous voulons que vous en fassiez partie, nous sommes la fusée vous êtes le carburant.

 

Rencontres the Series

We're making a French Language show in Toronto, and we want you to be a part of it we're the rocket you're the fuel.

 

Qui fait la série ?

 

Brennan Martin

- Acteur depuis de nombreuses années, Brennan a été intéressé par le rôle de réalisateur alors qu’il était toujours choisi pour jouer les mêmes rôles.

- Les 5 dernières années il a été réalisateur dont certains qui ont reçu des récompenses à de nombreux festivals comme :

·      TapFest ("Rencontre", Best Picture, Actress, Actor)

·      48 hour film project Toronto ("Expiry Date" [2015] Audience Choice Award, Best Cast)

·      Digi60 ("Ignite"[2014] Best actor) ("Last Impression" [2015] Best Actor, Best Cast)

·      Actra's 24 hour film challenge ( "The Talk" [2016] Winner, "Actor @ Actra" [2017] Winner)

·      KinoTO  ("Good to see You" [2017] Audience choice award)  

- Brennan est également directeur de la photographie, il a tourné la plupart de ces projets mais aussi ceux des autres comme pour le pilote sit-com ‘Quota » fait par les créateurs de « The Beaverton » et « Second Jen » (Il était également monteur sur ce projet)

Florian François

- Une valeur sûre de la scène d’improvisation de Toronto et un acteur accompli à part entière. L’écriture de « Rencontre » a été son premier scénario, son deuxième scénario est « Glove me Tender » en tant que réalisateur, tourné avec Brennan dans le rôle de directeur de la photographie et monteur. Ils ont tous les deux été retenu pour la récompense « Choix du Public » au festival de cinéma KinoTO Film Fest au printemps 2017, le film de Florian « Glove me Tender » et le film de Brennan « Good to see You ».

 

Who's making the show?

Brennan Martin

- An actor for many years, Brennan got interested in Directing when he was always being cast as the same old thing. He's been directing for the last five years, and his films have won awards at many festivals including TapFest ("Rencontre", Best Picture, Actress, Actor), 48 hour film project Toronto ("Expiry Date" [2015] Audience Choice Award, Best Cast), Digi60 ("Ignite"[2014] Best actor) ("Last Impression" [2015] Best Actor, Best Cast), Actra's 24 hour film challenge ( "The Talk" [2016] Winner, "Actor @ Actra" [2017] Winner) KinoTO  ("Good to see You" [2017] Audience choice award)  among others. 

- Brennan also is a Director of Photography, and has shot most of his own projects, and those of others like the pilot for the sit-com "Quota" made by the creators of "The Beaverton" and "Second Jen" (He was also the editor on that project). 

Florian François

- A staple of the Toronto Improv scene and an accomplished actor in his own right, Rencontre was his first script to be produced, his second script "Glove me Tender" he directed, and shot with Brennan as his DOP and Editor, they both tied for the Audience Choice award at the KinoTO Film Fest in the Spring of 2017, Florian's film "Glove me Tender", and Brennan's Film "Good to see You". 

De quoi nous avons besoin

Pourquoi avons-nous besoin de cet argent si Bell est notre distributeur ?

- Nous avons beaucoup de chance d’avoir Bell en tant que distributeur, mais leur financement est faible. Nous avons décidé d’engager des acteurs de l’union pour être sur d’avoir les meilleures performances. C’est pour cela que nous recherchons plus de financement, être dans la capacité de rémunérer des acteurs de qualité. Nous devons également payer l’équipe de tournage, la location, l’assurance, la restauration durant le tournage, l’équipement, etc. etc. etc. pour chaque contribution financière la série s’améliore.

 

What We Need 

Why do we need this money if Bell is distributing?

-We're very lucky that Bell decided to be our distributor, but their funding is very low, we've decided to hire union actors to make sure that this show is well acted, so we're looking to get a bit more money to make sure we can pay them, while making a great show. We also need to pay for crew, locations, insurance, food, post, equipment, etc. etc. etc. for every dollar that you contribute the show gets that much better. 

 

Pourquoi voulons-nous faire Rencontres ?

Rencontres la série promouvoit Toronto comme une ville Francophone et présentera des histoires francophones, nous voulons que Rencontres soit montré à une audience internationale.

- 300,000 francophones vivent à Toronto, la série Rencontres veut raconter leur histoire par la vision d’un voyager étranger. Nos épisodes vont explorer ce que c’est d’être Français et gay à Toronto dans les années 80, une histoire d’immigrant, des histoires d’Aborigènes, des histoires de la perte et des histoires à propos de la découverte d’une ville aussi multiculturelle que Toronto. Cette série raconte l’histoire Canadienne, et nous voulons retranscrire cela au mieux.

 

Why do we want to make Rencontres?

Rencontres The Series will promote Toronto as a francophone city, and showcase francophone stories, we want Rencontres to be shown to a Global audience. 

- 300,000 francophones live in Toronto, what Rencontres wants to do is try and tell their stories through an outsider's perspective. Our episodes will explore what it was like to be French and gay in Toronto in the 80's, immigrant stories, Aboriginal stories, stories about loss and stories about finding new lives in the multicultural soup that is Toronto. This show tells Canadian stories, and we want this show to be great. 

 

Risques et Défis

Comment allez-vous réaliser une série entière ?

- Créer une série est un défie. Heureusement notre équipe est expérimentée dans l’écriture, la production, le tournage et le montage de film. Donc vous pouvez être confiant sur la tenue des objectifs.

- L’écriture du scénario étant déjà fini, une grande partie du casting est déjà signée, en ce moment les lieux et le financement sont les principaux objectifs.

- Nos acteurs sont des professionnels formés, qui arriveront à l’heure en connaissant leur texte et prêt à tourné chaque jour.

- Faire le storyboard de l’intégralité de la série et tourner de façon « run and gun » permettra à la série de garder un rythme rapide et frai.

Brennan, notre réalisateur à beaucoup d’expérience avec des courts-métrages à défi, ayant gagné de nombreuses fois (gagnant de Actra 24 hours challenge deux ans de suite et gagnant de 48 hour film project Toronto’s Audience award en 2016 (le plus grand challenge en son genre au Canada) et gagnant à de multiples reprises au 72 hour film challenges au fil des années). 

Ces défis consistent, une fois le scénario écrit, de tourner et monter le film dans un temps limité. Heureusement, le scénario est prêt, les emplacements et les acteurs seront également préparés et programmer et le temps que nous avons pour monter la série fait de ce challenge un réel bonheur.

 

Risks & Challenges

How are you going to shoot an entire show? 

-Creating a show is a challenge. Luckily our team has a ton of experience writing, producing, directing, shooting, and editing films. So getting this all done on time is a foregone conclusion. 

-Our scripts are all finished, we have a lot of the cast already signed on to shoot, right now locations and funding are the main focuses. 

-Our actors are professionals. Our actors are well trained professional actors who will show up on time, lines memorized, and ready to shoot each day. 

-Storyboarding the whole show, and shooting in an indie run and gun way will keep the show quick and fresh. Brennan, our director has a ton of experience with short film challenges, having won numerous times (winning the Actra 24 hour challenge two years in a row, winning the 48 hour film project Toronto's Audience award in 2016 {the largest film challenge of it's kind in Canada}, and winning at multiple 72 hour film challenges over the years). These challenges are when you have to script, shoot, and edit your film in the time limit. Luckily the scripts are all ready, the locations and actors will be rehearsed and scheduled, and the time we have for editing the series would make film challenge editors cry with joy. 

 

Autre facon de nous aider

Si vous n’avez pas d’argent pour contribuer ? Vous pouvez toujours nous faire l’honneur de partager cette campagne à vos amis et famille. Suivez-nous sur Twitter @Rencontres_TV, Instagram @ Recontrestheseries, et sur notre page Facebook !

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have any money to contribute? You can still do us the honor of sharing this campaign to your friends and family.  Also follow us on Twitter @ Rencontres_TV on instagram @ Recontrestheseries, and on our Facebook page!

story:
What is it?

Hi, I'm Michael Krehan, director and co-writer of Pushing Skills. The story is about Mark, a street-smart hustler who invented a machine that can give somebody any skill they want - for a few hours. He makes a good living by selling his services, but his dealings attract trouble of all sorts.

The concept is loosely based on a very short film I made back in 2000. The idea lends itself to an interesting and colorful world that I would like to create, starting with this pilot, and evolving into a web series. There is so much we can do with the premise! We're starting this campaign to finish post production on the pilot so we can bring it to the festival circuit and use it to pitch the series. We'd like you to be part of our big journey!

Please check out our trailer:

The Cast

Norman Towns

Norman, who plays the protagonist Mark, is a man of many talents. He's a hilarious stand-up comedian, a versatile actor in film and TV, and devoted basketball player.

Bayardo de Murguia

From an early age, Bayardo was fascinated with the arts and learned playing various instruments until he fell in love with acting. You can see him CSI:Crime Scene Investigation as Agent Javier Silva, as well as other shows such as Marvel's Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D., Matador, and Shooter. 

Will Harris

 

Will is all over the TV landscape - you can see him in CSI, Community, Justified, NCIS, just to name a few. In addition to that, he makes use of his powerful voice at the Westminster Chorus as bass section leader.

PJ Adzima

 

If you missed PJ on TV (like as Damien in Royally), you can see him perform live in the Book of Mormon! 

Charles Windle Greer IV

Charles is a talented actor who has already had a lot of appearances on TV shows such as How to get away with murder and School of Rock. He had a major role in Michael Krehan's previous short film, Dreams My Master, who was so impressed by Charles' performance that he wrote this role specifically for him.

Kieran Tamondong

In addition to some serious acting chops and being featured in many commercials, Kieran also has a black belt and is also on the Junior US Karate team.

 

Zuri Starks

Zuri's resume includes a variety of roles in all forms of entertainment: Theater, film, commercials, and on the web.

 

The Crew

Michael Krehan

Director, Co-Writer, Executive Producer.

Maris Lidaka

Producer

Ryan Cook

Co-Writer

Kevin Perry

Cinematographer

Daniel J. Pico

Production Manager

 

Risks?

We already shot the pilot, so that will happen - that much is for sure. However, you have control over the quality! The more successful this campaign, the more effort we can put into polishing it and setting the stage for the new content. The only risk you're facing is that you may not like the end result... but quite honestly, chances are you will. We've gotten great responses so far, and once we're done with post production, it will be even better!

The other risk is that we will not be able to secure resources to continue the story in future episodes of the web series and you'll be left with the pilot, itching for more. But that is exactly why we're asking you to pitch in - every single contribution is one step closer to making it happen!

If you can't make a contribution...

Please consider spreading the word! Post a link to this campaign. Tell others about the idea and bring them here. We're counting on you. Thank you very much!
story_txt:
What is it?Hi, I'm Michael Krehan, director and co-writer of Pushing Skills. The story is about Mark, a street-smart hustler who invented a machine that can give somebody any skill they want - for a few hours. He makes a good living by selling his services, but his dealings attract trouble of all sorts.The concept is loosely based on a very short film I made back in 2000. The idea lends itself to an interesting and colorful world that I would like to create, starting with this pilot, and evolving into a web series. There is so much we can do with the premise! We're starting this campaign to finish post production on the pilot so we can bring it to the festival circuit and use it to pitch the series. We'd like you to be part of our big journey!Please check out our trailer:The Cast

Norman Towns
Norman, who plays the protagonist Mark, is a man of many talents. He's a hilarious stand-up comedian, a versatile actor in film and TV, and devoted basketball player.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
WELCOME TO MAJESTIC 8!

It couldn’t be more exciting for me to introduce this project and the insanely talented group of people working so hard to put it together. It truly is a surreal moment that has forced me to ask: how did we get here? 

My name is Tyler Jacob Stevens and I’m the Showrunner and Co-Creator of Majestic 8, an NYU Advanced TV Pilot. I’ve spent the last few years at NYU lucky enough to be doing exactly what I love: writing, directing, and producing films with the most talented young filmmakers in the world. In early 2018, I sat down with my close friend and roommate Spencer Nachman to talk about a script a script about a few teenagers, a rundown movie theater, and their experiences coming of age in the late 2000s. 

We titled it MAJESTIC 8, our personal tribute to the movie theaters we grew up in and the unsung heroes that keep the popcorn popping and films showing. We pitched the script for NYU’s Advanced TV Program and were given the incredible opportunity to produce the pilot of MAJESTIC 8 as one of two 30-minute pilots being produced at Tisch this Fall. 

The most rewarding part of this process has been watching a team of friends and filmmakers, people I’m proud to call collaborators, come together over the last six month and work hard   on MAJESTIC 8, preparing to shoot in November. We’ve assembled a terrific team of artists that I couldn’t be more excited to work with. So while pre-production continues and we get closer and closer to bringing Majestic Theatres to life, we figured it was time to introduce MAJESTIC 8 to the world.

With your help and generous donations, we’ll be able to make MAJESTIC 8 the show we know it can be: an offbeat and cinematic ode to the people who make the movies happen for us, one tub of popcorn at all time.

Tyler Jacob Stevens (Showrunner/Co-Creator/Writer)

WHAT IS MAJESTIC 8?

MAJESTIC 8 is a TV show set in a movie theater. Taking place in the suburbs of Orlando, Florida in early 2008, it’s a love letter to the theatrical experience and the dying art of film projection set in a pre-recession era. It’s a coming-of-age comedy that follows BRANDON, a recently-suspended high school student in desperate need of a job, as he stumbles into employment at the local eight-screen branch of the nationwide Majestic Theatres Corporation, better known as the MAJESTIC 8.

At the MAJESTIC 8, Brandon is drawn into a strange world populated by eccentric new co-workers. There’s KEITH, the sleazy, semi-tyrannical General Manager who gives Brandon the job; there’s MICKEY, the high school senior longing to leave Orlando and find purpose on the West Coast; there’s PJ, who spends his time on the clock at the Majestic daydreaming about becoming the next Tarantino… or Michael Bay… or whatever hyperviolent male director he happens to be obsessed with at the moment; and finally, there’s SHAWN and GREGORY, the only two who ever seem to take their jobs seriously.

Over the course of his first day, Brandon adjusts to the unique way of life at the MAJESTIC 8, facing strange guests, making new friends, and finding a path forward for himself where he didn’t see one before.

MEET THE CREW!

TYLER JACOB STEVENS - Showrunner/Co-Creator/Writer

Tyler Jacob Stevens was born and raised in Los Angeles, California, which led him to flee to the East Coast for college and subsequently led him to NYU, where he’s written, directed, and produced short films that brought him together with the Majestic 8 team. At the same time throughout college, he has interned at Jimmy Kimmel Live!, Allison Shearmur Productions, and Untitled Entertainment. He’s tremendously honored and humbled that MAJESTIC 8 was chosen to be produced at NYU and couldn’t be more excited that he gets to work with this wildly talented group of close friends and collaborators for his final thesis project.

SPENCER NACHMAN - Co-Creator/Writer

Spencer Nachman is a recent graduate of NYU’s Cinema Studies program and currently works in New York as an agent’s assistant at Buchwald. He’s also held a number of internships focused on film and television development. Before moving to the big city, Spencer was a staff member at a Regal movie theater in his hometown of Jacksonville, Florida — a theater not unlike the Majestic 8. He’s excited and honored to be able to bring some of these experiences to life with the help of an amazing team of creators.

ADAM ROAT - Director

Adam Roat is a senior at NYU studying Film and TV. After falling in love with all things cinema at the age of 10, he soon discovered the creative side of filmmaking and hasn't stopped since. Over the years he has won several awards for his writing and directing and his work has played at film festivals across the country, including a 30 minute movie musical he directed, which premiered at the Montclair Film Festival. He is honored to be a part of the Majestic 8 team and cannot wait for you to see it!

JOHN HOLLANDS - Executive Producer

John Hollands is a Senior at NYU Tisch studying Film & TV. Hailing from Vancouver BC, John has produced numerous student shorts during his time at NYU while developing his own films. Previously, John worked to help develop and produce work with Khare Communications, a leading Canadian corporate documentary company. 

JULIA YELVINGTON - Director of Photography

Julia Yelvington is a Brooklyn based DP, Documentarian, and Activist who first worked with Tyler and John on a previous project in November of 2018 and is very excited to be back with the team! Originally from Boulder, CO, Julia has experience working on large-scale commercial and Fashion projects with Rosco Production, as well as being Head of Visuals for NYC based accessories brand Susan Alexandra. She is excited to tackle the big new world of Television!

GRIFFIN CUBERO - Production Designer

Griffin Cubero is a Senior at NYU Tisch studying Film and Television. When she first began working on set, she found a home with the art department and soon began seeking opportunities out. She’s worked as an art assistant on multiple independent film projects and is now working to build her portfolio as a Production Designer on student sets, short films, and music videos.

ELLIOT FARINARO - Editor/Producer

Elliot Farinaro, born and raised in the San Francisco Bay Area, is a senior at NYU Tisch School of the Arts. During his time in New York, he has edited over twenty students films, done freelance editing for various companies such as Def Jam Recordings and HUMAN, has had his work featured in publishing outlets like Forbes, Teen Vogue, and Director’s Note, and just this past summer he cut his first feature film. Currently, Elliot is interning at Final Cut Edit. He is thrilled to be a part of the Majestic 8 crew, and cannot wait to help bring the team’s vision to life.

Other insanely talented, amazing people included on this journey toward, throughout, and past production are...

CLAUDIA ROSE - Art Director

DANNY ROBERTS - Sound Mixer

CHASE NEWMAN - Producer

TUNC SARDAN - Producer

LAINE ELLIOTT - Costume Designer

SARAH NOCQUET - First Assistant Director

YOUR DONATION WILL HELP…

A lot like going to the movies nowadays, filmmaking can be quite an expensive endeavor (except just on a much, much larger, more costly scale). And while NYU has provided us with a generous allotment and an equipment package to get us going, we need your help in order to get over the finish line and make this show what we know it can be.

So what will your donation go towards?

LOCATIONS!

Filming in a unique, specific location such as a movie theater presents an exciting challenge we’re eager to tackle! Taking over a movie theater is a costly get, but with your help we’ll be able to secure a theater we’ll be proud to call our very own Majestic Theatres 8!

PRODUCTION DESIGN!

Creating a movie theater brand that feels lived in and true to the specific world of our show presents a lot of fun opportunities: Majestic 8 cups! Majestic 8 popcorn tubs! Uniforms! And much, much more – Our Production Designer Griffin Cubero and Art Director Claudia Rose are hard at work to create the Majestic 8 world and all of its period-specific peculiarities!

FOOD/LODGING!

A production like this involves quite a few people both in front of and behind the camera, and of course we want to feed those people well and keep them comfortable during the filming of the show, so part of our funds will of course be going to food and lodging over the course of our production.

TRANSPORTATION!

And lastly, in order for these people to work hard for our show, we need to get them back and forth! So part of the funds raised will be going towards transportation for our cast/crew.

DONATION TIERS

To show our endless, immense gratitude for any and all contributions to our campaign for MAJESTIC 8, we’ve put together some fun reward tiers that we hope you all enjoy!

$25: A ‘Special Thanks’ in the credits of the show!

$75: A poster used on the set of ‘Majestic 8’, signed by the cast and crew!

$100: An official Majestic Theatres uniform shirt, just like the ones worn in the show!

$500: Associate Producer credit!

CLOSING STATEMENT

From the bottom of my heart, I want to thank you all for checking out the crowdfunding campaign for our show. This story has been a major part of a lot of our lives for well over a year now, and in many ways feels like a culmination of things I’ve been passionate about my entire life.

I couldn’t be more excited to make this show with this amazing group of people. We can’t wait to share it with the world and all of you.

Thank you so much for your help, and we hope to see you at the movies!

story:
We take 6 people into the woods, then have them fight TO THE DEATH!  Let me explain:

Around the Campfire is an exciting new competition based, reality show. It’s all about camping and the great outdoors. Each episode, we teach our challengers a series of basic survival skills, then force them to compete against each other, using this freshly acquired knowledge in a MEGA CAMPING CHALLENGE. And when we say they will fight to the DEATH, of course we mean, they will compete for the chance to win an amazing camping prize pack!

 

The goal of our show is to educate and entertain our viewers through laughter and fast paced excitement. We want to show that armed with a little helpful information, ANYONE can get out there and truly enjoy their own camping adventure.

Online presence.

                Around the Campfire Challenge will not just be a stand-alone series. We will be launching a companion web site that will be a rapid access designed to answer any camping related questions a person may have. How do I level my trailer? We’ll have a tutorial video for that. How do I tie a Bow line knot? We’ll have an illustrated step by step guide for that.   You want a recipe for a peach cobbler, that you can cook in a cast iron pan, directly over a campfire? Oh, you better believe we’ll have a place for that! Need to know how to shave your cat, while it has distemper and hates being touched? Yeah, you may need a different web site for that one. But any topics you see covered on the show, will have detailed directions available whenever you need it. Tutorials, product reviews, camping recipes, activities, you’ll find it here.

                                              

Similar Style & Tone                            Similar Theme                       Similar Tone & Emotion

 

Why is this a marketable idea?

The unique format of Around the Campfire, allows us the ability to invite retailers and manufacturers, onto the show, where they can showcase a wide variety of innovative and trend setting gear. This is where we will bring in the bulk of our revenue.

                                                                   

                                                                   Similar in Marketability

Skills segment – The instructional segments of each episode are available for specific brands or manufacturers to have one of their representatives on screen, explaining and giving a full demonstration of their products.

Set dressings – Our set is designed with logo placement in mind. Background banners can be used to showcase branding advertisement or sponsorship on screen during challenges.

Wardrobe – Our lawyers have made this quite clear… repeatedly! “the Hosts must NOT be naked on screen” so, what better place to have them wear sponsored fashion brands when they’re on screen.

Background – The set always needs object placement, this can be simple things like an axe leaning up against a pile of wood. A knife sitting on the table, all the way up to tents and trailers in the background. All placements would be listed in the credits, as well as on our web page.

Challenges and prizes – All the objects our challengers handle within an event, are available for product placement.  All the gifts and prizes will be sponsored items.

CBC News 04/23/21

The great thing about camping is that camping is not a destination, it’s not just something you do.  Camping is a frame of mind, a feeling, it’s getting to spend time with your family without life’s stressful distractions. Sitting around a blazing campfire with a group of friends, laughing the night away, and reminiscing about days gone past. Camping is defined without boundaries: It knows no gender, belief or personal view.  Camping is something that is for EVERYONE, anywhere, any time! Around the Campfire, everyone is in love with nature!
