What we need funding for?

The amount shown is... a rather excessive amount, but that is flexible, and if we don't achieve it (which we don't expect to) we will still receive the any funding provided. Whatever money we do receive will help to ensure that we can create a high quality production, which will result in us receiving the highest grades. 
All money donated will go towards supporting our expenses such as set, costume, props and actors. 
Your contribution will be essential to our success for this production, We would be really limited without your help


With your contribution we will provide you updates concerning our progress on this project. And once it is finished, we will provide each of those who helped support this production with a link to view the final result.
The Impact
This Production contributes to our final grade on our course, it is therefore paramount that we achieve a high grade to support us in our future careers in Film and TV. Any support you can provide for us would be massively appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help
Please Share! Every Donation Counts!
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Overview:

My name is Cam Faull and I am a Melbourne based Director, Producer and Actor.

Our extremely talented team are VERY close to filming the 2nd Season of the Sketch Comedy Web Series: Swiping Right.

Swiping Right is a comedic, heartfelt observation of online and face to face dating in the city of Melbourne. The episodes are a mix of an overarching main story spliced with some stand-alone sketches which make the show a unique viewing experience. With the shows vast array of characters, audiences can enjoy a mix of cringingly relatable comedy and some genuinely tender moments.

Season 1 was a highly nominated and awarded Web Series which found itself travelling the globe into 12 International Web Series Festivals. These included Toronto, New York, Rio, New Jersey, Seoul, Sicily, New Zealand and the Asian Web Awards.

 

THIS TIME we have 8 New Episodes which a bigger, longer, finnier, more weird and wonderful than Season 1!

With COVID having greatly impacted the arts community, we need your support to help us fund our entire Production and Post-Production so that you can finance some VERY talented artists. AND be a part of the production itself with some wonderful Perks!!!!

 

What We Need & What You Get:

We have whittled down our budget to the best of our abilities to assure everyone gets decent pay for their artistic contributions. 

 

Your generous donations will help to finance:

-Cast: Principal and Supporting Roles

-Crew: Directors, 1st Assistant Director, Director of Photography, Sound Recording, COVID Safety Officer 

-Equipment: Lighting, Camera, Lenses, Tripod and additional Gear.

-Art Department: Make up, Set Design, Wardrobe

-Catering: The crew get HUNGRY!!!

-Location Fees

-COVID Safety Officer and Protocols

-Legal Fees

-Insurance

-Marketing

-Video Editing

-Sound Editing

-Colour Grading

All of this together brings us to our total of $45,000 for our total budget.

 

YOU get the opportunity as a supporter, depending on your donation you could receive: 

-Personalised gifts “Cats on Clouds” Art 

-Production updates including behind the scene footage 

-Personalised messages from Charaters/Cast

-Signed Posters 

-T-shirts

-”Thank You” in the credits

-The opportunity to be an extra  

-Have your name in credits as a producer should you be so generous!

Check out the Perks list for more info and breakdowns!

Cast:

The series stars:

Cam Faull (Offspring, Fat Tony and Co, Blacklight)

Lynn Hagele (Swipe Right S1)

Constance Washington (Last Breath, The Association, 50 Kisses

Ben Watts (Stringybark, Double Black)

And a tonne of other talented Melbourne-based Actors!

Crew:

Directors: Cam Faull, Constance Washington and Jesse Walsdorf

Director of Photography: David Richardson (The BBQ, Suzi Q)

1st Assistant Director: Kate Fisher 

COVID Safety Officer: Jarryd Trask

And a super-talented On-Set, Art Department and Post-Production Team!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute financially, we would love you to share this campaign on any of your social media. Help us spread the word.

You are also welcome to check out Swiping Right season 1 on Youtube and you are more than welcome to subscribe, comment or share.

 

You can Like our ‘Swiping Right” Fanpage on Facebook.

story:
I am a passionate gamer through and through, always have been, always will. I care about the gaming community and I have always wanted to be more involved and contribute. Now, I have the opportunity to do that and the way I want to do it is through streaming a show on my own channel. It is something I have always wanted to do but never had the time nor the resources to pull it off. Now I have all the time I need to dedicate myself to this project.   

Streaming video games is a lot more than about playing video games! Because if you think about it, watching a game with no commentary or people to interact with isn't all that much fun. Imagine going to watch a football match and the only people there are yourself and the players. Not quite as good! That is the beauty of streaming. It brings together a community of people who all share the same interests under the banner of a streamer, whose job it is to provide an entertaining, rewarding show that people can enjoy. And that is exactly what I am going to do.

Well, while I have all the passion, charisma and dashing good looks to make an excellent streamer, I don't have a computer. So, you guessed it, I need to buy a computer! I'll also need all the hardware for streaming as well, such as a headset, a microphone and a camera. Computer wise, I need it to be fairly powerful to be able to play games on visually appealing settings as well as run streaming software, use on screen updates, track announcements, check stream health and a surprising amount of other stuff that goes on at the same time. It doesn't need to be top of the line, just a solid machine that can do what I need it to do for 6-12 months or so. Below is a list of everything I am looking for in terms of hardware that will allow me to start creating my show:

  • CPU: Intel Core i5-7600K LGA 1151
  • GPU: GeForce GTX 1070 8 GB
  • RAM: G.SKILL Ripjaws V Series 16GB
  • Motherboard: MSI Z270 GAMING PRO CARBON Intel Z270
  • Power Supply: EVGA EVGA SuperNOVA 650W G1 80Plus
  • Case: NZXT S340 Mid Tower Computer Case
  • CPU cooler: Cooler Master Hyper T2 - Compact CPU Cooler 
  • Monitor: BenQ GL2760H 27"
  • Headset: LOGITECH G430 DTS Headphone
  • Camera: Logitech c920

For the uninitiated, that is everything one needs to build a computer as well as the camera, headphones/microphone that you need to broadcast yourself to the viewers. Once I have this, it will take 1 week to get everything ready to start.

£1750: I will buy one extra monitor at £150. Streaming requires a lot of screen real estate, many different windows open at the same time, the most important of which is your chat! Which is hard to read when the game takes up the whole screen. An extra monitor will make the viewing and interaction a lot smoother. The extra £100 will go towards a new keyboard and mouse. Not top end, but something that is going to be comfortable, as I will be using them 9 hours every day!   

£2000: Streaming is a major CPU intensive process; a lot of streamers have a computer dedicated to it! I won't be too greedy and ask for another computer, but an upgrade to an i7 processor will help keep everything running smoothly. Also, a proper microphone will be great. As well as a boom filter, to make my voice sound silky smooth. Audio and video quality gives a better image, helping to get more people watching.

£2500: This would be incredible and would be enough to make an almost perfect setup! I won't hold my breath for this but, if achieved, I would be able to get additional things like a sound card and video capture card, so the sound would be much better and I can capture footage from consoles as well, increasing my potential audience. As well, upgrades here and there to the RAM and GPU would ensure I could do this for a while to come!

I am here because I need financial help getting my channel running. Of course providing whatever you can is the main way to help and it means so much to me that people would be so generous, but I know that not everyone has the means to help this way. However, there is something that you can do! Please, share this project with others through Facebook, Twitter, Reddit or any form of social media channel. The next level would be to ask a couple of friends to share themselves and ask a few of their friends. If you can do that, this page will never stopped being shared and that is a monumental help to me and the project :)

I want to give back whatever I can to anyone who helps me chase my dream! To honour those who invest their gold in me, we are creating paintings of some of video games most iconic charatcers, moments and events. The first up, the Master Chief, surviving the wreckage of a collapsed Halo ring. There will be a new one every week for a minimum of 5 we will keep you updated on their progress :)

Due to the nature of the project, there are no real risks involved. The only thing of difficulty is getting to Colombia and finding somewhere that sells all the pieces, as it is generally cheaper to buy there than in Ecuador. Luckily I have friends there that can help me out so, once I am there, it shouldn't be too difficult to locate all the parts I need! I have found every piece online on Colombian websites, so I will definitely be able to get everything. I have built my last 2 PCs back in the UK so I am not going to fumble putting it together either! As I said, due to it's nature it is a safe project, so after the success of the campaign I willbe up and running within a month :)

 

 

As a last note, I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for reading all the way down to the bottom of the page! I know that sounds funny, but you would probably not be here unless you felt this project is worthwhile. To me, this endeavour has meant so much. I have learned all kinds of things that genuinely excite me which is a first in my life. It really is wonderful to work on something that you are truely passionate about, which I always thought sounded a bit cliche, but now I understand exactly what that means. I am looking forward to doing this for years to come, to build my skillset and earn a place in this beautiful community. Again, thank you for reading down this far, it means a lot! Please consider helping, either through a pledge, sharing with your friends or, preferably, both ;) THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU

story:
Keep pro wrestlers working (SAFELY) this winter!

Synergy Pro Wrestling is in its offseason as we await more doses of COVID-19 vaccines to be given. In the meantime, we want to provide a safe place for our roster to work, perform, and get paid.

  • #SynergySOS is a closed-set of tapings to provide YOU, the fans, with a series of 45-60 minute episodes featuring the best of Synergy Pro Wrestling talent, champions, and new exclusive matches.
  • It is also a place where our roster can get paid to work doing what they love, what they train for, and what they do to survive — all while following strict COVID-19 protocols.

More donations = more episodes

Our primary goal is to create at least two streaming specials of #SynergySOS during our offseason. If we receive more support, every dollar will go into more episodes of Synergy Pro Wrestling.

We're not asking you to help us raise EVERYTHING — we're kicking in our own funds so you don't have to. The more you kick in on your end, the more we will as well. 

No 'saving it for later', no 'put it in our pockets'. 100% of your support goes to wrestlers and crew. No money will be taken by management

Your rewards & our goals

Perks for sponsoring our #SynergySOS episodes start at just $10. We want to show our gratitude in every way we can.

  • $10: Your name (podcast, group, etc.) will be listed during the end credits in alphabetical order.
  • $25: A personalized short message w/ your name will run on a "ticker" at the bottom of the screen during #SynergySOS episode(s).
  • $40: The Synergy commentary team will thank you, by name, during a match at #SynergySOS (you will be told which ahead of time).
  • $75: The $25 perks, plus your name (podcast, group, etc.) will appear at the TOP of the end credits in alphabetical order in larger font along with a web/social media address.
  • $100+: Exclusive perks are available to donors at this level, including match sponsorship, commercials, 'thank you' messages from our roster/staff, or whatever we can think up together. Synergy management will work this out with you personally. You will also receive the $25 and $75 perks.
  • $150: REQUEST A WRESTLER. (This item is sold out!)

story:
This is Our What? 

The youth culture of Newcastle, Australia also known as ‘Newy’, ‘Spewy’, ‘Spewcastle’,  and ‘Steel City’  has been separated into different cultures. ‘This is Our Newcastle’s focus is to give young Novocastrians the opportunity to talk about their cultural activity and explain how they feel their subculture fits into a wider Newcastle identity. 

The idea was sparked from a conversation between the TWOhours North team in class about how youth in Newcastle is perceived and opportunities these young people have to share their voice. As the 7th largest city in Australia, Newcastle is inevitably made up of multiple subcultures. The subcultures that are the focus of TiON are; Surfing, Skating, Sports, Coffee, and Music. Catch ya down at Dixon for a shorey, grinding bar beach bowl, sipping on a Blue Door coffee while watching the Saturday arvo footy or livin’ it up in the main room at the Cambo. There are many different faces that make up Newcastle and TWOhours North want to capture the city in all its glory to showcase it to the world. As part of the overall goal of creating this series, TWOhours North wants to enter the series into Real Film Festival to utilise its platform to increase the reach of 'This is Our Newcastle' to a larger audience. 

 

This is Our Who?

TWOhours North is composed of five University of Newcastle students. All studying Creative Industries although all with different majors, this provides the team with a wide variety of skills and knowledge. As part of the final year in Creative Industries, each student is required to complete a major project as individuals or part of a group. This team of students came together with a shared vision of showcasing the broad cultural identity of Newcastle through film.

Director Helena Kallinis is trained in visual arts practices and despite being new to this role is eager to venture out of her comfort zone to learn skills in a  different sector of the Creative industries. Victoria Bridge is more familiar with her role as a writer as she has been a part of various media production teams. She is making her writing debut with ‘This is Our Newcastle’. Cinematographer, Daniel Lane is experienced in similar roles such as photography, film and editing. Rachel Bergquist and Adriana Flaherty complete the team in their shared role as producers. Both with different sets of skills in media, they will come together to ensure the documentary will be created in its highest quality. Working with industry professionals the, passionate soon to be graduates, TWOhours North team aim to premiere their first documentary in late 2019, hopefully with more projects to follow. 

This is Our Need. 

To get our project off to a roaring start and get people interested in what were creating, we need to cover some costs first. We require help in paying for aspects of the project such as, artist payment, printing costs, film festival entry fees, ticketed access to filming locations, paid professionals, and a contingency for any unforeseen expenses that roll our way. 

As the production of the film is being done using personal equipment and our own skills where possible, this project is operating on a relatively small budget; with the majority of the proceeds from this campaign going towards the promotion of the film through the cost of printed media, festival submission fees and paying hannah for her excellent work in designing our poster.  We want to showcase Newcastle in all its glory, and in order to do so we are required at times to purchase entry to certain events. While this is an extra cost it will allow us to present a unique storytelling environment that is ideal for 'This is Our Newcastle'.

 

This is Our Where. 

Our project has three phases:

And this is where we're at...

We have completed phase one and we are right now in the midst of phase two. With your help we will be able to complete phase two more successfully such as; paying our artist, getting posters and stickers printed, our fees to enter the Real Film Festival etc... then once all the filming and editing is complete we will be able to move on to the final phase! Phase Three consists of promoting, distribution and giving back. During this phase, all of our rewards from this campaign will be sent out to you! Our lovely contributors! Except of course for our top contributors who we will be in contact with in regards to appearing in the series.

 

This is Our Thanks

By making a donation to TiON you will not only be supporting a bunch of Newcastle kids just trying to make their ideas come to life, but also the creative industries, indie films and a chance for Newcastle’s charm to be shown to the world. 

 

As Newcastle’s next generation of creatives, we need your help to give the industry an audience that enjoys and responds to projects like these. We explore how the city advances from steel production to an innovative and cultural one whilst being amongst the revolution ourselves. Be a part of the change by supporting TWOhours North and TiON.   

Simply by donating, you're helping this project come to life so we'd like to give back! Each donation level comes with rewards! Starting with a name in the thank you credits, to a spot in the film! We like to support local where ever we can, so included in the perks are promotional items such as stickers and a poster designed by Hannah Dunn! Check out some of her work on instagram - @hannart.dunn 

 

More ways you can help

We want to reward you for your generous contribution no matter how big or small. Got some loose change or notes? We’d really appreciate it if you chucked it our way however we understand not everyone is in a financial position to hand over their hard earned dollary doos so here’s what we ask everyone to do

 

Spread The Word!

Tell your mum, dad, grandma, dog, cat, fish, your aunt from Sydney that goes overseas every year! Tell them all! We don’t have the budget to start a huge social media campaign and blast our trailer at you from your laptops, Tv’s and phones; but we do have kind people who can help us spread the word! If you see us posting on Facebook or Instagram chuck us a like! Throw us a comment! Maybe even give us a follow! Or even better, share it on your page too!  

 

-Lend a hand! If you or your business can’t afford to invest your money, we would still love your invested time or materials. We won’t say no to any extra offerings of venues, equipment or another helping hand. 

 

-Come along! Once you’ve subscribed and liked all our social media pages you’ll be the first to know how the film is going and where to come see us at Real Film Fest!

This team of students came together with a shared vision of showcasing the broad cultural identity of Newcastle through film.
Director Helena Kallinis is trained in visual arts practices and despite being new to this role is eager to venture out of her comfort zone to learn skills in a  different sector of the Creative industries. Victoria Bridge is more familiar with her role as a writer as she has been a part of various media production teams. She is making her writing debut with ‘This is Our Newcastle’. Cinematographer, Daniel Lane is experienced in similar roles such as photography, film and editing. Rachel Bergquist and Adriana Flaherty complete the team in their shared role as producers. Both with different sets of skills in media, they will come together to ensure the documentary will be created in its highest quality. Working with industry professionals the, passionate soon to be graduates, TWOhours North team aim to premiere their first documentary in late 2019, hopefully with more projects to follow. 

This is Our Need. 
To get our project off to a roaring start and get people interested in what were creating, we need to cover some costs first. We require help in paying for aspects of the project such as, artist payment, printing costs, film festival entry fees, ticketed access to filming locations, paid professionals, and a contingency for any unforeseen expenses that roll our way. 
As the production of the film is being done using personal equipment and our own skills where possible, this project is operating on a relatively small budget; with the majority of the proceeds from this campaign going towards the promotion of the film through the cost of printed media, festival submission fees and paying hannah for her excellent work in designing our poster.  We want to showcase Newcastle in all its glory, and in order to do so we are required at times to purchase entry to certain events. While this is an extra cost it will allow us to present a unique storytelling environment that is ideal for 'This is Our Newcastle'.

 
This is Our Where. 
Our project has three phases:
And this is where we're at...
We have completed phase one and we are right now in the midst of phase two. With your help we will be able to complete phase two more successfully such as; paying our artist, getting posters and stickers printed, our fees to enter the Real Film Festival etc... then once all the filming and editing is complete we will be able to move on to the final phase! Phase Three consists of promoting, distribution and giving back. During this phase, all of our rewards from this campaign will be sent out to you! Our lovely contributors! Except of course for our top contributors who we will be in contact with in regards to appearing in the series.


 

This is Our Thanks
By making a donation to TiON you will not only be supporting a bunch of Newcastle kids just trying to make their ideas come to life, but also the creative industries, indie films and a chance for Newcastle’s charm to be shown to the world.  As Newcastle’s next generation of creatives, we need your help to give the industry an audience that enjoys and responds to projects like these. We explore how the city advances from steel production to an innovative and cultural one whilst being amongst the revolution ourselves. Be a part of the change by supporting TWOhours North and TiON.   
Simply by donating, you're helping this project come to life so we'd like to give back! Each donation level comes with rewards! Starting with a name in the thank you credits, to a spot in the film! We like to support local where ever we can, so included in the perks are promotional items such as stickers and a poster designed by Hannah Dunn! Check out some of her work on instagram - @hannart.dunn 

 
More ways you can help
We want to reward you for your generous contribution no matter how big or small. Got some loose change or notes? We’d really appreciate it if you chucked it our way however we understand not everyone is in a financial position to hand over their hard earned dollary doos so here’s what we ask everyone to do

 
Spread The Word!
Tell your mum, dad, grandma, dog, cat, fish, your aunt from Sydney that goes overseas every year! Tell them all! We don’t have the budget to start a huge social media campaign and blast our trailer at you from your laptops, Tv’s and phones; but we do have kind people who can help us spread the word! If you see us posting on Facebook or Instagram chuck us a like! Throw us a comment! Maybe even give us a follow! Or even better, share it on your page too!   -Lend a hand! If you or your business can’t afford to invest your money, we would still love your invested time or materials. We won’t say no to any extra offerings of venues, equipment or another helping hand.  -Come along! Once you’ve subscribed and liked all our social media pages you’ll be the first to know how the film is going and where to come see us at Real Film Fest!

story:
Who We are

Labrisz Lesbian Association was established in 1999. It works to create a society where women have the opportunity to freely choose their partners and lifestyles and to express their sexualities without restrictions. We organize monthly community programs (film club, game club, discussion evenings, social gatherings), an annual cultural festival (LIFT Festival), and LGBT History Month.

We offer a sensitizing program for schools and workplaces, called “Getting to Know LGBT People”. In order to preserve and promote lesbian and feminist culture in Hungary, we have a “Lesbian Herstory Archive”.

We publish books, including the fairy tale collection “Fairyland is for Everyone” (2020) which has been scandalized by extremist politicians and became a bestseller, soon to be published in several other languages.

 

The Second Golden Age

The pandemic is making it hard for the lesbian (LBT women’s) community to stay connected. During the Covid-19 pandemic we mostly keep in touch through digital devices. However, not everyone is able to access these technologies equally easily. Women of different age groups may differ in their skills and knowledge of how to best utilize their smartphones, navigate different apps, or how to stay safe online.

We have filmed a romantic educational video series in six episodes about two middle-aged women who have met online, to introduce viewers to using these digital devices and apps more efficiently and safely.

Judit and Tünde are on different levels of familiarity with their computers and smartphones, and their life situation is different, as well: Judit is from the capital city, freshly out of a long-term relationship, and Tünde lives in the countryside, which makes it hard for her to meet new people.

The pandemic is making it especially hard for different generations and people separated by borders to keep in touch. Through our video series, we can help people acquire IT skills and basic skills in smartphone usage and staying safe online.

With your contribution, you will support the spread of digital literacy, especially for LBTI women of older age groups.

We need 2,500 Euros in order to be able to finish the post-production work for the video series, which includes creating the visual effects used for transferring IT information, and for sound mixing and lighting.

7 EUR - 1 minute of colour correction

20 EUR - 3 minutes of sound mixing

50 EUR - 3 minutes of visual effects

100 EUR - 1 day rental at a post-production studio

300 euro - Marketing, promotion

We are aiming to premiere these six episodes in April 2021 to transfer knowledge about smartphones, IT and online skills and help our audience as soon as possible!

 

The circumstances

The needs of older generations of LBTI women and those living in social environments where technological savviness is not a given are often overlooked or neglected. Such needs are exacerbated by the isolation because of the covid-19 pandemia on the one hand, and an oppressive, homo- and transphobic socio-political environment in Hungary, where many people fear being open about their sexuality more than before, on the other hand.

The film production team has a sound track record of films depicting the lives of LGBTQI people and Labrisz has a rich experience in community organizing, therefore the film is expected to be a great success.

 

Dreams come true ...

We are optimistic about achieving our goal, as we have run several successful donation campaigns. We regularly produce videos, and our member and the director of the series, Maria Takacs, is an internationally renowned documentarist in both LGBTQI circles and the broader public interested in social issues and inequalities. Her films include:

Secret Years (trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vj8FaAOL-hk)

Hot Men Cold Dictatorships (trailer and film: https://vimeo.com/ondemand/hotmencolddictatorships)

The greatest challenge for us is time. The sooner we can complete the film, the sooner we can empower LBTI women who are less IT literate. Therefore time is important, so make your donation as soon as possible!

... with You!

Whether you are able to support the campaign by a donation or not, please get the word out and share its link on social media. We encourage you to use the Indiegogo share tools.

story:
IT GIRLS ON THE STOOP was created so we could hang out and eat good food, drink cocktails and laugh!  Well, Yes and No. We really wanted to share how making your life as simple as possible could lead to a much better Quality of Life especially for YOU!  While we still intend to offer loads of Stoop-It Simple ideas in Season 2, we also want to share easy, healthy recipes, delicious Juices and Shakes (sometimes with a little Vodka), various workouts to keep you fit and fab, mindful meditations and practices to keep you at Peace and Focused and Talk- Women- Centric Topics with our special guests such as Jessica Leccia, Michelle Ray Smith, Dot Marie Jones, Michael Sabatino, Tina Sloan, Kassie DePaiva and so much more! AND fun sports that get you outside enjoying your day and friends.

We kid that we started this just to hang out and drink martinis…. we do that any way.  We really want to help as many women like us who have been in relationships, had children, loved and lost friends, been a victim of #MeToo been a working Mom, been through the changes that Mother Nature provides all of us...basically anyone with a Uterus...And Men, you can learn a lot from us too!  Women are multitaskers! Creative Goddesses! IT GIRLS ON THE STOOP: Season 2 is going to take us Gals to the next fulfilling level!

 

We  know as a wives, friends, daughters, Sisters and  Mothers of two how much time there is in a day. “Women Who Have It All” is an oxymoron because in order to do everything, there are compromises along the way. We also know that it’s easy to get stretched in many directions and, at the end of the day, feel like we missed moments either with a loved one or, and most importantly, with ourselves.  Hillary and I have amassed years of easy tips to make your lives Easier and Fuller with our Stoop-It Simple tricks! Our goal is to give you the tools you need to be the very BRILLIANT SELF that you are!

 

Help us make this happen by supporting our Indiegogo “It Girls on the Stoop” Season 2 Fund Raiser!  We have put together some really FUN perks for you to purchase! We promise to be the Hostesses with the Mostesses in front of the camera….and behind the camera when we meet and greet, play golf, lunch, dinner,  ahem...wine taste….or very possibly be your very OWN Chefs and Mixologists while we entertain you and some friends! Check us out and Give us your feedback. The money raised will go toward Production Needs such as travel expenses (people and equipment), accommodations, props, insurance, crew, all post-production costs (which can be...costly : ) ) and of course, PERKS!

Hillary knows I’ve been wanting to do a Womens Themed Show for some time.  While we can open up about some real issues we are facing, we can do it with laughter and a total sense of well-being! Because laughter keeps you young and energized!  Here’s to a GREAT Second Season! And thank you from the bottoms of our Stoop-It Simple Hearts!

 

Xxoo

Crystal and Hillary

The IT Girls on the Stoop

story:
I used to be a girl! I used to be a teenager!

I remember making sure never to get detention on Thursdays, because the moment the school bell rang at 3:30pm, my friend Maureen and I would run, as if the Devil were on our tail, and arrive home out of breath, just in time for our favourite TV programme.

That's why teen girls in Ghana need a positive and refreshing show they can rush home to, just as I did. A show that reflects all Ghanaian teen girls, be they  big, short, slim, physically challenged, dark, hearing impaired, tall or fair.  A show that explores  the issues they consider important, that shows them they are important, and presented by teen girls, just like them.

At the moment what they normally hear is:

‘Do as you’re told!’ ‘Study! Study! Study!’ ‘Pass your exams!

‘Be disciplined and obedient!'

There's nothing wrong with that ... but .., what about money management skills, learning about their bodies, exercise, careers advice, thinking outside the box, standing up for themselves, learning to say 'No' without feeling guilty, reaching for the stars and other skills that will help them grow into confident, well informed people who take responsibility for themselves?

Fabteen presenters Precious and Maame Serwaa

As you can see from our short video, FABteen is colourful, friendly and fresh. It's a 30 minute weekly programme, with 8 segments per episode.

Each episode has 6 unrelated FAB segment topics and 2 Vox Pops.

In one episode; we have beauty - how to fight pimples with natural home made products, how to deal with bullying, tips to boost confidence, learning about the culture of another country - some phrases and a recipe, creating individual fashion style, social issues discussion forum, and two vox pops (street interviews) relating to any of the segments showcased.

The following episode will have 6 new topics and 2 vox pops.

Each episode will have 'signing' so that teens who are hearing impaired can follow and enjoy the show.

A good television production costs. Cameras, lighting, cast, locations ... and the list goes on.  We're a small team with a fantastic project and we need help to make it a reality. YOUR  help.

The goal is $63,000 to shoot Season 1 (13 episodes).

Where will the money go?

How will the money be spent?

As each episode has 6 segments and 2 vox pops, there will be a lot of logistics to organize before we shoot.

 We will need to secure Locations, People to interview, Equipment hire (if we can buy some, even better), Food (very important), Transportation, Costumes, Props, Visual and Sound editing, and last but not least, Pay the young up and coming cast & crew a proper wage.

We plan to spend:

  • 4 weeks in pre-production: Decorating Maame and Precious's FAB studio; securing locations; people to interview; costumes, etc.
  • 24 to 28 days to shoot the series - 2 days to film content for an episode, and a couple of days for any pick ups
  • 2 - 3 months in post production

We aim is to be on air in January 2018.

We will  update you as to where and on what we use the funds, including what we are up to in the filming process.

Our eternal gratitude and, a huge sense of satisfaction that you've helped make this happen.  You can contribute as much or as little as you want, however, we offer perks starting at $20 (check them out and choose something, or 2, or 3). Apart from the FAB merchandize, Season 1, thank you credits and producer credits, you also get the chance to be part of a series that is fresh, unique and, dare I say it, daring. A show that treats teens as responsible intelligent human beings; there has been nothing like this in Ghana and you can help make this a reality.

FABteen has been a dream for over 4 years and last year my small crew and I were able to film 2 episodes. 

Companies in Ghana who we've approached for funding, love the show and see it's value but aren't ready to invest. Why? It's unique and untested (only 6% of television programming is aimed at the 0 - 19yr age range; and they are mostly foreign cartoons). There is an assumption that teens don't have money, so businesses are reluctant to invest in a project with teens as the target audience - teens who apparently don't have money to buy their products.

Our teens are our country's future adults and it is important that we invest in them. Television is such a powerful tool and perfect to reach as many teens girls across the country, and the continent. And you know what, once season 1 is aired, all those who didn't have faith will come running to jump on board for season 2 and beyond. FABteen's existence will be the catalyst that will inspire other television content producers to produce for the teen market.

So FABteen has to be made! But we want to make it the best we possibly can, and we will... but it will be so, so much better with your help!

Join the FAB squad and make FABteen a reality.

If you can't contribute money, you can still help.

  • Help us get the word out there through Facebook, Email, Word of Mouth, Twitter, Instagram  and any other means you can think of.
  • Tell your friends, family and colleagues to contribute, big up and make noise about our ground breaking show.

Please use this short link when you share: igg.me/at/fabteen

story:
The Project

CHILL GIRL follows the lives of three recent graduates as they move to Los Angeles and balance figuring their shit out, sex and love, and new friendships. Whether it be managing their up and coming chocolate blog, figuring out if they’re a fuck buddy or not, or battling their work enemy, the crew somehow manages to screw up all three.

CHILL GIRL focuses on one of the most difficult times in a person's life: post-grad. We spend the first twenty-two years of our lives working our way through school and preparing for what's next. But once we hold up that diploma and leave our college campuses, we begin to ask ourselves that terrifying question: Now what?

In this web series, we aim to show an honest depiction of what this part of life is really like. It's scary, it's exciting, it's messy, and it's filled with possibilities. For Jess, Damien, and Claire, the fun (and drama) comes from figuring it all out. And when every day is filled with unexpected job opportunities, love affairs, and new friendships, "figuring it all out" is easier said than done.

The Team

Creators:

Jessie Vane is a Los Angeles based actor and writer who recently graduated with a B.S. from Northwestern University, where she studied acting and playwriting. During her time in Chicago, she dove into the world of experimental film and theater, mentored playwrights through Vertigo Productions and was lucky enough to see her work go up at Victory Gardens. Since moving to Los Angeles, Jessie has been lucky enough to act at Santa Monica Playhouse, Long Beach Shakespeare Company, as well as in several short films. Other than obsessing over her cats (yikes), she's preparing to laugh at her own struggles in Chill Girl! jessievane.com.

Samantha Casesa is an actor and born and raised New Yorker who traded bagels for palm trees when she moved to LA last year. She recently graduated from Northwestern University’s theatre program with a concentration in acting for screen. At Northwestern, she learned how to combine her love of art and social justice through working with Lipstick Theatre, a theatre group dedicated to tackling women's issues through performance. She moved to LA to follow a life-long love and admiration of TV and film and is really passionate about opportunities like these to create her own content. She is represented by Velmont Talent Agency.

Julian Larach is an actor originally from San Francisco who moved to LA after graduating from Northwestern University in 2019 with a B.A. in theater. While attending school in Chicago, he made his professional theatrical debut in 'Sycamore' at the Raven Theater. Now after doing a few squats and hip thrusts, he's back to California to pursue a career in TV & Film. He is represented theatrically by Commercial Talent Agency. 

Producers:

Max Kliman is a recent graduate from Northwestern University. He currently works as an executive assistant at a management company and uses his free time to make sketch comedy videos. He previously produced The Blackout - Northwestern's Late Night Show, and co-created the web series BIG SQUAD. An aspiring producer, Max is excited to help create something meaningful, funny, and relatable. He also just learned how to make a smoothie so is now one step closer to being an adult. 

Sarah Evans is the most recent graduate of Northwestern University on the team, but graduating in the pandemic class matured her to the level of Peter. Sarah's short films and scripts have travelled the festival circuits, garnering her recognition from Cannes, Los Angeles Film Festival, Austin Script Competition, Heartland Film Festival, Indie Short Fest, and more. She produced The Blackout (late night comedy show), ran Studio 22 Productions (student run production company), and founded Northwestern's chapter of Team Enough (gun violence prevention group). Now that Sarah's graduated, she just sleeps, watches horror movies, and plays with her puppy (DM for pics).

Peter Condie is a not-as-recent-as-the-other-two-but-still-thinks-of-himself-as-pretty-recent graduate from Northwestern University. He previously worked at NBCUniversal as a part of their West Coast Page Program and recently started as an assistant at a premium cable network. With hopes of producing television, Peter is excited for his first foray into producing web series. He also recently finished a science-fiction novel titled "The Three Body Problem" and thinks you should read it too. 

Your Donation

CHILL GIRL will be shot with a modest goal budget of $5,000.

To keep the budget low, we thankfully have friends of extraordinary talent both in front of and behind the camera who have volunteered their time and energy to the project. This allows us to cut down on major costs involved with cast and crew, and focus money that would be spent in those categories elsewhere. 

The largest portion of our budget is allocated to On-Set Expenses (30.5%), which will cover all the basic materials needed to handle emergencies on-set (duct tape, power extenders, etc..), as well as craft services to keep our dedicated volunteer friends happy to fed. 

Similar to cast & crew, our locations budget is razor-thin. Thanks to a network of friends and family in the Los Angeles area, we believe we will be able to shoot on location for free due to their generosity. 

The lack of cast, crew, and locations budget will allow us to rent high-quality lighting and sound equipment (13.4%), ensuring a professional-quality final product. We'll also be able to dedicate more funds than usual to props, costumes, and production design (8.1%), allowing our talented production team to create genuine, authentic environments on-set. 

Our goal is to showcase this web-series at various festivals across North America; to achieve this we'll be setting aside roughly 10% of the budget to cover submission costs. 

Rounding out our budget is the expected transportation costs (8.1%) of our cast & crew, and a small contingency (9.2%) to be used wherever deemed most necessary. 

The CHILL GIRL team is committed to creating the highest-quality web-series possible, and each dollar of your donation will aid us in our goal of delivering an original, comedic, and compelling story.  

The Impact

Your donation will help bring this project to life and allow us to create something both entertaining and meaningful. We don't pretend to have all the answers, but we hope that by creating an honest, genuine depiction of the post-grad experience, we can help ourselves and others make sense of it. We want our viewers to see themselves in our characters, and we hope everyone will walk away feeling at least a little bit better about not having their lives together. And if you do have your life together at this point, please reach out. We have questions.

Safety and Inclusivity

With the COVID-19 pandemic, we will make sure that all shooting is conducted in the safest way possible. That means required masks, minimal crew members on set at a time, and frequent testing. Any scenes that require larger numbers of people will be shot last as to allow for maximum preparation time to make sure all safety protocols are followed. We're excited to bring this project to life, but our priority is the health of our entire team, and if there are any health issues we will immediately halt production until we are able to safely film.

In terms of inclusivity, we want to create an environment where our entire team feels valued. We want everyone to feel like CHILL GIRL is their project, and each person involved should feel as though they played a significant role in its creation. No matter the skill level or previous experience, we want our entire team to be excited about showing up to set and making these episodes. This will not be one of those projects where the director is the only person allowed to speak on set. This will be a collaborative, fun process, and we're so excited to combine everyone's ideas to create the best product possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute financially, there are other ways you can help! Please share this campaign and tell your friends/family/enemies about it. Or reach out to us if you want to be involved with the project! We'd love to have you on our team.
story_txt:
The Project
CHILL GIRL follows the lives of three recent graduates as they move to Los Angeles and balance figuring their shit out, sex and love, and new friendships. Whether it be managing their up and coming chocolate blog, figuring out if they’re a fuck buddy or not, or battling their work enemy, the crew somehow manages to screw up all three.
CHILL GIRL focuses on one of the most difficult times in a person's life: post-grad. We spend the first twenty-two years of our lives working our way through school and preparing for what's next. But once we hold up that diploma and leave our college campuses, we begin to ask ourselves that terrifying question: Now what?
In this web series, we aim to show an honest depiction of what this part of life is really like. It's scary, it's exciting, it's messy, and it's filled with possibilities. For Jess, Damien, and Claire, the fun (and drama) comes from figuring it all out. And when every day is filled with unexpected job opportunities, love affairs, and new friendships, "figuring it all out" is easier said than done.
The Team
Creators:
Jessie Vane is a Los Angeles based actor and writer who recently graduated with a B.S. from Northwestern University, where she studied acting and playwriting. During her time in Chicago, she dove into the world of experimental film and theater, mentored playwrights through Vertigo Productions and was lucky enough to see her work go up at Victory Gardens. Since moving to Los Angeles, Jessie has been lucky enough to act at Santa Monica Playhouse, Long Beach Shakespeare Company, as well as in several short films. Other than obsessing over her cats (yikes), she's preparing to laugh at her own struggles in Chill Girl! jessievane.com.
Samantha Casesa is an actor and born and raised New Yorker who traded bagels for palm trees when she moved to LA last year. She recently graduated from Northwestern University’s theatre program with a concentration in acting for screen. At Northwestern, she learned how to combine her love of art and social justice through working with Lipstick Theatre, a theatre group dedicated to tackling women's issues through performance. She moved to LA to follow a life-long love and admiration of TV and film and is really passionate about opportunities like these to create her own content. She is represented by Velmont Talent Agency.
Julian Larach is an actor originally from San Francisco who moved to LA after graduating from Northwestern University in 2019 with a B.A. in theater. While attending school in Chicago, he made his professional theatrical debut in 'Sycamore' at the Raven Theater. Now after doing a few squats and hip thrusts, he's back to California to pursue a career in TV & Film. He is represented theatrically by Commercial Talent Agency. 
Producers:
Max Kliman is a recent graduate from Northwestern University. He currently works as an executive assistant at a management company and uses his free time to make sketch comedy videos. He previously produced The Blackout - Northwestern's Late Night Show, and co-created the web series BIG SQUAD. An aspiring producer, Max is excited to help create something meaningful, funny, and relatable. He also just learned how to make a smoothie so is now one step closer to being an adult. 
Sarah Evans is the most recent graduate of Northwestern University on the team, but graduating in the pandemic class matured her to the level of Peter. Sarah's short films and scripts have travelled the festival circuits, garnering her recognition from Cannes, Los Angeles Film Festival, Austin Script Competition, Heartland Film Festival, Indie Short Fest, and more. She produced The Blackout (late night comedy show), ran Studio 22 Productions (student run production company), and founded Northwestern's chapter of Team Enough (gun violence prevention group). Now that Sarah's graduated, she just sleeps, watches horror movies, and plays with her puppy (DM for pics).
Peter Condie is a not-as-recent-as-the-other-two-but-still-thinks-of-himself-as-pretty-recent graduate from Northwestern University. He previously worked at NBCUniversal as a part of their West Coast Page Program and recently started as an assistant at a premium cable network. With hopes of producing television, Peter is excited for his first foray into producing web series. He also recently finished a science-fiction novel titled "The Three Body Problem" and thinks you should read it too. 
Your Donation
CHILL GIRL will be shot with a modest goal budget of $5,000.
To keep the budget low, we thankfully have friends of extraordinary talent both in front of and behind the camera who have volunteered their time and energy to the project. Similar to cast & crew, our locations budget is razor-thin. Thanks to a network of friends and family in the Los Angeles area, we believe we will be able to shoot on location for free due to their generosity. 
The lack of cast, crew, and locations budget will allow us to rent high-quality lighting and sound equipment (13.4%), ensuring a professional-quality final product. We'll also be able to dedicate more funds than usual to props, costumes, and production design (8.1%), allowing our talented production team to create genuine, authentic environments on-set. 
Our goal is to showcase this web-series at various festivals across North America; to achieve this we'll be setting aside roughly 10% of the budget to cover submission costs. 
Rounding out our budget is the expected transportation costs (8.1%) of our cast & crew, and a small contingency (9.2%) to be used wherever deemed most necessary. 
The CHILL GIRL team is committed to creating the highest-quality web-series possible, and each dollar of your donation will aid us in our goal of delivering an original, comedic, and compelling story.  

The Impact
Your donation will help bring this project to life and allow us to create something both entertaining and meaningful. We don't pretend to have all the answers, but we hope that by creating an honest, genuine depiction of the post-grad experience, we can help ourselves and others make sense of it. We want our viewers to see themselves in our characters, and we hope everyone will walk away feeling at least a little bit better about not having their lives together. And if you do have your life together at this point, please reach out. We have questions.

This will not be one of those projects where the director is the only person allowed to speak on set. This will be a collaborative, fun process, and we're so excited to combine everyone's ideas to create the best product possible.

story:
Short Summary

Thank you all for donations on our previous episodes. We are excited to shoot the shows airing pilot and we need help to complete it. 

What We Need & What You Get

We have specific perks this round including a dinner (virtual) with the episode's writer/director, Jacob Arbittier; a dinner (virtual) with the web series' show runner, Ken Rudnick; and even a day in the writers' room (virtual)! 

This will help us to be able to afford our Grip and Electric team and rentals, our cast, and important COVID safety items and protocols. 

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE! Follow us on instagram @midnightbytes.tv and facebook @midnightbytes.tv. 

Share with your friends and ask them to contribute. If everyone's 5 friends contributed $5- we'd hit our goal easily! 

Thank you so much and keep your eyes out for our first three episodes, available soon!

story:
Short Summary

The show centers on Sean Murphy (Chuck Fusca) an ex Wall Street executive who recently moved to Boulder, leaving behind his job and controlling ex-wife, to help his childhood friend Andy (John Connon).  Andy just purchased a Cannabis and Coffee Shop on a whim without thinking about how he would actually pay for and run the business.  It now falls to Sean to save his overreaching and underachieving friend. 

Sean hires employees from various backgrounds including the palm-reading Morgan (Deanna Shaekel), former NFL lineman and cannabis savant Jeep (Elliot Mealer), and Michelin star pastry chef Alex (Rachael Thompson).  Together this team builds the Boulder Buds brand while overcoming legal and comedic hurdles.

Taking from influences such as It's Always Sunny In Philadelphia, Arrested Development, Cheers, and Taxi, the show will be a vehicle for some of Florida's best comedic actors and bring recognition to talent in the Central Florida area.

Emmy award winning producer Larry Hardnett and Jared Bolhuis are producing Boulder Buds and the “Face of CMT” Lance Smith, is directing.

 

Funding and Perks

FUNDING:

We are producing a "Proof of Concept" episode in Orlando, FL in July.  This will be our vehicle to shop to network and online streaming executives in the hopes of producing a full season of episodes right here in Orlando. To make this vision happen we are looking for partners to assist us with our budget.  

The budget for this episode is $35,000. 

About 10% of that goes to IndieGoGo and PayPal/credit card processing.

The rest will be spent on payment to the cast and crew, and "hard costs," of a 5-day shoot and post-production.

Cast and crew payments include Actors, Production Department (producers, assistant directors, location manager, production coordinator, production assistants), Camera Department (Director of photography, assistant cameramen, grips, electricians), sound mixer, script supervisor, prop master, set decorating, costume design, hair and make up artists, editor, and post production supervision,

"Hard costs" include insurance, permits, craft service food for cast and crew, prop and costume purchases,  equipment rental, vehicle rental, trailer rental (if necessary), production supplies, batteries, and hard drives, fees, and promotion.

PERKS:

The perks we included are laid out in detail on the right side of the screen. We take our contributors seriously and want them to feel part of the production. That is why some the perks are focused on credits on the film, film set visits, and cast and crew screening invitations in addition to cool Boulder Buds schwag.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t financially support Boulder Buds, we ask that you participate by sharing this webpage with all of your friends and followers.

story:
Hi, I'm Mike from Epic Duck Studios

You might know me from my YouTube channel, or my live Twitch shows. I've been making hobby tutorials for wargamers in some capacity since 2009, and I'd like to take that further than I ever have before. To produce better quality content and focus on producing it full-time, I need to complete some renovations to my studio space, get some new equipment, and set up a safety net to pay the bills while I get things rolling.

 

What I Need & What You Get

As I'll be working full-time from my home, I need to make sure some basic household expenses are met in the coming months while I ramp up video production and take on painting clients. On top of that, there are 3 things I'd specifically like to do to improve the audio quality in my studio:

  • Install acoustic insulation and an acoustic tile drop ceiling in the studio to cut down on noise travelling from upstairs.
  • Install new cabinets to help better organize the space while also cutting down on some noise transmission from the nearby central air unit.
  • Upgrade the microphone I use when narrating YouTube tutorials.

In return, I pledge to continue producing 6 live Twitch streams, and a minimum of 2 new YouTube tutorials plus one additional video every week (with exceptions for holidays, because I'm human).  Aside from making more content than ever before, I'm also offering a few perks to those who can give a little more as my way of saying Thank You!

 

Why YOU should support this project

I love teaching others how to paint their miniatures well, and take pride in their work. I'm on a mission to rid the world of unpainted miniatures. By funding this project, you're helping to ensure that I can pursue that passion all day, every day, teaching people on both Twitch and YouTube to LOVE painting their miniatures. This project is as much about supporting my family as it is about upgrading my studio - I want to make sure my wife and son have a roof over their head and food on the table, while also pursuing a career I'm highly passionate about.

 

Risks & Challenges

The specific goals of this project are essentially risk-free - I've assembled cabinets and drop ceilings before, and completing those tasks is effectively a non-issue. The risk comes from the fact that I've already left my old career behind and I'm actively pursuing this as a full-time endevour. I need to get the ball rolling and fast so that painting commissions and video production can comfortably pay the bills. I'm confident that in a few months time I'll have plenty of painting work and other revenue coming in, but I'd love to get to that point safely.

I should point out that this isn't my first rodeo - I operated Epic Duck Studios full-time through most of 2009 and 2010, and that was before Twitch or Patreon existed.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're not ready to support this campaign, there's a few other ways you can help out:

  • Spread the word! If you're a fan of my tutorials and shows, tell your friends!
  • Become a Patron at patreon.com/epicduck - even a dollar a month helps keep the lights on and the paint flowing.
  • Follow me on Twitch at twitch.tv/epicduckstudios - and if you have Amazon Prime, your Twitch Prime free subscription would mean a lot to me.
  • Subscribe to my YouTube channel at youtube.com/epicduckstudios

 

The Goal Breakdown

To be as transparent as possible, here are my goals. As mentioned in the Campaign Video, 50% of each goal will go toward paying the mortgage and other bills so the studio can keep operating, while the other half will go toward upgrades.

Goal 1: Acoustic Ceiling: $1058
Goal 2: Ikea Cabinets: +$1686  ($2744 running total)
Goal 3: Sennheiser Mic: +$1600 ($4344 running total) (converted from $599 USD)

Acoustic Ceiling cart from homedepot.ca:

Besta Cabinets from Ikea.ca (plus 13% HST):

 

Sennheiser Wireless Mic from B&H USA:


THE BIG GOAL - $10000+?
If this campaign just blows up in a totally unexpected way, I'm prepared to renovate the garage into a dedicated full-time studio space. This will include insulation, sound dampening, air filtration, and running new electrical and plumbing to the garage, as well as erecting a small shed in the back yard to house much of what's currently stored in it. In this dream goal, I'd have two dedicated painting stations for myself and a guest, as well as a dedicated airbrushing booth, and a gaming table on-site. Streaming RPGs from the garage would not be out of the question.  I have not actually estimated the cost of this project yet because at this time I just consider it a pipe dream... but stranger things have happened.

story:
ABOUT BUCK'S

Buck's is a new web series, written and produced by Molly Faber and Austin Calam. It follows a group of small town baristas in the Midwest, where hijinks abound and coffee is taken a little... okay, WAY too seriously. Your donation will help us pay for the production costs, location rental, wardrobe, and props.

WHO ARE WE?

Molly Faber is the creator of Buck's and will also be producing, directing, and acting in Buck's. She has an MFA in Acting as well as experience directing and coaching actors.

Austin Calam is a writer for Buck's and will also be producing, filming, and directing Buck's. He is a film maker with acting and directing experience. 

This is Molly and Austin's first project of this magnitude, and they have big plans for it. By contributing, YOU will help make Buck's a reality! 

WHY ARE WE FUNDRAISING

Since the pandemic started, jobs for actors and filmmakers have become even more scarce than they were pre-pandemic. So we thought: why not make our own work? And thus Buck's was born!

However, filmmaking is... expensive. We have a clear and exciting vision for Buck's, but we can't make it happen on our own. That's why we need YOU! 

Here's what your donation will go toward:

  • Production Costs: This is our largest expense and includes all things needed to produce a film: lights, camera, action! 
  • Location Rental: good locations = a good looking web series
  • Wardrobe, Props, Set Dressing: these details ensure that Buck's looks like... Buck's! 

WHAT IF YOU EXCEED YOUR GOAL?

First of all, that would be AMAZING! Second, here's how we would use that money:

  • Crew and Actor salaries: At this point, our amazing cast and crew are volunteers. Exceeding our goal would mean we could pay them for their time and hard work.
  • Food for the Cast and Crew: A well fed cast and crew is a happy cast and crew!
  • Festival Fees: We believe strongly in Buck's and our ability to make a great web series, SO we plan to enter Buck's into festivals. Unfortunately, entering things into festivals is not free.

WHY SUPPORT BUCK'S?

As we thought about what story we wanted to tell we realized that there isn't a show out there that tells the stories of baristas, and very few stories set in small towns. Both of us are from a small town and love a good cup of coffee. We also have both previously worked as baristas. It made sense that we would tell a story that we are familiar with, and we would love if you would help us get our story, crazy as it might be, out into the world!

Additionally, as creatives who are relatively new to this industry, it is so important to build a solid resume and have excellent material to show what we can do. Buck's would provide us this opportunity. Supporting Buck's would mean supporting the dreams of two (very cool) artists.

A SINCERE THANK YOU

Asking for money is always a weird and difficult thing, and it is not one that we take lightly. We value that you have even read down this far and taken the time to consider donating to Buck's. Whether you hit that donate button or not, THANK YOU for being here! We could not make this project happen without the support of people like you! 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Some people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Send this campaign to someone you know who might be interested in donating!
  • Follow and share our social media pages: @bucksthewebseries (on Instagram and Facebook)
  • Donate your time: we'd love more help on set! Whether you're a make-up artist, great at keeping things tidy, or want to take behind the scenes photos for us, we'd love to have your help! Our email is bucksthewebseries@gmail.com.

Production Costs: This is our largest expense and includes all things needed to produce a film: lights, camera, action! 
Location Rental: good locations = a good looking web series
Wardrobe, Props, Set Dressing: these details ensure that Buck's looks like... Buck's! 

WHAT IF YOU EXCEED YOUR GOAL?
First of all, that would be AMAZING! Second, here's how we would use that money:

Crew and Actor salaries: At this point, our amazing cast and crew are volunteers. Exceeding our goal would mean we could pay them for their time and hard work.
Food for the Cast and Crew: A well fed cast and crew is a happy cast and crew!
Festival Fees: We believe strongly in Buck's and our ability to make a great web series, SO we plan to enter Buck's into festivals. Unfortunately, entering things into festivals is not free.


WHY SUPPORT BUCK'S?
As we thought about what story we wanted to tell we realized that there isn't a show out there that tells the stories of baristas, and very few stories set in small towns. Both of us are from a small town and love a good cup of coffee. We also have both previously worked as baristas. It made sense that we would tell a story that we are familiar with, and we would love if you would help us get our story, crazy as it might be, out into the world!
Additionally, as creatives who are relatively new to this industry, it is so important to build a solid resume and have excellent material to show what we can do. Buck's would provide us this opportunity. Supporting Buck's would mean supporting the dreams of two (very cool) artists.

A SINCERE THANK YOU
Asking for money is always a weird and difficult thing, and it is not one that we take lightly. We value that you have even read down this far and taken the time to consider donating to Buck's. Whether you hit that donate button or not, THANK YOU for being here! We could not make this project happen without the support of people like you! 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
Some people just can't contribute monetarily, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Send this campaign to someone you know who might be interested in donating!
Follow and share our social media pages: @bucksthewebseries (on Instagram and Facebook)
Donate your time: we'd love more help on set! Whether you're a make-up artist, great at keeping things tidy, or want to take behind the scenes photos for us, we'd love to have your help! Our email is bucksthewebseries@gmail.com.

story:
Hey guys, I'm Aaron and I make stuff!

Many of you may remember my 3D SketchUp model that I made and posted about on Instagram. 

Since posting, many people have asked if I am going to purchase and build the actual LEGO model. Some asked if I would build it and stream the build! 

I love this idea AND I want to use it to help people in need... SO here is what I am thinking.

How about I ask you all to send money my way and I buy the LEGO Millennium Falcon set live, for everyone to watch. We can hang out and have a little fun during this quarantine time. ALL donations go to charity to help with the World Health Organization's efforts surrounding the current COVID-19 situation.

Proceeds of this fundraiser will go directly to the World Health Organization's COVID-19 Solidarity Response Fund

What We Need & What You Get

So here is what I see happening... I am going to buy a Millennium Falcon kit and stream the whole thing. The more donations I get, the more I will stream! If I can get a full $500 to donate, I will stream for a full 12 hours on a weekend!!

If I get less than $500, I will still stream the whole thing, but it will be broken up into more, shorter streams.

Your money will all go to charity, but how much you commit will help determine my pain! Yay!

The Impact

While it will be a fun project to be a part of and should be entertaining to watch. The big piece is the people that will be helped by the donations that you make!

Risks & Challenges

No downside! Please donate!!

story:
Summary

An ambitious homicide detective goes on the hunt to bring down a murderous crime boss after the death of a young kid. Frank James is a classical journey told in a modern tale of life and death, love and betrayal; set in a city that is on the verge of civil unrest. 

This story is being told as a web series and is as ambitious as the main character. We have filmed and released the first two episodes which are already garnishing awards at web film festivals across the globe. We are here to ask you to join us on this journey to finish the next six episodes to complete the first season.

These are challenging times and the cast and crew are all hoping to get back to work as soon as possible and these funds will help get us there. They have put so much hard work and care into this project and it shows on the screen.

Almost 70% of the money raised will go to paying the cast and crew. The rest will go to renting the gear from small companies and for paying for permits and locations. One of the locations from the second episode was rented from a home for dance students attending a school and the money we payed went towards helping them. So every little bit helps not just us but with a conscious effort others in need as well.

Awards for Episode One and Two

We are hitting the festival circuit with our first two episodes and have already garnered several awards.

New York Independent Film Awards - Best Web Series - Monthly Edition

Oniros Film Festival - Best Web Series - Monthly Edition

Festigious Film Festival - Best Web Series - Monthly Edition

Indie Film Fest - Outstanding Achievement Web & New Media

Indie Film Fest - Winner - Best Original Song "Night Lies"

We are also in the official selection for the Valley Film Festival in August, 2020 which is a fitting venue since we filmed mostly in the San Fernando Valley. Hopefully we will be in a better place with everything then to have a live screening.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming high and shooting for quality. While this amount may not get us everything we want, we hope that it will get us everything we need. Budgeting for each episode will vary and we will have to make choices once we reach the end of the fundraiser. 

Each episode will vary in budget and will be filmed on the same schedule. But all of it will go to the best quality production possible.

We have some exciting perks lined up, some for those who just want to contribute and put your names on the screen and others that are fun and worth their cost.

    

Who We Are

My name is Jon Massey - I’m the writer, director, producer and basic show runner of the web series. I’m also an Emmy nominated visual effects supervisor working on 9-1-1 on Fox. This story is based on a feature film I wrote. I’ve decided to put it out into the world as a web series and see how far I can get with your help. I’ve written many projects and directed a short film that played through the festivals years ago. I'm leaning in on directing and writing and I welcome you on this journey to help make it succeed.

Chris Muto is Frank James.  An actor on the rise who has performed in some of televisions best shows. His credits include The Orville, General Hospital, Grey's Anatomy and Scandal. I'm very excited to be working with Chris on this project and hope you will follow him along on his hero's path.

Angie Patterson is Maria James.  Goliath, American Crime Story, Brooklyn Nine-Nine and The Mindy Project have all showcased her wide ranging talents from drama to comedy. We couldn't be more thrilled to have her on board.

Toni Robison-May and Fred Mata round out our detectives and are both extremely talented up and comers in the acting world. You’ll be seeing more of them and not just on Frank James.

Drew Ganyer is our Cinematographer. A talented master with lights and cameras. A professional in the industry who is on his way up.

Emily Streetz is our Editor.  A professional assistant editor in television working on high profile material like Lost in Space. She always gave me the best notes on True Blood when I was the vfx supervisor. A true talent.

Matthew Wang is our Composer and along with Becca Krueger is contributing award winning original music for our show. I think you'll agree they are both someone you'll be hearing a lot about.

Che Landon is our Co-Producer & Casting Director. A focused talent who is an immense contributor to any project she is involved in. Also a talented actor. Look for her in episode Two.

 

Risks & Challenges

There are many risks and challenges in accomplishing the story we are trying to tell. Independent film and TV is almost an impossible task given all of the hurdles one must overcome. But it’s a passion of ours and one that we don’t take lightly. We are driven to see this through and welcome your input and devotion as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know these are challenging times and many of us are not working or don’t have the extra funds to support passion projects. And we know that there are many other services that are in need that even we can agree are of a more direct use of your funds. But I believe in this story and one that is worth telling and all of us are committed to this project. If you’re not able to contribute maybe you know someone who might or maybe even just pass on the shout out. Everything and anything will be welcomed.

Thank you so much for your time.

We hope you are all being well and staying safe.

I need ride or die motherfuckers that aren't afraid to get their hands dirty. I need people that will breathe, eat and sleep MobKing. I am the real deal and I need people that are just as real.

I don't do dope, I am dope.

If you know other people that are as hard as I am, let them know where they can find me: https://www.facebook.com/MobKingCiroDapagio?hc_...

story:
Short Summary

My name is Drew Hance! I graduated from the Minneapolis College of Art and Design in 2016 with a degree in Web and Multimedia. During my time there I studied and practiced film and performance art. Since I was a kid I've been interested in making videos, jokes, and dancing around like an idiot. This project is the amalgamation of my different artistic outlets in one absurd package.

What We Need & What You Get

Proud to say that Drew's Mystery Hour 3 will be paying over $800 to local Minneapolis artists!!!

This money is being used ENTIRELY towards the show. It will go towards props, music, stage construction, hired help, poster design and printing, and  paying the guest comedians that perform on the night of the Mystery Hour.

In return for your donations you will receive access to the Mystery Hour videos, exclusive unedited footage, props, and more!

Risks & Challenges

I'm planning on spending this money either way, I'm just trying break even on the show and not end up in the red! Anything helps!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this! Share the facebook page! Or best yet come to Drew's Mystery Hour 3 at Day Block Brewing Company in Minneapolis, MN on 4/20/19 for FREE! (21+)

I also accept Venmo (@Drew-Hance) and Paypal (andrewmhance@gmail.com)

https://www.facebook.com/pg/DrewsMysteryHour

story:
What’s on the Gaming Historian Volume 1 Blu-ray?

It’s finally here! For the first time ever, you can own the Gaming Historian on Blu-ray. I love a good value, so I’ve packed this region-free Blu-ray with tons of exclusive, never-before-seen content. And when I say that this content is exclusive, I mean it. All of the extras (including the 20-minute episode on the Grand Theft Auto “hot coffee” mod) will only be available on this Blu-ray and will never appear on YouTube.

The Gaming Historian Volume 1 Blu-ray Includes:

  • 16 classic episodes, including: The Story of Super Mario Bros 2, History of LJN, History of Wolfenstein, Power Glove, Sega Nomad, Tengen: Atari Games vs. Nintendo, Nintendo's 3 Biggest Mistakes, Mega Man on Sega, Sharp NES TV, The Life of Satoru Iwata, Mario's Secret Game Boy Games, Sega Visions Magazine, Final Fantasy Mystic Quest, Ristar, Conquest of the Crystal Palace, and Top 10 Birds in Video Games. Every episode has been remastered in the highest quality possible.
  • Exclusive: Audio commentary on every episode, featuring special guests ProJared, The Completionist, Lazy Game Reviews, Pixel Dan, Derek Alexander (SSFF), PushingUpRoses, and Joey “Roo” DeSena.
  • Exclusive: A 20-minute episode on the controversial Grand Theft Auto “hot coffee” mod. The hot coffee mod had a huge impact on the industry. It inspired lawsuits, government intervention, and permanently changed the way the ESRB reviews games.
  • Exclusive: A tour of Norm’s new game room!
  • Exclusive: A new, updated history of the show.
  • Exclusive: An episode of Cookin’ with Norm! Learn how to make Norm’s spicy North Carolina BBQ.


Why should I pre-order?

I’m glad you asked! People who pre-order through the Indiegogo campaign will be the first to receive the Blu-ray. You can order it for $20, or you can do a bundle deal and get a t-shirt and the Blu-ray for $30. The Blu-ray is region free and we ship internationally!

But there’s more to it than that. When you pre-order a Blu-ray, you’re doing us a big favor. We are professionally producing these Blu-rays and pre orders help cover that upfront production cost. The number of pre orders also help us determine how many Blu-rays to order in general.

For t-shirt size information, click here (at bottom of page)


About the show

Welcome! I’m Norman Caruso. I created the Gaming Historian almost ten years ago while I was working on my bachelor’s degree in history at Elizabeth City State University. I loved studying history, and loved video games too, so I created a YouTube documentary series exploring the history of video games. The rest, as they say, is history!

It’s hard to believe that, all these years later, my wife and I work on the show full time. And it’s even harder to believe that we’re finally putting out a Blu-ray. This is something that we’ve talked about doing -- and that fans have requested -- for years.

It’s taken a lot of time and hard work, but we’ve created a Blu-ray that’s packed with hours of exclusive content, as well as some of our favorite episodes. We hope you enjoy it and that you learn something along the way.

As always, thanks for watching!
