story:
THE WHAT

“Ensemble” is a fast-paced, character-driven, half-hour, student television comedy mini-series that highlights the complexity and hilarity of college conservatory theatre.

From tyrannical directors, to the pressure cookers of working together to make a 24-hour play festival happen, to staging an original rap musical, this show explores nuance and gut-busting irony of the shows within a show - all set to original CLASSIC ROCK music.

Faster-paced and less self-deprecating than Glee, and less cheesy and more self-aware than High School Musical. Think mockumentary-style confessionals with college students, and a stage not big enough for all of them.

 

THE WHY

“Ensemble” was created by Comedy Television Writers of USC, a student organization dedicated to creating a half-hour comedy writers room environment and producing student-made television work. The team comes from various schools within USC: the School of Cinematic Arts, the School of Dramatic Arts, and the Thornton School of Music.

 

With Ensemble, the team hopes to create meaningful, collaborative, comedy-driven content and further the creative education received at USC, past the walls of a classroom. We are devoted to writing characters of diversity–from various racial, ethnic, religious, and sexual backgrounds–and sharing our love for the visual and performing arts. “Ensemble” is a love letter to the theatre community, and we hope to bring the heart, humor, and inclusiveness of this community to a television audience.

 

THE HOW

We are shooting Episodes 4, 5, and 6. To cover our production costs for industry-standard cameras, lighting, and sound equipment, and support our incredibly dedicated and hardworking cast and crew, we need your help!

Everything we receive on this page will go towards building the world of "Ensemble"! We are producing more content than any other School of Cinematic Arts student production has done before. With any extra funds, we’ll be able to submit to festivals (like the Student Emmys!) and keep the show going past its completion.

Thank you so much for helping "Ensemble" be the best show it can be and seeing the series through to the end!

 

THE WHO

Our main AND supporting cast includes students from USC’s School of Dramatic Arts.

 

And here are some of the people working behind-the-scenes to bring this project to life:

 

Mary Bronaugh (Creator/Showrunner) is a B.F.A. Writing for Screen and Television student at USC who loves to write and direct for student television and theatre, perform improvisational comedy, write poetry, and romanticize men she doesn't even know (which is to say, perform improvisational comedy and write poetry). She is the head staff writer and Co-Executive Producer of Puns for Ensemble, and her favorite parts of her job include being creatively smacked down by Carl Albert in the writers' room, responding by threatening to fire him, and cowering in fear and dismay as all of the other writers then threaten to overthrow "this autocracy!".

 

Lexie Chu (Lead Series Producer/Showrunner) cites all pre-2000’s Disney musical soundtracks as her life source. Other than aspiring to bridge the gap between theatre and film through producing, she adores voice directing and spending her free time watching more animated children's programming than she’d like to admit. She also runs a noodle review/enthusiast blog even though her parents have encouraged her to pursue healthier activities, like yoga to grow taller. Lexie currently studies Film & Television Production with a minor in Theatre at USC’s Schools of Cinematic and Dramatic Arts.

 

Maya Vyas (Supervising Producer) is a middle child and a Writing for Screen and Television major in The School of Cinematic Arts. She was born in a small town in Ohio called Tipp City and bears an immense amount of pride for her Middle American roots (Seriously, she never shuts up about it.) As a child, Maya realized she wasn’t good at many things including, but not limited to, soccer, basketball, skiing, playing any instrument, dancing and professional croquet. These failures translated into writing and that is how she became who she is today. In turn, Maya would like to encourage failure. Not because you necessarily learn anything from it, but just because it would be funny.

 

Justice Schiappa (Supervising Producer) is a B.F.A. Writing for Screen and Television student at USC who got his start writing battle plans for his Star Wars LEGOs. A theater kid since a young age, Justice has a passion for performance and appreciation for all parts of the creative process including directing, writing, and costume design. He enjoys long walks to the fridge at 2 am while discussing what’s out there among the stars. His favorite thing to do on set is providing witty commentary that leaves everybody in witch-like cackling.

 

Elizabeth Keller (Producer) is an ex-theater kid who is still bitter about the way Glee ended, making her even more grateful for the opportunity to work on Ensemble. She loves sushi, stuffed bears, and bossing people around. She is currently studying Cinema & Media Studies at the USC School of Cinematic Arts.

 

Carl Albert (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) got his start with the highest form of writing – fanfiction – and soon enough found himself excited by the prospect of filmmaking when he discovered the Oscar-nominated psychological thriller-drama, Marvel’s The Avengers. He seeks only to affect his audience with his work in a passionately emotional, and possibly even lover-like way, such as by making them throw up or pee their pants laughing. In his free time, Carl enjoys a good book, long walks on the beach at sunset, and hearing the cries of his fallen enemies. He is most influenced by the reincarnation of William Shakespeare, or, as his legion of fans known him, Mr. Worldwide aka Pitbull aka Armando-freaking-Perez, and his now iconic quote, ‘Big News, Pitbull, Tom Cruise, Mumbai.’"

 

Natalie Cohn-Aronoff (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) hails from Princeton, New Jersey, and has considerable experience with theatre, prose, and self-deprecating humor - which somehow landed her in film school. She is currently in the USC Writing for Screen and Television program, where she seeks to complicate the stories we tell with diverse characters whose lives are underrepresented on screen, relentless feminist critique, and an acerbic wit. Natalie can usually be found method acting extroversion, watching hockey, or weeping over Les Misérables. Though she is Israeli and American by citizenship, she’s a Canadian at heart. She hopes one day to be the first screenwriter-attorney-senator.

 

Becca Mann (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) is a Writing for Screen and Television major at USC. Never happy with the way books or TV series ended, Becca decided she wanted to be the one controlling the story, igniting a passion for writing. In addition, Becca is a member of the USA Swimming National Team and loves chocolate, traveling, pretending she can sing, and the ocean. She also published a novel two years ago called The Stolen Dragon of Quanx, which was a finalist in the 2015 IAN Book of the Year Awards.

 

Chasey Ridgley (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) grew up in Omaha, Nebraska and became enamoured with television at an early age, deciding to become a screenwriter. She is currently earning her Bachelor's of Fine Arts at University of Southern California in Writing for Screen and Television. She enjoys long hikes, writing, and dogs.

 

Anthony Sabatino (Composer) is an award-winning composer from Kansas, who graduated from Berklee College of Music with a dual major in Film Scoring, and Electronic Production & Design with a minor in Conducting. He is currently a student in the prestigious Screen Scoring Program at USC and has worked on over 50 professional and student film, TV, video game, and concert works.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We understand not everyone can donate, but there are many ways you can help support the show:

  • Tell others about Ensemble!
  • Watch and share our Pilot!
  • If you’re as excited as us to make this show, please like, share, and spread our Indiegogo campaign and our Facebook Page! Find us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/ensembleminiseries/.

Every bit counts, and we will keep you updated with behind-the-scenes news every step of the way! Thank you ALL again for your support!
story_txt:
THE WHAT“Ensemble” is a fast-paced, character-driven, half-hour, student television comedy mini-series that highlights the complexity and hilarity of college conservatory theatre.From tyrannical directors, to the pressure cookers of working together to make a 24-hour play festival happen, to staging an original rap musical, this show explores nuance and gut-busting irony of the shows within a show - all set to original CLASSIC ROCK music.Faster-paced and less self-deprecating than Glee, and less cheesy and more self-aware than High School Musical. Think mockumentary-style confessionals with college students, and a stage not big enough for all of them. THE WHY“Ensemble” was created by Comedy Television Writers of USC, a student organization dedicated to creating a half-hour comedy writers room environment and producing student-made television work. The team comes from various schools within USC: the School of Cinematic Arts, the School of Dramatic Arts, and the Thornton School of Music. With Ensemble, the team hopes to create meaningful, collaborative, comedy-driven content and further the creative education received at USC, past the walls of a classroom. We are devoted to writing characters of diversity–from various racial, ethnic, religious, and sexual backgrounds–and sharing our love for the visual and performing arts. “Ensemble” is a love letter to the theatre community, and we hope to bring the heart, humor, and inclusiveness of this community to a television audience. THE HOWWe are shooting Episodes 4, 5, and 6. To cover our production costs for industry-standard cameras, lighting, and sound equipment, and support our incredibly dedicated and hardworking cast and crew, we need your help!Everything we receive on this page will go towards building the world of "Ensemble"! We are producing more content than any other School of Cinematic Arts student production has done before. With any extra funds, we’ll be able to submit to festivals (like the Student Emmys!) and keep the show going past its completion.Thank you so much for helping "Ensemble" be the best show it can be and seeing the series through to the end! THE WHOOur main AND supporting cast includes students from USC’s School of Dramatic Arts. And here are some of the people working behind-the-scenes to bring this project to life: Mary Bronaugh (Creator/Showrunner) is a B.F.A. Writing for Screen and Television student at USC who loves to write and direct for student television and theatre, perform improvisational comedy, write poetry, and romanticize men she doesn't even know (which is to say, perform improvisational comedy and write poetry). She is the head staff writer and Co-Executive Producer of Puns for Ensemble, and her favorite parts of her job include being creatively smacked down by Carl Albert in the writers' room, responding by threatening to fire him, and cowering in fear and dismay as all of the other writers then threaten to overthrow "this autocracy!". Lexie Chu (Lead Series Producer/Showrunner) cites all pre-2000’s Disney musical soundtracks as her life source. Other than aspiring to bridge the gap between theatre and film through producing, she adores voice directing and spending her free time watching more animated children's programming than she’d like to admit. She also runs a noodle review/enthusiast blog even though her parents have encouraged her to pursue healthier activities, like yoga to grow taller. Lexie currently studies Film & Television Production with a minor in Theatre at USC’s Schools of Cinematic and Dramatic Arts. Maya Vyas (Supervising Producer) is a middle child and a Writing for Screen and Television major in The School of Cinematic Arts. She was born in a small town in Ohio called Tipp City and bears an immense amount of pride for her Middle American roots (Seriously, she never shuts up about it.) As a child, Maya realized she wasn’t good at many things including, but not limited to, soccer, basketball, skiing, playing any instrument, dancing and professional croquet. These failures translated into writing and that is how she became who she is today. In turn, Maya would like to encourage failure. Not because you necessarily learn anything from it, but just because it would be funny. Justice Schiappa (Supervising Producer) is a B.F.A. Writing for Screen and Television student at USC who got his start writing battle plans for his Star Wars LEGOs. A theater kid since a young age, Justice has a passion for performance and appreciation for all parts of the creative process including directing, writing, and costume design. He enjoys long walks to the fridge at 2 am while discussing what’s out there among the stars. His favorite thing to do on set is providing witty commentary that leaves everybody in witch-like cackling. Elizabeth Keller (Producer) is an ex-theater kid who is still bitter about the way Glee ended, making her even more grateful for the opportunity to work on Ensemble. She loves sushi, stuffed bears, and bossing people around. She is currently studying Cinema & Media Studies at the USC School of Cinematic Arts. Carl Albert (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) got his start with the highest form of writing – fanfiction – and soon enough found himself excited by the prospect of filmmaking when he discovered the Oscar-nominated psychological thriller-drama, Marvel’s The Avengers. He seeks only to affect his audience with his work in a passionately emotional, and possibly even lover-like way, such as by making them throw up or pee their pants laughing. In his free time, Carl enjoys a good book, long walks on the beach at sunset, and hearing the cries of his fallen enemies. He is most influenced by the reincarnation of William Shakespeare, or, as his legion of fans known him, Mr. Worldwide aka Pitbull aka Armando-freaking-Perez, and his now iconic quote, ‘Big News, Pitbull, Tom Cruise, Mumbai.’" Natalie Cohn-Aronoff (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) hails from Princeton, New Jersey, and has considerable experience with theatre, prose, and self-deprecating humor - which somehow landed her in film school. She is currently in the USC Writing for Screen and Television program, where she seeks to complicate the stories we tell with diverse characters whose lives are underrepresented on screen, relentless feminist critique, and an acerbic wit. Natalie can usually be found method acting extroversion, watching hockey, or weeping over Les Misérables. Though she is Israeli and American by citizenship, she’s a Canadian at heart. She hopes one day to be the first screenwriter-attorney-senator. Becca Mann (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) is a Writing for Screen and Television major at USC. Never happy with the way books or TV series ended, Becca decided she wanted to be the one controlling the story, igniting a passion for writing. In addition, Becca is a member of the USA Swimming National Team and loves chocolate, traveling, pretending she can sing, and the ocean. She also published a novel two years ago called The Stolen Dragon of Quanx, which was a finalist in the 2015 IAN Book of the Year Awards. Chasey Ridgley (Staff Writer/Associate Producer) grew up in Omaha, Nebraska and became enamoured with television at an early age, deciding to become a screenwriter. She is currently earning her Bachelor's of Fine Arts at University of Southern California in Writing for Screen and Television. She enjoys long hikes, writing, and dogs. Anthony Sabatino (Composer) is an award-winning composer from Kansas, who graduated from Berklee College of Music with a dual major in Film Scoring, and Electronic Production & Design with a minor in Conducting. He is currently a student in the prestigious Screen Scoring Program at USC and has worked on over 50 professional and student film, TV, video game, and concert works. OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELPWe understand not everyone can donate, but there are many ways you can help support the show:

Tell others about Ensemble!
Watch and share our Pilot!
If you’re as excited as us to make this show, please like, share, and spread our Indiegogo campaign and our Facebook Page! Find us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/ensembleminiseries/.
Every bit counts, and we will keep you updated with behind-the-scenes news every step of the way! Thank you ALL again for your support!

story:
We're looking for your help! Yes, you! Right now we are a group consisting of dozens of college age students looking to have some fun and get some experience with production. We made this show with love and excitement in our hearts and can't wait to bring our magic to life!

With only a few contributions we will be able to fly higher than we ever expected to before and build an immersive world of college, magic, and mermaids! She can't wait to see the magic happen!

Fathoms Below - The Gist

Everyone has secrets that should be kept locked up and kept to the chest. Often we keep these secrets unsaid and kept to ourselves, never to be shared with anyone. But what happens if the secret is let out? For Kai, keeping her secret is life and death. Yet, she is very incredibly bad at keeping it.

What happens when four strangers from across the country, find each other, and bond over what should have been a well-kept secret?

Produced by Mya Stengel and Julia Stitely, Fathoms Below is a coming-of-age ICTV series that follows the adventures of Syd and Kai, freshman roommates as they navigate college life, and the ambitious biology professor Harris Hawthorne, all the while keeping the secret that one of them is a mermaid.

WHO ARE WE?

Producers!

  • My name is Mya Stengel and I'm a freshman attending Ithaca college in order to learn more about Writing and Audio production. Fathoms Below is more than just a school show to me, it became important when my co-producer Julia Stitely proposed the idea of a mermaid show. We both bonded over this idea, but never thought we'd get the chance to make it real! We've spent every week putting hours and work into creating this project. Building a team, creating a cast, and writing scripts. I could not be more excited to see how the show turns out!
  • Hello! Ithaca College Freshman here, Julia Stitely. I'm a Writing for Film, TV, and Emerging Media major at Ithaca College, hoping to learn more and write scripts that will tell important stories. Fathoms Below started because of her and her friend, Mya’s, passion for wanting to do a mermaid show. When the opportunity came, they jumped at the chance. Every day has been dedicated to writing and making the show come to life and that help couldn’t be done without the hard work from the team. 

What are you funding?

We are a college-run production. The college we work for gives us $100 to start off our fundraising, but from there we are on our own. With your help, we will be able to get everything we need to create a wonderfully fantastical show! We need a plethora of different things to get the production running. Such as -->

Film Equipment/Replacements | Costumes | Props | Locations | Kiddie Pool

Once the show completes the post-production stage we will be able to release episodes for anyone to watch. Meaning that you will be able to see what your contributions did for us on-screen while also enjoying a delightful and thrilling story along the way!

Risks & Challenges

We prioritize the safety of our cast and crew. The world has been in a crazy state since the start of the COVID19 pandemic and we want to ensure there is no health or physical risks towards our team.  Once the 2021 school year starts, Ithaca College will be requiring all students and professors to be fully vaccinated. 

In addition to this, we will be filming on-location scenes, in and around pools of water. To prevent any risks in this area we will be hiring an on set lifeguard so as to assure the safety of our mermaid.

Every day of production we are faced with new challenges that we overcome. Production is all new and fun to us, though experience has not once been an issue to our production! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to the funds then that is entirely okay! We are all just trying to get by in this world with what we have and there are other ways to get involved!

If you have any mermaid fanatic friends, share our promo video and donation cite with them!

Do you happen to be a student at Ithaca College? Fantastic! We are always looking for new crew members to help out! 

Get in Contact!

Questions, Concerns, or just want to say hello? Send us an email!

mstengel1@ithaca.edu | jstitely1@ithaca.edu

story:
Origin Story

My name is STEVEN TSAPELAS. In 2007, I was one of the creators of the web series WE NEED GIRLFRIENDS. With my then co-producers Brian Amyot and Angel Acevedo we turned that small, homemade series into a YouTube hit, with millions of views every month and articles in The New York Times, Rolling Stone, Yahoo News, The Guardian Unlimited and numerous other publications. It caught the attention of SEX AND THE CITY producer Darren Star who brought it to Sony and CBS, where it ended up becoming the first web series developed as a sitcom at a major network.

Producing that series was the highlight of my creative life. I am now asking for your help to produce another series that I feel just as passionate about --- a semi-autobiographical nostalgia piece called HOT N' NERDY.  

Now, if I ask you to picture "Comic Con," what do you see? Big celebrities? Massive lines of eager people? Sneak peeks at blockbuster movies starring superheroes punching other superheroes? Absurdly attractive men and women cosplaying as nerdy characters?

It wasn't always that way. In fact, there was a time when merely mentioning the fact that you read comic books made you feel like, well, an outcast. I know because... I was one of those outcasts. I spent most of my young life obsessing over the details of my favorite comic books and sci-fi movies, feeling as though the world would never accept my fringe interests. Back then, I never would have imagined that one day my interests would not only be accepted but mainstream, with comic conventions packed to the gills by people of all ages and genders --- and with movies starring a few of my favorite characters becoming some of the biggest of all time.

In 2014, I began to reflect on that time in my life. I had not only reached an age where I was considered kind of normal . So, I wrote a pilot script titled HOT N' NERDY. I submitted it to the Austin Film Festival and to my great honor, it was accepted into the competition. It's a story that I have always wanted to tell and now I think I have found the form in which I can do it.

HOT N' NERDY is set in the year 2000. It follows two best friends --- the sweet and socially awkward ALAN and the blissfully unaware PHIL. They hang out at dingy comic conventions held in basements and backrooms which are sparsely populated by awkward young men. That is, until, they meet BECKY, a rebel, a trendsetter and the first female they've ever seen at a comic book convention. Becky ends up taking pity on these two dateless nerds and gives them a She's All That-style make-over in order to prepare them for what is coming their way --- a world in which nerds are cool.

 

The plan is to film this July and then complete post-production by this fall, with the end goal being turning this into an ongoing series which chronicles the lives of comic convention nerds from 2000 all the way through present day.

 

Avengers Assemble

CAST: 

GALYA LOEB -- Galya is so excited to be a part of Hot N' Nerdy! She is a graduate of Northwestern University’s Theatre Program and The Second City Conservatory. Some of her Chicago theatre credits include: Jane Eyre (u/s Jane, Lifeline Theatre); Orange is the New Comeback (Public House Theatre); Echo, a Reading (Chicago Dramatists), Girl Found, a Reading (Greenhouse Theatre Center); and Failmix with Raisins, The Powers that Be-Little, DeBased on a True Story, and Swing for the Picket Fences (The Second City Training Center). Outside of Chicago, her stage credits include originating the role of Julie in the new play The Chaotic Art of Life at Andrews Hall in Sonoma, CA. On camera, she has acted in I'm Literally Dying, a satirical short film, and has guest starred in the web series Single... And Bad At It and an episode of The Carbonaro Effect, which will be airing on truTV later this year. 

JUSTIN CHESNEY --- Justin Chesney is a NYC-based Actor and graduate of Hofstra University's BFA performance program. Past New York credits include King John (Fools and Kings Project) and Scum: A New Play. He currently performs off-broadway at New World Stages in "The Imbible". He's a super hero buff and thrilled to be working on a series that speaks so accurately to his true and final form.

KELAND ALAKA'I SARNO - Keland Alaka'i Sarno is an actor based out of NYC.  He graduated from Wagner College in 2014 with a BA in Theatre and Speech.  He has performed at a number of regional theatres over the past few years, notably Allenberry Playhouse, Geva Theatre and Cape Playhouse.  When not performing, Keland can be found gaming or daydreaming about the cosmos!  

CHANDLER LOVELLE - Chandler Lovelle is an actor/singer/model based in NYC. She grew up in sunny South Florida doing musical theatre and went on to major in musical theatre at Texas State University. There she discovered her love for film and tv work. She has costarred in Netflix’s Bloodline, CBS’s Blue Bloods, Netflix’s upcoming show Brainchild, and the upcoming movie Belleville Cop. She apparently only does projects that start with “B”...until now. She’s very excited to join the cast of Hot N’ Nerdy. Instagram: @ChandlerLovelle

 

JONATHAN HYPPOLITE --- Jonathan graduated from Farleigh Dickinson University in 2011 with a Masters in Professional Communication. In 2014, an impromptu stand-up routine for The Trisha Goddard Show turned J Hype into the permanent warm up entertainer for shows like Crazy Talk, The Maury Show and The Jerry Springer Show. Now, 2018 finds J Hype within the world of Trivia, hosting a weekly trivia game show a few blocks away from NBCUniversal’s Stamford Media Center as well as hosting a live taping one-of-a-kind game show, called Do You Know Black, that celebrates and educates on Black history and culture in a fun and interactive format in New York City.

BELLA McGRATH --- Bella McGrath is an NYC based actress with a repressed nerdy side. She is grateful to represent She Hulk in all her green glory! A BFA Musical Theater graduate from Nazareth College, some favorite credits include ...Spelling Bee and A Christmas Carol at Geva Theater. Previous film credits are Jeffrey Kills A Guy, Multiplex, and Ciconia Ciconia. She would like to thank her friends and family for their unending support. 

CREW ---

STEVEN TSAPELAS - Writer/Creator/Executive Producer - Steven Tsapelas is a graduate of Hofstra University. He co-created We Need Girlfriends, which in 2007 became the first web series developed into a major network sitcom when it was purchased by Sony Pictures and CBS. He has written and directed many award-winning short films, includingTeenage Superhero Pregnancy Scare and Be My Valentine, Franny Canada. He has worked on many documentary television shows and has also written content for Pound Puppies, Marvel and numerous other companies. He is currently the Supervising Promo Producer at SmashPoint CreativeWorks in Stamford. Steven was born in Queens but raised on Long Island. He met his wife, Ana Afloarei, when they were both living in Los Angeles. They currently live in Connecticut with their two children, and Steven's large collection of vintage VHS tapes.

BECCA VALENTE - Supervising Producer - Becca Valente graduated from Wagner College in 2014 with a B.S. in Arts Administration.  Immediately after graduation, she began her television career as a production assistant on Beat Bobby Flay.  Since then, she has worked on over fifteen productions and has worked for NBCUniversal as a production coordinator for the past three years.  Originally from a small log cabin in the woods of New Hampshire, she now resides in Connecticut.

ROBERT VORNKAHL- Director - Robert holds a Bachelor of Arts in Film Studies and Production from Hofstra University where he was the School of Communications Film Student of Year and winner of Best in Show and Best Cinematography for his thesis film Ellipsis. Now based in Los Angeles, he has worked for over a decade as a freelance Director, Director of Photography, Lighting Director, Writer and Editor. In 2015 Robert completed his first feature film Completely Normal was accepted to over 20 festivals internationally and won four Best Feature awards and a host of other awards, such as Best Ensemble Cast and Best Cinematography, as well as garnering many other nominations, including Best Director, Best Actor, and Best Actress. The film was distributed on Amazon Prime and Vimeo. In 2017, Robert’s second film Nowhere, Michigan premiered at the New York City Independent Film festival and has been accepted to over 25 Film Festivals internationally and has won a number of awards including Best Feature, Best Actors, Best Cinematography and Best Director. Born in White Plains, NY but transplanted to Iron Mountain, Michigan in the 1980’s, Robert enjoys drawing, the Green Bay Packers, the NASA space program, Instagraming airline emergency card art while traveling, looking too closely at brush work on classic paintings, designing T-shirts, and going to small mom and pop run movie theaters.

 

Music:

We have secured the rights to use music from the popular Long Island ska band Step Lively's 1998 debut album The Trigger Effect. This music was an integral part of my teenage years, always playing in my car or one of my friend's cars and I was even lucky enough to go to high school with the band's drummer Mike Rubenstein. I'm incredibly excited to have their music featured in this! 

 

The Plan

We need enough funds for crew, equipment, locations and set-builds. The perks we are offering are unique and fun --- such as a VHS and personal comic books from my collection. But there are also real opportunities to be involved, with many producer credits

If we don't reach out entire goal, we will reconvene to see how much of the shooting script we can keep intact. If we go above and beyond our entire goal, we can film more episodes of Hot N' Nerdy.

Every dollar helps and every social media share helps. Please, please, please share this with your friends and family on Facebook, MySpace, AOL Instant Messenger, that one with the blue bird, Insta-whatever and wherever else you can think of!

Thank you for taking the time to visit this page! We are all SO EXCITED about this project!

 

P.S. Thank you to Brian Harnick for shooting the campaign video and John Perno for editing it!

JUSTIN CHESNEY --- Justin Chesney is a NYC-based Actor and graduate of Hofstra University's BFA performance program. Past New York credits include King John (Fools and Kings Project) and Scum: A New Play. He currently performs off-broadway at New World Stages in "The Imbible". He's a super hero buff and thrilled to be working on a series that speaks so accurately to his true and final form.

KELAND ALAKA'I SARNO - Keland Alaka'i Sarno is an actor based out of NYC.  He graduated from Wagner College in 2014 with a BA in Theatre and Speech.  He has performed at a number of regional theatres over the past few years, notably Allenberry Playhouse, Geva Theatre and Cape Playhouse.  When not performing, Keland can be found gaming or daydreaming about the cosmos!  

CHANDLER LOVELLE - Chandler Lovelle is an actor/singer/model based in NYC. She grew up in sunny South Florida doing musical theatre and went on to major in musical theatre at Texas State University. There she discovered her love for film and tv work. She has costarred in Netflix’s Bloodline, CBS’s Blue Bloods, Netflix’s upcoming show Brainchild, and the upcoming movie Belleville Cop. She apparently only does projects that start with “B”...until now. She’s very excited to join the cast of Hot N’ Nerdy. Instagram: @ChandlerLovelle
 

JONATHAN HYPPOLITE --- Jonathan graduated from Farleigh Dickinson University in 2011 with a Masters in Professional Communication. In 2014, an impromptu stand-up routine for The Trisha Goddard Show turned J Hype into the permanent warm up entertainer for shows like Crazy Talk, The Maury Show and The Jerry Springer Show. Now, 2018 finds J Hype within the world of Trivia, hosting a weekly trivia game show a few blocks away from NBCUniversal’s Stamford Media Center as well as hosting a live taping one-of-a-kind game show, called Do You Know Black, that celebrates and educates on Black history and culture in a fun and interactive format in New York City.

BELLA McGRATH --- Bella McGrath is an NYC based actress with a repressed nerdy side. She is grateful to represent She Hulk in all her green glory! A BFA Musical Theater graduate from Nazareth College, some favorite credits include ...Spelling Bee and A Christmas Carol at Geva Theater. Previous film credits are Jeffrey Kills A Guy, Multiplex, and Ciconia Ciconia. She would like to thank her friends and family for their unending support. 
CREW ---
STEVEN TSAPELAS - Writer/Creator/Executive Producer - Steven Tsapelas is a graduate of Hofstra University. He co-created We Need Girlfriends, which in 2007 became the first web series developed into a major network sitcom when it was purchased by Sony Pictures and CBS. He has written and directed many award-winning short films, includingTeenage Superhero Pregnancy Scare and Be My Valentine, Franny Canada. He has worked on many documentary television shows and has also written content for Pound Puppies, Marvel and numerous other companies. He is currently the Supervising Promo Producer at SmashPoint CreativeWorks in Stamford. Steven was born in Queens but raised on Long Island. He met his wife, Ana Afloarei, when they were both living in Los Angeles. They currently live in Connecticut with their two children, and Steven's large collection of vintage VHS tapes.
BECCA VALENTE - Supervising Producer - Becca Valente graduated from Wagner College in 2014 with a B.S. in Arts Administration.  Immediately after graduation, she began her television career as a production assistant on Beat Bobby Flay.  Since then, she has worked on over fifteen productions and has worked for NBCUniversal as a production coordinator for the past three years.  Originally from a small log cabin in the woods of New Hampshire, she now resides in Connecticut.
ROBERT VORNKAHL- Director - Robert holds a Bachelor of Arts in Film Studies and Production from Hofstra University where he was the School of Communications Film Student of Year and winner of Best in Show and Best Cinematography for his thesis film Ellipsis. Now based in Los Angeles, he has worked for over a decade as a freelance Director, Director of Photography, Lighting Director, Writer and Editor. In 2015 Robert completed his first feature film Completely Normal was accepted to over 20 festivals internationally and won four Best Feature awards and a host of other awards, such as Best Ensemble Cast and Best Cinematography, as well as garnering many other nominations, including Best Director, Best Actor, and Best Actress. The film was distributed on Amazon Prime and Vimeo. In 2017, Robert’s second film Nowhere, Michigan premiered at the New York City Independent Film festival and has been accepted to over 25 Film Festivals internationally and has won a number of awards including Best Feature, Best Actors, Best Cinematography and Best Director. Born in White Plains, NY but transplanted to Iron Mountain, Michigan in the 1980’s, Robert enjoys drawing, the Green Bay Packers, the NASA space program, Instagraming airline emergency card art while traveling, looking too closely at brush work on classic paintings, designing T-shirts, and going to small mom and pop run movie theaters.
 
Music:
We have secured the rights to use music from the popular Long Island ska band Step Lively's 1998 debut album The Trigger Effect. This music was an integral part of my teenage years, always playing in my car or one of my friend's cars and I was even lucky enough to go to high school with the band's drummer Mike Rubenstein. I'm incredibly excited to have their music featured in this! 

 
The Plan
We need enough funds for crew, equipment, locations and set-builds. The perks we are offering are unique and fun --- such as a VHS and personal comic books from my collection. But there are also real opportunities to be involved, with many producer credits
If we don't reach out entire goal, we will reconvene to see how much of the shooting script we can keep intact. If we go above and beyond our entire goal, we can film more episodes of Hot N' Nerdy.

Every dollar helps and every social media share helps. Please, please, please share this with your friends and family on Facebook, MySpace, AOL Instant Messenger, that one with the blue bird, Insta-whatever and wherever else you can think of!
Thank you for taking the time to visit this page! We are all SO EXCITED about this project!
 
P.S. Thank you to Brian Harnick for shooting the campaign video and John Perno for editing it!

story:
What is "The Pineapple Diaries"? / De que se trata, "Diarios de la Piña"? #Pineapple3Please

"The Pineapple Diaries" is a comedic web series, written and directed by Paloma Valenzuela ­­brought to you by La Gringa Loca Productions! The show produced its second season in 2016 and in 2019 we would love to produce and launch the third season! 

www.thepineapplediariesshow.com

In our first two seasons we saw our characters going through the unique journey that is being una mujer in her late 20s. Our characters were discovering the beauty of their natural hair, sharing stories from their families in the Dominican Republic and Puerto Rico, they were getting over recent divorces, moving into new apartments, following their dreams and hopeful career paths, finding love, losing love, grappling with loves lost in the past, learning how to date in this digital world, dealing with their parents and working through the complexities how to be a Latina-Americana and navigating the world through the lens of two distinct cultures and worlds. 

In Season Three we return to another summer in the city of Boston, in 2019. Where are our characters now? How are they now navigating their adult lives now in their 30s? In Season Three we will explore the lives of these characters and the absurdities of the daily situations they deal with.

////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////


“Diarios De La Piña” es una serie web de comedia, escrita y dirigida por Paloma Valenzuela y producida por La Gringa Loca Productions. El programa produjo su segunda temporada en 2016 y en 2019 nos encantaría producir y lanzar la tercera temporada!

En nuestras primeras dos temporadas vimos a nuestros personajes atravesar el viaje complejo de ser una mujer en sus casi-30 años. Nuestros personajes descubrieron la belleza de su cabello natural, compartieron historias de sus familias en República Dominicana y Puerto Rico, superaron divorcios recientes, se mudaron a nuevos apartamentos, siguieron sus sueños, careras y esperanzas — encontraron el amor, perdieron el amor, lidiaron con los amores perdidos del pasado y navegaron las complejidades de cómo ser una latina americana y navegar por el mundo a través de la lente de dos culturas y dos mundos distintos.

En la tercera temporada volvemos a otro verano en la ciudad de Boston, en 2019. ¿Dónde están nuestros personajes ahora? ¿Cómo están navegando sus vidas ahora como adultas en sus 30 años? En la tercera temporada exploraremos las vidas de estos personajes y las situaciones absurdas que le pasan cotidianamente. 
 

 

How can you help us with Season Three?/Como nos pueden ayudar con la tercera temporada? #Pineapple3Please

 

With the help of our viewers we were able to produce Seasons One and Two! In gearing up to produce Season Three we would love your help with production!

Your Contributions for Season Three will Help:


1.) With daily production costs: food, water, transportation and extras.

2.) With the purchase improved equipment for sound recording and the rentals for other equipment needed. 

3.) The fees for actors and crew members who will be dedicating almost two months of their time for this project! Artists have bills too!
4.) With the budget for costumes, make-up and props. 

5.) With the budget for our editors in post-production. 

//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Estamos tan agradecidos por la ayuda que recibimos de nuestros televidentes en la producción de la primera y segunda temporada! En preparación de producir la tercera temporada nos encantaríamos la ayuda de todos ustedes!

 
Sus Contribuciones Nos Ayudarán Con:


1.) Los costos diarios de producción: comida, agua, transporte y extras. 

2.) La compra de equipos de sonido y la renta del resto de los equipos. 

3.) El presupuesto para pagar a los actores y crew. Nuestro equipo estarían dedicando casi 2 meses de su tiempo en la grabación de esta temporada y los artistas tienen que pagar las facturas también! 

4.) El presupuesto para vestuario, maquillaje y utilería. 

5.) El pago para nuestros editores en post-producción

Other Ways You Can Help "The Pineapple Diaries" Season Two/ Otras Formas de Darnos su Ayuda en Nuestra Segunda Temporada: #Pineapple3Please


If you are unable to make a contribution today but are still excited about this project and really want to help, here are ways you can help:

1.) Please spread the word by: sending emails with the link to this campaign, share on Facebook, Instagram or Twitter! Be sure to hashtag #ThePineappleDiaries


2.) Like/Follow/Subscribe to La Gringa Loca on Youtube, Instagram and Facebook.

3.) Take a picture of yourself watching Seasons One or Two of the show on Youtube, post it on social media with the hashtag #ThePineappleDiaries and encourage people to check out the show when it airs on Youtube!

4.) Watch Season One & Two! Comment and Share! Use the hashtag #Pineapple3Please

5.) Send us positive vibes! 

////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////

Si no se pueden hacer una contribución hoy, pero todavía quieren ayudar con este proyecto aquí hay maneras de ayudar:

1.) Corre la voz a través de: Email con el link de esta campaña , compartir en Facebook , Instagram o Twitter! Usa el hashtag #DiariosDeLaPiña o #ThePineappleDiaries


2.) Seguir / Like/Suscribir a La Gringa Loca en Youtube , Instagram y Facebook.

3.) Tomen una foto viendo la primera o segunda temporada de la serie y publícala en los redes sociales con el hashtag #ThePineappleDiaries o #Diariosdelapiña y animar a la gente a ver esta serie cuando se lanza en Youtube!

4.) Vean la primera y segunda temporada de Diarios De La Piña y comenten! Hashtag #Pineapple3Please

5.) Mandarnos buena vibra!

story:
'The Eternals' Series Synopsis

When Casey Samuels is reported missing, it changes the world for the once quiet town of Edenfield in the heartland of Virginia, USA. A string of disappearances and unexplainable personality changes to the town’s most beloved residents becomes a warning, that Edenfield is not what it used to be.

For Evangelene, Gabriel, Lorelei and Nate, their quiet senior year is about to become a year from hell when they are targeted by Lucifer's Fallen Angels, The Damaged, led by mysterious new girl Scarlett and her allies,

With the help of new and old faces of Edenfield, Evangelene must discover the truth about who the newcomers are and what they want as it becomes clear they should be afraid of what lurks in the shadows of their once picturesque town... all the demons and monsters that God has tried to keep tied down.

 

Who are we?

We are a group of filmmakers from Newcastle and Sydney, NSW, Australia. We are all passionate about film, and filmmaking. It is what we live, breath and dream. Combining three production companies, and employing some of the best up and coming crew in the area. We believe we have what it takes to make this production, the next big thing. 

Upon receiving this novel we knew we had something special on our hands. Five years in the making, it's now the time to finally produce 'The Eternals'. For the producers this has been something we have been religiously passionate about for a long time and we are so excited to show what we have.

Contributors will help us produce the pilot episode of 'The Eternals'. It will help us fund this project so we can make the most of this amazing script we have been given, and working so long to produce. 

What We Need:

What we are hoping to get from this campaign. 

  • We are looking to raise 10K to produce the first episode, it will go towards: Costumes/Wardrobe, Hair and Make-Up, FX Contacts/Wigs, Set Designing, Prop Designing, Location Fees, Location Film Permits, Travel Expenses, Liability Insurance, Rental Equipment Fees, Music License Fee, On Set Photographer, On Set Food Catering, Crew, Graphic Designing, Music Composing, Rental Trucks for moving Props/Equipment/Costumes, Editor and Post-Production fees and anything else we need.
  • Extra funds will go towards: Future episodes of the series.

Why Donate?

By pledging any amount, you will be eligible to receive rewards exclusive to those pledging through this Indiegogo page. Have a look at the rewards column -  getting a perk is like placing a pre-order for the project once it's done. Donations help us create the 'Pilot' episode and pay for the above costs mentioned - without your help, we wont be able to show this brilliant idea to the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, and that's okay, but here are some other ways you can help:

  • Spread the word about the series by sharing our Official Instagram/Facebook pages to get it ready for it's release.
  • Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to link it back to the campaign.

If you have any further questions relating to the project, don't hesitate to contact us on the.eternals.tv.series@gmail.com

story:
After working in the motion graphics and video production industry for a few years, Toronto-Based student and adopted dog owner, Michael Alves, wanted to use his production skills to create a narrative-driven story that pushes the heartwarming message of responsible pet ownership. In 2019, Michael produced a 5-minute animated comedy short called “Pound Dogs,” which featured three dogs and their antics in a run-down city pound. In 2021, Michael pitched the idea to a group of his colleagues, setting in motion a full series pilot project. The production team consists of a group of driven and creative university students who have a passion for classic animation, comedy and, of course, dogs. The story follows a preppy Yorkshire terrier who ends up in the city pound with a bunch of zany personalities (the titular “Pound Dogs”), but in the end, finds her place among them as she comes to realize the other dogs are not all that different from herself, beginning her journey to become an integral part of her newfound, new-pound family.  With the help of contributors, the student team will be able to cover production costs, outsource freelancers in animation, composing and public relations, and ultimately, assist in making this project be as good as it possibly can be.

What We Need & What You Get:

Our goal is $5300 CAD. After putting our heads together and coming up with a concise plan on what exactly we’ll need to allocate funding towards, we came up with that number as we believed it was achievable. After the campaign, we will use the contributions to:

- Purchase a dedicated, failsafe external hard drive to back all of our assets up

- Pay for the software needed to produce the episode for those who do not have access to a free version through an institution (Animation, Video Editing, and Audio Software)

- Pay out outsourced vendors that can contribute their expertise to the project (Animators, Composers, Public Relations Experts)

In return for your support, here's what we're giving away:

- Pound Dogs T-Shirts

- Pet Bandanas

- Custom Digital Artwork & Stickers

- Private Access to Production Events

As the pandemic slowly transforms into a thing of the past, many people who adopted a furry friend for quarantine are bringing them back to the shelter. As dog lovers, our team wants to bring awareness to the increasing number of dogs who are left un-adopted, and are still in need loving homes. We are hoping this show pushes a new way of thinking towards adoption, and changes the dialogue around what constitutes a lovable dog. The project is just one of the many strides Toronto creatives continue to make every single day. The Pound Dogs project is yet another means of putting Toronto Students on the map as viable contenders in the animation industry.

story:
The Basics (aka Bethany and Jon)

Hey everyone! Bethany and Jon here. Thanks for checking out our page! Appreciate the read. We don't want to drag this on, so let's get to it. Between us you have two writers, two producers, a director and an actress. The both of us come from different parts of the music world, Bethany in radio and myself from a record label. We love this project and after seeing all these dramatic shows about the music industry fail (Vinyl, Roadies, etc.), we wanted to bring it to the interwebs as a comedy. We love the concept, characters, locations, etc. and really need your help to fund the project. As you'll see, we have some pretty cool incentives in exchange for your donations so we hope you'll join us on this adventure (was that cheesy enough?).

What We Need & Why

The first episode and everything we had shot over the last year (sizzle reel, short pilot, etc.) had been done for free with everyone, cast and crew, donating their time for a project they really loved and believed in. Our Jewish/Nordic guilt (if that's a thing) won't allow us to keep making these without paying the amazing talent behind it. BETHANY AND I ARE NOT TAKING A CUT. WE WANT NOTHING FOR OURSELVES. We love the process and really just want the best talent involved. We've priced it out and here it goes:

  • For $6,000, we can shoot an 8 episode season.
  • Each episode, the money allotted will cover our sound guy, actors and any location fees we might incur as we're trying to use any cool locations we can for this. It'll also include any specialty editing that we need as we will be editing 95% of everything ourselves.
  • If we don't reach our goal, we're going to use the funds we DO collect to cover as much as we can, be it 3 episodes or 4.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everybody has the ability to donate (and there are probably better uses for your money), but we want you to be a part of any success we have. Here's how:

  • Continue sharing Episode 1. The more people that know about it, the more reason we have to continue making them and better chance we have of gaining more funding.
  • Share this fundraising page with the hashtag #Labeled. All it takes is a few shares and we could have our next episode covered.
  • Look out for any kind of opportunities to be extras. We're looking to film one or two days a month and can always use some extra bodies to either help with production or act as background extras.
story_txt:
The Basics (aka Bethany and Jon)
Hey everyone! Bethany and Jon here. Thanks for checking out our page! Appreciate the read. We don't want to drag this on, so let's get to it. Between us you have two writers, two producers, a director and an actress. The both of us come from different parts of the music world, Bethany in radio and myself from a record label. We love this project and after seeing all these dramatic shows about the music industry fail (Vinyl, Roadies, etc.), we wanted to bring it to the interwebs as a comedy. We love the concept, characters, locations, etc. and really need your help to fund the project. As you'll see, we have some pretty cool incentives in exchange for your donations so we hope you'll join us on this adventure (was that cheesy enough?).

What We Need & Why
The first episode and everything we had shot over the last year (sizzle reel, short pilot, etc.) had been done for free with everyone, cast and crew, donating their time for a project they really loved and believed in. Our Jewish/Nordic guilt (if that's a thing) won't allow us to keep making these without paying the amazing talent behind it. BETHANY AND I ARE NOT TAKING A CUT. WE WANT NOTHING FOR OURSELVES. We love the process and really just want the best talent involved. We've priced it out and here it goes:

For $6,000, we can shoot an 8 episode season.
Each episode, the money allotted will cover our sound guy, actors and any location fees we might incur as we're trying to use any cool locations we can for this. It'll also include any specialty editing that we need as we will be editing 95% of everything ourselves.
If we don't reach our goal, we're going to use the funds we DO collect to cover as much as we can, be it 3 episodes or 4.


Other Ways You Can Help
We know not everybody has the ability to donate (and there are probably better uses for your money), but we want you to be a part of any success we have. Here's how:

Continue sharing Episode 1. The more people that know about it, the more reason we have to continue making them and better chance we have of gaining more funding.
Share this fundraising page with the hashtag #Labeled. All it takes is a few shares and we could have our next episode covered.
Look out for any kind of opportunities to be extras. We're looking to film one or two days a month and can always use some extra bodies to either help with production or act as background extras.

story:
Wanting to prove that humans are still good-natured, Jesus begs God to return to Earth to help. God reluctantly agrees, but on three conditions:

1. He can't perform miracles (because last time he did, we killed him.)

2. He must be accompanied by a chaperone (to make sure we don't kill him again.)

3. He must be back by 10 PM Heaven Standard Time (because that's when killers lurk about.)

Things quickly go awry when Jesus realizes he has no idea how to do anything without his holy powers. Turns out, the world might be better off if he just stayed in heaven.

We created this show as a response to an issue we saw rising: political correctness. People are so easily offended by issues that weren't meant to be offensive. Everyone is special and unique so they can't be made fun of, or else their feelings will get hurt. JCIPYC aims to lampoon this radical political correctness by using Jesus, the pinnacle of kindness and generosity. Through his adventures on Earth, we will demonstrate that it is okay to tease or poke fun at someone, as well as critique them, as long as it is done without malice.

We like to call it a cross between Mike Tyson Mysteries and Bewitched.

 
 

JESUS H. CHRIST (Voiced by Anthony Gullace)– Jesus is neglectfully optimistic and enthusiastically incompetent. He's always eager to help, but has no idea how to without his holy powers. He never gives up and tries his hardest to help those in need (though they really wish he would stop before he makes things worse). 

THE ANGEL GABRIELLE “GABI” (Voiced by Rochelle Bulmer) - Gabi does not like humans. She still holds a grudge because not only did they mess up her name in the Bible, they screwed up her gender as well. She is sarcastic, snarky and only agrees to accompany Jesus on his trips to Earth so she can get her payback on the race that failed to realize that she had breasts.

GOD (Voiced by Griffin Toplitsky)– God is all-knowing, all-powerful and wants everyone to know it. He is never afraid to flaunt his power and even abuse it just to get a rise out of someone. He cares only about his son Jesus and his muse Mary and will do anything to get back in her pants.

THE VIRGIN MARY (Voiced by Hannah Tarder-Stoll)– Mary is still a virgin, and not by choice. She wants nothing more than to consummate her marriage with Joseph, but he refuses to have sex with her. When not thinking of new ways to get Joseph in the sack, she is giving Jesus advice on how to remain positive.

JOSEPH (Voiced by Conor Casey)– No one likes Joseph. God can't stand that Mary chose Joseph over him. Mary is annoyed he won't make a move on her. Jesus doesn't like being called his son, and Gabi just thinks he's an idiot. Despite all this, he remains upbeat and chipper in hopes that one day Jesus will finally call him “Dad”.

Who's blasphemous enough to create this show? Nailed It! Productions! We're three writers who just like to make people laugh and we think we can make it far because we have a straight, white guy (there's also a woman and a brown dude, so we're diverse too).

Brandon Goutam – Creator/Head Writer/Living Cartoon:

Brandon is a graduate of the Radio and Television Arts program at Ryerson University. He loves animation of any kind, so much so that he remained in his home while it was burning down because "Inuyasha wasn't over yet". He hopes that JCIPYC is successful so his family will finally understand he's not a journalist. 

Julia Jones – Producer/Writer/Resident Catholic:

Julia wears glasses and everyone thinks she is, or at least should be, a librarian. She isn't. She just wears glasses. Julia is a graduate of Ryerson University's Radio & Television Arts program where she specialized in writing and producing comedy. Julia would like to give special thanks to her Roman Catholic mother for not excommunicating her. 

Evan Furlong – Writer/Post-Production Supervisor/Charlie Day Idolizer:

Evan's constant attempts at joke-making have been described as "inundating", "pathological" and "annoying". His experience with animation while working at Nickelodeon made him a perfect fit for JCIPYC. Evan also likes to take long showers, believing that the hot water dilates the blood vessels around his brain, allowing for more humourous thoughts. 

Gabe Rudyk - Lead Audio Technician

The people at Nailed It! Productions are convinced that Gabe is some sort of wizard, or at the very least, a sound manipulating superhuman. He has recorded all of the audio for JCIPYC and mastered it as well. If you ever meet him, it would be wise to refer to him as "Master of Audio".

Nick York - Head Character and Storyboard Artist

Nick is a good person. Nick draws. Nick is very good at drawing. Nick has worked very hard for this project. You should check out Nick's Tumblr nickyorkdraws.tumblr.com. You should also commission Nick. Praise Nick.

Animators: We want to spend as much money on animators as possible to ensure that we have the best product possible. Not much else to it.

Friends: We don't want to be Joe Cocker. We don't want to get by with the help of our friends. We want to properly compensate them for their amazing work. Help us do that. 

Indiegogo Fees: We have to pay Indiegogo for hosting our campaign. Don't want to bite the hand that feeds.

Promo Materials: We're going to need some money to print out and produce all the stickers and buttons that we plan on shipping out. Speaking of shipping out...

Postage: It costs money to send things in the mail. 

Contingency: We have no idea what might go wrong during all of this. We are firm believers in Murphy's Law and we plan on being prepared for whatever may happen. 

Even though we are only producing one episode through this campaign, we hope to do more than just live on forever through your memories. We've already got the first episode fully recorded and storyboarded, which you can check out here. The next two episodes are written and ready to record. We plan on showing our finished pilot to producers and companies in hopes that they'd want to finance the rest of the season.

We also have a few stretch goals for this campaign if it is more successful than we anticipated.

$5500 – Hire more animators

$5750 – Hire storyboard artists for episode 2.

$6250 – Live table read of episode 2.

Additional stretch goals will be announced if the prior have been met. 

For more updates, check out our Facebook page, Twitter and Instagram.

SPECIAL THANKS

Dana Lee 

Dorsa Bidhendi, Michael Randall and Alanna Vanderbaan (Animation and Colouring)

Nicole Bell, Alex Cabrera-Aragon, Alex Nasson and Allan Turner (Additional Voice Work)

Asia Aoki and Kai Pinkerton (Video and Technical Support)

Leandra Vermeulen (Photography)

Alex Boss (Audio Support)

Elaine Jones (Videographer)

Ramona Pringle, Sarah Shelson, Wayne Shipley and the TMZ (Production and Legal Assistance)

Cassidy Allison, Dylan Campus, Toni Karan, Paige Peralta, Agnes Wong (Writing Assistance)

James Nadler, Ken Scott and Henry Warwick (Concept Assistance and Editing)

story:
‘We The People’ is a love letter to immigrants, and we hope to bring the heart, humor, and humanity of this community to a wide audience.

 

Hi! My name is Swati and I am the creator of ‘We The People’. Moving to the United States offered me the chance to connect with immigrants from all over the world and I fell in love with their stories! I wanted to know more but all I found on the internet were serious, grim videos that made me sad. And of course, those stories need to be told! But I also wanted the fun stuff! I wanted stories that would make me smile and experiences that I could relate to. Being a filmmaker myself, I knew I had to tell these stories. That's where the idea of 'We The People' was born.
 

As part of this project, I have interviewed people who’ve moved to the US from all over the world. Each of the individuals showcased have brought the spirit of 'We The People' to life, by making the invisible, visible. We are now in the editing phase and this is where I need YOUR help! With this campaign, I intend to raise the money I need to cover our post production costs, namely, editing, music, sound and marketing.

 

The Team

 

KYRA UNIEJEWSKI - VIDEO EDITOR

Kyra, pronounced like Tyra, the international supermodel, has previously edited videos for brands like Buzzfeed, Food Network and Playstation to name just a few (and happens to be an immigrant herself!). Over the years, she has cut documentary, narrative and music videos. In her free time, she teaches swimming, pretends to play the ukulele and attempts to bond with her hedgehog, Quilson. Kyra is first generation Polish, and found herself relating to the ‘We the People’ project and it’s upbeat take on a pressing and current topic.

 

NOAH LIFSCHEY - MUSIC AND TITLE MUSIC COMPOSER

Noah Lifschey is a seasoned composer, songwriter, producer, and multi-instrumentalist with projects on major networks, film, and ads spanning from the Academy Awards and Joseph Gordon-Levitt to Google VR and American Idol. He received a Grammy Nomination in 2014 as well as a Mark Award in 2017. Noah's originally from San Francisco and was attracted to 'We The People' because of its down-to-earth and fresh way of looking at immigrants and how immigration to a new country affects real people's lives. He thinks it's a necessary counterpoint to this highly important issue that has a lot of negativity surrounding it these days.

 

SWATI ALI - CONCEPT, STORY, DIRECTOR

That's me! I have over 10 years of experience, writing and producing fiction and non-fiction shows for television as well as the online space. In fact, I was one of the pioneers in the original web content space in India (I created the first 'made for internet' sitcom!) I've also had one of my short films screened at the International Film Festival of India. And I've been a journalist! The best part is that I am also extremely modest, as is evident in this bio! 

 

So, there you have it - two talented immigrants and one Grammy nominee…I think we make a pretty good team!  The three of us feel strongly about this project and its importance in the times we live in.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The minimum amount we need to enable editing, sound, music and marketing is 25000 USD. Every dollar of this minimum goal will go towards the post production and marketing of this series.

Here is a pie chart with a breakdown of expenses:

The post-production expenses are divided into editing, music and sound engineering. The marketing budget will go towards applying to film-festivals, paid PR activities, online and offline screenings and showcases. Part of this budget will also go towards YouTube and Facebook marketing to drive awareness about the series.

My long-term goal for this series is to approach and work with outlets like VICE or NPR to expand the scope of the project to interview a broader spectrum of individuals (asylum seekers, refugees, Dreamers etc.) across the entire United States. 

 

The Perks

And there is something in it for you!! Every time you contribute, you receive something in return!!

Please check out our perks! They are pretty awesome!

Want examples? $15? You just got early online access to all completed episodes of 'We The People' as soon as they are ready. $50? You bought a beautiful e-book featuring a compilation of delicious recipes that our participants grew up with! $100? You get to flaunt a cool, limited edition, 'We The People' t-shirt. $250? You just got Swati. Wait. What??? Yea, check out those perks.

Here are some pics:

 

 

What We Want to Achieve

The United States, throughout its history, has benefitted greatly from the arrival of new people…people who bring with them fresh ideas, energy and ambition. Think Joseph Pulitzer, Einstein, Elon Musk, Hedy Lamarr…But as we all know, that legacy is in danger today. There is an urgent need for a different, more positive conversation and this series aims to start that.

If that positive dialogue is something you care about, then I urge you to contribute to our campaign. Please tell your friends and your family about it; please post about it and share it with your networks!

We can only be our most powerful as a community, as a country, as a world when everybody's voice is a part of the conversation.

By contributing to this campaign, you are enabling the start of a new, constructive conversation on immigrants and their stories.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can donate, but there are many ways you can help support the show:

  • Tell others about 'We The People'! Talk about it at work, dog parks, secret dinners, not-so-secret dinners...you get the gist? 
  • Watch and share our Trailer!
  • Like us on Facebook at https://www.facebook.com/wethepeoplefilm/
  • If you’re as excited as us to make this show, use the Indiegogo share tools to like, share, and spread our campaign! (The share tools are right next to the 'BACK IT' button on the top right!)

Every bit counts and we will keep you updated with behind-the-scenes news every step of the way! 

Thank you so much for helping ‘We The People’ be the best show it can be and for seeing the series through to the end!

 

Frequently Asked Questions

 

Q: What is the intended outcome of the crowdfunding campaign?

The intended outcome of the crowdfunding campaign is two-fold: one is to raise money to pay the editor, music and sound professionals who put their heart and soul into the project, in addition to slashing their prices. The second objective is to market the series so that we spread the word as much as possible, get as many views as possible and get as many people involved in the conversation.

Q:  What are you guys going to do with all this money?

A:  There is a pie chart above that illustrates how we will use the money.

Q:  Will any Perks go out before the campaign is completed?

A:  No. All perks are sent only after the completion of the campaign.

Q:  How do I tell you what T-Shirt size I need?

A:  When the campaign comes to an end we will send you an email asking you what size you need.

 

Risks and Challenges

Every project comes with its own set of unique risks and challenges. But we believe we have diminished risk by meticulously crafting our budget and building an accurate scope of the work - covering everything from editing, music, sound and marketing. Based on where we are, we are comfortable in stating that all perks will be delivered, on a timely basis.

If you have any questions or comments, please contact us on info@wethepeople.film. You'll find us most willing to engage.

 

Thank you ALL again for your continued support!

Risks and Challenges
Every project comes with its own set of unique risks and challenges. But we believe we have diminished risk by meticulously crafting our budget and building an accurate scope of the work - covering everything from editing, music, sound and marketing. Based on where we are, we are comfortable in stating that all perks will be delivered, on a timely basis.
If you have any questions or comments, please contact us on info@wethepeople.film. You'll find us most willing to engage.
 
Thank you ALL again for your continued support!

story:
A WISH

Hi, I'm Dan McNamara and I'm the creator of Wish Weasel.

I have over a decade of experience creating bizarre comedy shows and web series. My first project was The Calderons, a mockumentary about a couple that took care of handicapped robots, featuring Kristen Schaal as the art teacher.  In Redeeming Rainbow, Pat Byrne and I lived with a talking cartoon rainbow voiced by Kurt Braunholer, featuring Ellie Kemper as our neighbor. I've screened work in the New York Television Festival multiple times and created an original animated series for Channel Frederator called The Bear, The Cloud, and God.

I'm a talented editor, animator, and SFX artist and I have always been driven to make offbeat yet heartfelt alternative comedy content. I love films from the 1980s/1990s, like Gremlins 2, Labyrinth, Howard The Duck, Big Trouble In Little China, Muppets Take Manhattan, Short Circuit, and Batteries Not Included, and Japanese kids shows like Ultra Man, Godzilla, Pokemon, and Dragon Ball Z.  So I thought, what if Jim Henson and John Carpenter made a kids show like Robert Smigel's TV Funhouse? 

WE NEED YOUR HELP

With your help we can complete a well-shot and well-executed Wish Weasel! All funding will go to the talent, production, green screen, music, and post-production special effects. We'll be able to fund the entire production and post-production and distribution through film and television festivals and screenings in New York City. All are welcome to the screening that will be scheduled this summer!

We're offering early access to the completed episodes, a music playlist from the show, an official card membership into Wish Weasel's Space Friends™, a Wish Battle Trading Card Magnet, a space phone, special thanks credit, no special thanks credit, your photo with Wish Weasel, and an Executive Producer credit!

If we don't reach our goal, the funding will go to as many talented actors, puppeteers, production and post-production crew members as possible.

My wish is that you'll help our Wish Weasel dream come true.

All the best,

Dan McNamara, Wish Weasel and Space Friends™

 

 

 

Here is our puppeteer and voice talent, Ricky Downes III. He's with Space Friends™ Star Cat, Wish Weasel, and Pom Pom.

General Zorgo, the evil leader of the wishomites who travels to Earth to destroy mankind.

One of Wish Weasel's Space Friends™, Space Detective, played by Mary Houlihan.

The Space Friends™ line up.

story:
Hello! Hey! What's up?

We are Broken Coconuts Productions. A team of comedy loving, self-starting Ryerson University students eager to create something original that boasts Toronto's unique, talented and flourishing comedy scene. Oh ya... and we want it to be *bleep*ing funny.

BleepingFunny 30 minute sketch comedy pilot that consists of five sketches, showcases comedians from across Canada and will be hosted by a local stand-up comedian. The final show will be shot in front of a live studio audience and will pieced together to create a kick*bleep* pilot that will be accessible on a digital platform.

We embarked on production in January, have spent the last 9 months to development and will move into production this fall. In order to make this project come to life we need your help.

Each sketch and the final live studio taping is its own separate production with its own sets, props, costumes, cast and craft services. It's not one production, it's six.

What We Need & What You Get

So order to cover the costs of our production we need to raise $6000. This money will be put towards for things like equipment, transportation, set design, costumes, hair & make up, props and craft services.

We appreciate every penny you are able to donate and we have a few things lined up as our way of saying thanks to all you generous donors.

It Ain't Easy

As full time students juggling school, work, internships and the production of a pilot episode, *bleep* gets tricky. On top of all that, every member of this team has volunteered their time and energy, putting 110% effort and working our *bleep*ing butts because we believe in the success of the show.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to donate, come out and support the final step of our production, the taping of our LIVE SHOW on November 10th 2018. Check out our Instagram and Facebook @bleepingfunny for updates on our show, details about our fundraisers and a whole *bleep* load of memes.

The Extra Funds

All addition funds raised from our Indiegogo campaign will be donated to Sickkids Foundation. Our mission is to make people laugh and if we can, we want to help those who have a harder time being able to embrace and enjoy life's sillyness.

story:
Summary

Retroactive is a tv series following two college students, Kate and Walter, who meet through unlikely circumstances and must navigate through their complicated pasts in pursuit of something meaningful.  Crewed by a team of University of Alabama students, this tv pilot has a host of talent and enthusiasm behind it. 

Crew

Will Barham, the creator of Retroactive, is a senior at UA majoring in Creative Media and minoring in Creative Writing. Will loves writing and hopes to continue screenwriting after he graduates. He is the Co-Director for External Relations for the Black Warrior Film Festival and really just loves working with all aspects of film production. 

The director of Retroactive’s pilot episode, Blake Snawder is an Emmy winning student filmmaker from Dallas Texas. He has worked in various areas of media, obtaining a wide experience in broadcast television and radio. Beyond film directing, Blake is also a Post Production Editor and VFX artist. His passions for film lies in the creative visuals for audiences to escape to.

Mack McCollum, Retroactive's director of photography, is a senior majoring in Creative Media at the University of Alabama who works at the Center for Public Television. His goal is to work in commercial and documentary, but likes to dip into narrative as well.

Budget

Our total budget is $570. 

Timeline

The pilot of Retroactive will shoot February 7-9, 2020. It will reach completion in Spring 2020.

Other Ways You Can Help

We will take donations in any capacity we can get them. Financial support is more than appreciated, as well as sharing of our social media pages and general support. We hope you’ll join us in this process.

story:
Short Summary

Pale Horse is the culmination of the time I've spent at Loyola Marymount working towards my MFA. I've been writing it in one form or another for the better part of two years. Finally, the time has come to try to take my words, and to bring them to life onscreen with a terrific cast and dedicated crew.

What We Need

There's still a lot left to pay for before I can finish shooting my project. Some of the expenses left to cover are as follows:

-Locations: I needed to find a diner for two days of my shoot. I have my eye on a standing set at a studio nearby, but rental fees total well over $1000 a day. At another location, I have to hire a Police Officer to direct traffic so we can safely shoot on a residential side street.

-Special Effects: I'm building a system of compressed air and plastic tubing in order to simulate gunshot effects for a shootout between several of my characters. I'm also hiring a stunt coordinator to help choreograph and safely execute this sequence.

-Catering and Craft Services: Most of my crew members and cast are helping me on a volunteer-basis. The least I can do is make sure they're well-fed.

-Costumes, Props, and Makeup: From futuristic weaponry and military-style cargo pants to customized contact lenses and temporary tattoos, it isn't cheap to sell a world and make it look good.

And much more besides all that!

Risks & Challenges

When it comes to making a short film, in my experience there's always something you weren't able to plan for. Maybe an actor gets sick at the last minute. Maybe the truck gets caught on a low-hanging tree branch and is delayed reaching the location. Gear can fail, effects can be lackluster, costumes can look too costume-y. 

However, at present I have over 40 filmmaking projects under my belt. I know how to prepare  and plan, where to save money and where to spend extra to ensure quality. I believe that I am particularly well-qualified to take on an ambitious project like the one I'm in the midst of planning.

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word! The best way for people can find out about the project is by hearing from people already excited to see the finished product!
