story:
WHAT IS THE SERIES ABOUT?

 

Pussy. (Season 1)

Money. (Season 2)

Weed.  (Season 3)

 

Our story follows the journey of, Brian, a 20- something  Brooklyn based comedian who appears to have a magnetic attraction to shenanigans as he pursues sex, money, and drugs. The pilot season, PUSSY, focuses on Brian’s pursuit for a new love interest after things go south with his ex-girlfriend. He is supported by friends Quincy, a happy-go-lucky frat bro still trying to use college techniques to maneuver through life, and Jade, a natural cynic who seems to be questioning her choice of friends after each situation. All of this creates an environment for Brian to convert his hijinks into great source material for his debut comedy special.

WHAT’S NEW?

The Black Universe

In Brian, all that has ever been reflected or referenced in black cinema can live in this universe that is portrayed in the series. All your favorite shows from Coming to America, Atlanta, The Boondocks, and more are all accessible to our writers and characters. Luke Cage actually lives uptown, Good Burger is a fast food restaurant, and Pooty Tang is a real crime fighter.

 

For the Record

This after-the-show segment is very special and separates us from every other series online - it's our chance to bring in around the way folks who have either witnessed or experienced first-hand the situations that correlate with the topic of the episode. Fuxkboys, dating while broke, interacial relationships, Tinder session shenanigans, and much more.

 

WHO ARE THE CHARACTERS

BRIAN 

Both wiry and energetic Brian is in the midst of the struggle of a starving artist in New York City, nevertheless he maintains an upbeat attitude. His struggle with short-sighted decision making is often the catalyst for the situations he gets himself into as he miscalculates the domino effect of his motives and actions.

QUINCY 

Happy go-lucky black frat bro now outside of the college environment still using the tools from his glory days to traverse the streets of New York. Often able to get through situations on charm alone, he finds himself interjecting with ditzy remarks in conversations with his friends Jade and Brian.

JADE

A New York transplant from Houston. Witty, sarcastic, and cynical, Jade is treated by Quincy and Brian as one of the guys. She often serves as the voice of reason in a situation, and for this reason can go unnoticed. 

 

WHAT DO WE NEED?

We are looking to shoot this spring and need your help to make it happen. With three episodes complete and ready to go, six “after-the-show” segments in post-production, and our last three scripts of season one being finalized, all we need is a few more coins (we will take bitcoin!) With your contribution we can finish the final episodes and complete the pilot season package!

 

Where is your money going:

  • Insurance
  • Equipment Rentals
  • Locations
  • Crew/Cast Catering
  • Transportation
  • Coloring
  • Sound Engineering
  • Post-Production

WHY US?

With shows like Insecure, Atlanta and Fresh Off The Boat spearheading this current "diverse" Television Renaissance - The normalcy and day-to-day tales of people of color is finally showing itself to be worthy and necessary content. The series Brian has been compared to that of a modern day Seinfeld. With a talented group of NYC transplants who’ve had their share of interesting encounters in these NYC streets- we bring a variety of tales and skills.  

 

JORDAN RIGGS

(Creator, Director, Executive Producer)

Jordan Riggs is a graduate of Brooks Institute in Ventura, CA with a Bachelor of Arts in film and video production. He has worked in the industry for upwards of 10 years as an editor, writer, director, and cinematographer. Having started his career as a music video director with High5Collective signed to Partizan Los Angeles, Jordan had the opportunity to work alongside and learn from many talented artists and filmmakers, but he never lost his love for narrative filmmaking. Today, Jordan is honing his skills as a Director of Photography while working on narrative passion projects like Brian as well as several other short and feature film projects.

 

MAIA MILLER

(Producer)

Maia is a creative from Atlanta, GA whose life work is centered around creating spaces and platforms for artists of color, youth, and women. With over seven years of experience in content creation and event production, Maia has found her strength in being both detail oriented and sensitive to the stories on the table. Maia has teamed up with a series of productions from She's Gotta Have It (Netflix), Gil Scott Heron Doc (Lakehouse Films) and the American Black Film Festival (ABFFVentures). 

When Maia isn't working on a production, she can be found at a Brooklyn coffee shop  getting her life to a new SoundCloud artist. 

 

RACHAEL EDWARDS

(Producer)

Hailing from Upper Darby, PA, Rachael Edwards began her profession in Television Production during her time in Los Angeles, California. After graduating from Temple University with a B.A. in Broadcasting, Telecommunications & Mass Media, Rachael moved to New York City where her career advanced with MTV in Unscripted Production & Development.

 

BRYAN THOMPSON 

(Writer/Actor)

Bryan Thompson is a stand up comedian and actor, known for Print Shop (2016). Born in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania and now currently residing in New York, NY, he studied Film and Theater History at Delaware County Community College and the Philadelphia Freedom Theater.

 

SEAN VALENTINE

(Writer)

An up-and-coming independent film producer. Graduating from Howard University with a degree in Finance, Valentine has a professional background in investment banking and entrepreneurship.

His first film project, Print Shop, has been an official selection for the San Franscico Black Film Festival and the Greater Cleveland Urban Film Festival. 

 

DESHAUN WRIGHT 

(Assistant Director)

Recently inducted into the DGA, DeShaun is a very talented and highly sought after Assisant Director aka the set dad. With shows like "Broad City," "Amy Schuemer," and "Quantico" under his belt, Deshaun is tasked with keeping everyone safe, on time, and happy on the set of Brian. With a personality that combines a bit of Uncle Phil, Snoop, and a splash of Coach Carter, he keeps the show running smoothly. But don't get too lax, he will give it to you straight, but remember it’s out of love *insert hug emoji.*

 

SPREAD THE WORD!

Every coin matters... but we totally get it if your bank account isn’t quite set up for offerings right now BUT you can still help! By sharing this page with people you know and who may be interested in investing, we can keep the mission going. Follow us on  Facebook and Instagram to stay updated!

 

What’s next after you complete the season?

PITCH, PITCH, PITCH! We are creating this pilot season package in hopes of getting  picked up by a digital media who are seeking and in need of diverse and hilarious content. Once picked up, we will have the funding to continue on with the development and production of the second season entitled "Money," which follows Brian as he looks to find creative ways to fight off poverty and support his lifestyle as an artist in NYC and the third season, "Weed," depicting Brian’s experiences with getting high and interacting with the very unfamiliar world of drugs.

RISKS AND CHALLANGES

Brian is a passion project for one of our writers. His life experiences really has been worthy of a show. This parallelism between the main character and our own writer has created a family of believer, supporters, and encouragers who are dedicated to making this happen. We each bring different yet important strengths to the table. Any challenges that may arise (we work in production- it is bound to happen) we have no doubt that the flexibility, determination, and ability to problem solve will make the vision a reality- especially if we get the funding we need. Fund us and we WILL deliver.

Any challenges that may arise (we work in production- it is bound to happen) we have no doubt that the flexibility, determination, and ability to problem solve will make the vision a reality- especially if we get the funding we need. Fund us and we WILL deliver.

story:
Welcome to Bike Pals!

We can't wait to share more of our beloved project with you. This project is based on some true stories from being 13, and some very very silly fictional ones. We hope you enjoy our clip and info, and we want to thank you for taking interest in our weird story!

 

Synopsis

All Kip wants is to stay 13 forever, ride her bike, solve mysteries with her friends, and be noticed by her successful mom Wendy who reports on high profile crime. Instead she feels like she’s losing all of her friends to teenage-hood, her overly sensitive big brother is always picking on her, and her other stay-at-home bohemian parent Didi couldn’t be less similar to her. The story begins when Kip comes face to face with what lurks in their creepy town, something that's been there all along... real crimes. Torn between childhood and adolescence, Kip struggles to keep playing pretend, or to grow up with her friends, but little does she know she’s closer than anyone to solving the towns recent disappearances. 

Bike Pals is a parody of shows like Stranger Things, E.T., and Stand by Me. Stereotypes are flipped on their heads in Bike Pals. It will make you laugh with its absurd physical comedy and characters, all while showing you vulnerability and truthful experiences of bravery with getting older, coming out, and standing up to actual murderers. Laughter means there is trust, and once there is trust, you can touch someone deeply, and that is exactly what Bike Pals does through a roller coaster of meaningful human experiences, connections, and relationships.

 

Meet Our Lead Characters!

           

Kip - played by Meaghan Hommy

Kip is our scrappy lead. She’s a novice detective always sniffing around for a mystery to solve, but more importantly she’s a kid and she wants to stay that way.

 

           

Ronda - played by Del Hajipour

Ronda is the scaredy cat of the group. She’s a sheltered kid, allergic to everything, and always trying to keep Kip on the straight and narrow with little success.

 

           

Ty - played by Michael Sousa

Ty is a social butterfly, and his friends can never really nail him down because of his packed social calendar.

 

           

Kathy - played by Jill Lockley

Kathy is Kip’s best friend and sidekick. She’d follow Kip anywhere. She's always up for anything!

 

About Our Creators 

           

Sinead Grewcock (Director, Writer, Producer) 

Sinead has been filmmaking since I was a kid and this project is one of her favourite work to date. She has a background in Acting, Writing, and Directing. This money would make a huge impact on the quality of the Bike Pals production, and set it up to meet it's fullest potential. The Bike Pals team is passionate and one of kind, and any help by donation, sharing, or following them on our journey would be hugely appreciated.

 

           

Kora Vanderlip (Director of Photography)

Kora is a writer, director and cinematographer. Storytelling is a lifelong passion of hers, hand in hand with film. She loves this project and the team behind it is made up of some of the most wonderful, dedicated and passionate people she know's.
Reaching these funding goals would allow them to expand their production and create their vision of the project with support that makes a huge difference.

 

           

Roxana Beiklik (Writer)

Roxana is one of the writers on Bike Pals and super excited to be on board. Her background is in children's animated content and she's worked most of her career as a storyboard artist. This is her first foray into a live action project and the content has been an absolute blast to develop. Their team wants to give this project the best chance they can, contributions would greatly help them enhance the professional quality of their production and provide opportunities with development that might have otherwise not been possible. Even the rewards tier is curated by the team to extend the experience of the show content.

 

           

Michelle Walker (Writer)

Michelle has been writing sketch and other comedy projects for years now. This is her second web series. She's an improviser and comedian, and she's begging you for money so they can make this the best project they possibly can. Anything helps. Please and thank you.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Gear - $1500.00

9 Day shoot will need multiple gear rentals

  • Costumes - $300.00

We have a large cast since it takes place in a school, and the series covers 5 days with as many outfit changes for the cast

  • Props - $250.00

Many of our props will be used throughout the duration of the shoot and series, but there are 3 distinct locations that will be demanding: Classroom, Drama Room, News room

  • Crafty - $450.00

9 day shoot, with $50.00 each day to cover snacks and water for set

 

The Impact

This story shows atypical characters and pushes gender stereotypes. This is an integral direction for media/cinema moving forward. Film and tv is saturated with stereotypes, which are the way children and adults form perceptions of themselves and people different from them. Women can be masculine, men can be feminine, and anywhere in between. Non-binary people can also express themselves in whatever way they choose. It is important for the media to have space for stories with different and new characters, because that is how tolerance, acceptance, and innovation grow. Affirmative action means making space that wasn’t previously there, and our series Bike Pals creates space for racial, gender, age, and sexual diversity while telling an absurd story about growing up and solving a real murder mystery. Bike Pals is unique and tells the story about growing up in a way that’s never been done, and through character’s that aren’t always seen.

 

Risks & Challenges

  • Simplifying our workload - make sure we have good gear to make the most of our shoot days
  • Spending less when possible- we need to save where we can and allocate our props and costumes from thrift stores or use what pieces people already own
  • Save money for post-production - editing, colouring, and sound editing will cost money!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share to your social media! (use the indiegogo share buttons)
  • Message us directly if you'd like to get involved!

story:
The Fandom Presents... is a project created by fans, for fans. 

The concept for this web series is to provide a comedic love letter to the recognisable film franchises that many of us have grown up with or hold near and dear to our hearts. Our entire team is formed of various personalities, with completely different backgrounds, from all over the world. Yet, despite this, we all share one common trait in having a devoted passion for these franchises! The initial episodes will focus on what we consider the flagship pop culture franchises, these include:

  • Star Wars
  • Marvel
  • Lord of the Rings
  • Harry Potter

 

The idea behind the project is that we'll be interviewing various fans of these franchises who have a diverse range of knowledge, investment, and experiences. A franchise is only as strong as its fan base and thus these fans will both highlight how diverse audiences can be and how iconic narratives can be uniquely interpreted. Structurally, we aim to achieve this by asking fans to answer narrative questions, participate in activities, and even do the occasional Wookie or Gollum impression.  Their answers will then be inter-cut to form a 5-minute video that'll aim to keep you entertained wherever you consume your online content. (You can find an example of the format in a video at the top of the page​)

  • How do you explain the entire 40+ years old Star Wars franchise in one minute?
  • Who was right in Captain America: Civil War, Iron Man or Captain America?
  • Which Harry Potter house is undeniably the best?
  • Which character is never tempted by the ring in Lord of the Rings?

 

These are just a handful of narrative and subjective questions our interviewees will have to answer on the spot for your viewing pleasure, and whether you agree with them or not is totally up to you!

 

What will you be supporting?

Essentially, we're aiming to shoot this project in September ready for a quick release at the end of October, with the hope that if this becomes successful, we can provide more content for you! Any money raised will contribute to various production and technical costs. Specifically, any support you're willing to give will go towards:

  • Set Design (the more money we have to play with, the better set will look!
  • Sound Recording (we want only the best quality sound for your ear drums)
  • Transport (less exciting I know... but unfortunately, none of us have the superhero abilities to fly or teleport)

 

To give you a greater understanding of how we wish to design our set, we've created these concepts for you too see which can be found at the top of the page too alongside a narrated video explaining in further detail!

 

Ultimately, this project is about fans, by fans, and for fans - so any money you'd be willing to spare towards our project would be greatly appreciated either in pure donation or by taking advantage of our perk bundles! Thank you!

 

Risks:

- As our team is formed of Master's students we do ask for patience, we are all still in the process of learning, but what we lack in experience we certainly make up for in passion and we will do our hardest to fulfil our promises and provide an entertaining viewing experience.

- COVID-19 has disrupted the very fabric of existence in every sector across the world, as such we are not immune to the impacts either, we are currently working incredibly hard on working to adapt to this crisis and create a safe and secure shooting environment that adheres to safety guidelines.

- Rewards are mostly digital, but for those who are backing us for some of our physical rewards, we will ensure everything is in great condition and shipped to you as soon as we can.

story:
Who are you guys and why do I give a rat's ass?

Hi world, we're Mark Sarian and Ari Voukydis. We've been performing together at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theater and all over the country since back when there were hookers in Times Square. We've written for Spy, GQ, BuzzFeed and SNL’s Weekend Update. Our stage shows "Hooray for Mark & Ari" and "LOFT" have been featured at several national comedy festivals and we take full responsibility for many popular internet videos including one directed by John Landis and featured on The Tonight Show...

a video short for BuzzFeed highlighting Ms. Pac Man's role as a Feminist icon...
...and a spoof of HGTV's House Hunters for HuffPo Comedy.
We are particularly proud of Newsers, a pilot we self-financed, wrote, and produced which was an Official Selection to the 2014 New York Television Festival.

We also won First Prize at the 2011 Creative World Awards for our 30 Rock spec script. We've done a boatload of other videos on UCBComedy.com and FunnyOrDie, been on TV and in films, blah blah blah. We're fancy. You can learn and see more about us at www.markandari.com. 

So that's who we are. Now a little on what we're doing and why we need your help.

What's this about anyway? I'm late for hot yoga class!

Our latest opus is an idea for a  show called Hustle. We'd like to shoot a five-minute minisode that could then be sold as a multi-camera, single-camera, or even a digital series for the web. 

Hustle is the story of the three-generation family that runs The Rosen Agency in Hollywood (technically Koreatown, but they always say Hollywood). It's an agency that screams for modernization from the desks to its client list. It's basically a modern version of Broadway Danny Rose. It stars Dan Rosen Sr. (70s), a maverick agent from the 1970s who ran fast and loose with the morality of signing top-tiered talent. Dan Rosen Jr. (40s), his son, now the face of the agency and recently-divorced eternal optimist who truly believes that anyone, and we mean anyone, with the right opportunity can be the next A-List client on their roster. And then there's Dan Jr.'s daughter, Danielle (20s), a millennial with a purpose, which is to at least get the agency a functioning web site and working email account while trying to keep her father out of trouble. Dan Jr. is constantly pulled between his father's traditional (borderline-conniving) work ethos and his daughter's new-age (borderline-confusing) approach. But in the end, the Rosens always find a way to pull together in tough times, find their actors work, and (just barely) keep the lights on.    

Once completed, this five-minute short will then be pitched to networks, entered into Festivals, and shown to everyone and anyone who can help make this dream a reality.

In helping us to produce the Hustle minisode, you will be helping two guys who have the talent and the ambition to make this a reality, while contributing to making something special that you can totally take credit for years from now and we'll never know. We know what we're doing. We've done it already. And now, we simply need your help.

Meet the Cast.

Mark Sarian  (Dan Rosen Jr.)  hails from suburban Philadelphia where he first learned how to be bitterly disappointed in all things sports related. He has been performing stand-up, sketch and improv comedy at the Upright Citizens Brigade Theatre since 1998.  He has appeared in dozens of national and local television and radio commercials. Mark began his UCB career performing on two Harold Teams, Beautiful Cop and Suppertime. He also produced and performed in several improv shows at the UCB, most notably The Millers and Action 5 News, both performing at improv festivals around the country. His two-man sketch group, Mark & Ari, garnered several national comedy festival appearances and also produced and starred in a short film they wrote, Small World, that was directed by John Landis (Animal House) for JibJab.com. Mark can also be seen in films and television including; One Last Thing, The Tombs, Space Cadet, and Childrens Hospital. In 2014, Mark produced, wrote and starred in a short film, Newsers, that was an Official Selection to the New York Television Festival. Mark now lives in Los Angeles with his hard-working wife and lazy dog.

Beth Appel  (Danielle Rosen)  is a performer, writer, and director living in Los Angeles. Beth can currently be seen performing at UCB every Tuesday with her improv team, CARDINAL REDBIRD. Beth recently wrote and starred in the long-running solo show, BETH APPEL: SEXIEST WOMAN ALIVE, and she has written, directed and performed in countless other sketch and improv shows at UCB on both coasts (East and West). You may have seen her on MTV, TruTV, in various webseries, or, if you live in Germany or Switzerland, in a Volkswagen commercial with fellow heartthrob Robbie Williams.

Terrence Beasor (Dan Rosen Sr.) is a graduate of the Pasadena Playhouse ('57), and was their "Man of the Year", in 2011. He earned his Equity card in a production of "The Dybbuk", directed by Morris Ankrum, on the Playhouse's Main Stage('62). He moved to NYC in 1965, and met his actress/wife, Muriel Minot in 1968 doing back-to-back shows at ELT. They moved to Boston where he subsequently got an MFA in Theatre from Brandeis University ('76), after which he and Muriel moved to LA. Here he fostered a career in Film/TV/commercials (most recently appearing as "Grandpa" in a Kraft "Mac n' Cheese" campaign), and voice-over work, including being 1/4th the voice of the Borg on all the Star Trek series (as well as ADR/looping on over 450 projects). He is proud to STILL be a "working actor", and a member of all the acting unions! He and Muriel have been married since December 1968.

Mitch Magee (Director)  is a writer, director and performer. In 2008, his webseries, "Sexual Intercourse: American Style" was selected as an official entry in the New York Television Festival. In 2007, he was selected as a finalist for the Andy Kaufman Award, sponsored by HBO. Most recently, he wrote, directed and performed in a series of shorts for the HBO series, "Funny or Die Presents." He has been performing at the UCB Theater since November of 2000 and has appeared in such shows as "Citizen Nuts," "Game Face: The Church of Positivitology," and "The Osgood-Schlatter Show." He was also a founding member of the improv group, Monkeydick. He has produced and directed a number of series for the web, including "Sexual Intercourse: American Style" and "Mister Glasses" as well as "Welcome to my Study," in collaboration with UCB performer, Dyna Moe. Mitch is currently working as a Director of Content at BuzzFeed in Los Angeles, California.

 

Where your hard-earned scratch goes and what you get in return.

When we produced "Newsers," it was a 14-minute short that cost us $25,000, that was completely self-financed.  We had amazingly talented people work on it and shot at incredible locations,  and guess what, it showed. When we premiered it at the New York Television Festival everyone kept remarking how professional it looked, sounded, and was edited. We want to replicate that experience. Which is why, after consulting with our producer and director that $7,000 will fulfill all of our directives to produce a high-quality, memorable video. This stuff ain't cheap folks. Yeah, I know, "But iPhones have video cameras!" and "My sister-in-law knows a guy who shot a whole movie for like $400 in his backyard!" Well, good for him, and I bet it sounded and looked like shit. To get the attention of network executives and the public at large, a web series or pitch video needs to be beyond reproach. We need to show that we know what we're doing and most important, we have the taste level that succeeds in today's highly-competitive television landscape. And we do. So, $7,000 it is.

The funds will be spent on a One-Day Shoot in Los Angeles and will include:

Cast • Location(s) • Director • Producer • Minimal Crew (Grips, PAs) •  Rental Equipment (Lights, Sound equip., Digital backup) • Props • Catering • Editing • Insurance • LA Film License • Script Supervisor 

It adds up fast. So please help out. And if we exceed our goal then we will pour every penny into making Hustle an even better production.

And hey, there are other ways to help, Ebenezer.

And by all means, if you can't help out now, we'll be your best friends if you forward our Indiegogo page along to your social media base. Any and all help is appreciated, and that includes simply helping us get the word out.

In 2014, Mark produced, wrote and starred in a short film, Newsers, that was an Official Selection to the New York Television Festival. Mark now lives in Los Angeles with his hard-working wife and lazy dog.

Beth Appel  (Danielle Rosen)  is a performer, writer, and director living in Los Angeles. Beth can currently be seen performing at UCB every Tuesday with her improv team, CARDINAL REDBIRD. Beth recently wrote and starred in the long-running solo show, BETH APPEL: SEXIEST WOMAN ALIVE, and she has written, directed and performed in countless other sketch and improv shows at UCB on both coasts (East and West). You may have seen her on MTV, TruTV, in various webseries, or, if you live in Germany or Switzerland, in a Volkswagen commercial with fellow heartthrob Robbie Williams.

Terrence Beasor (Dan Rosen Sr.) is a graduate of the Pasadena Playhouse ('57), and was their "Man of the Year", in 2011. He earned his Equity card in a production of "The Dybbuk", directed by Morris Ankrum, on the Playhouse's Main Stage('62). He moved to NYC in 1965, and met his actress/wife, Muriel Minot in 1968 doing back-to-back shows at ELT. They moved to Boston where he subsequently got an MFA in Theatre from Brandeis University ('76), after which he and Muriel moved to LA. Here he fostered a career in Film/TV/commercials (most recently appearing as "Grandpa" in a Kraft "Mac n' Cheese" campaign), and voice-over work, including being 1/4th the voice of the Borg on all the Star Trek series (as well as ADR/looping on over 450 projects). He is proud to STILL be a "working actor", and a member of all the acting unions! He and Muriel have been married since December 1968.

Mitch Magee (Director)  is a writer, director and performer. In 2008, his webseries, "Sexual Intercourse: American Style" was selected as an official entry in the New York Television Festival. In 2007, he was selected as a finalist for the Andy Kaufman Award, sponsored by HBO. Most recently, he wrote, directed and performed in a series of shorts for the HBO series, "Funny or Die Presents." He has been performing at the UCB Theater since November of 2000 and has appeared in such shows as "Citizen Nuts," "Game Face: The Church of Positivitology," and "The Osgood-Schlatter Show." He was also a founding member of the improv group, Monkeydick. He has produced and directed a number of series for the web, including "Sexual Intercourse: American Style" and "Mister Glasses" as well as "Welcome to my Study," in collaboration with UCB performer, Dyna Moe. Mitch is currently working as a Director of Content at BuzzFeed in Los Angeles, California.
 

Where your hard-earned scratch goes and what you get in return.
When we produced "Newsers," it was a 14-minute short that cost us $25,000, that was completely self-financed.  We had amazingly talented people work on it and shot at incredible locations,  and guess what, it showed. When we premiered it at the New York Television Festival everyone kept remarking how professional it looked, sounded, and was edited. We want to replicate that experience. Which is why, after consulting with our producer and director that $7,000 will fulfill all of our directives to produce a high-quality, memorable video. This stuff ain't cheap folks. Yeah, I know, "But iPhones have video cameras!" and "My sister-in-law knows a guy who shot a whole movie for like $400 in his backyard!" Well, good for him, and I bet it sounded and looked like shit. To get the attention of network executives and the public at large, a web series or pitch video needs to be beyond reproach. We need to show that we know what we're doing and most important, we have the taste level that succeeds in today's highly-competitive television landscape. And we do. So, $7,000 it is.
The funds will be spent on a One-Day Shoot in Los Angeles and will include:
Cast • Location(s) • Director • Producer • Minimal Crew (Grips, PAs) •  Rental Equipment (Lights, Sound equip., Digital backup) • Props • Catering • Editing • Insurance • LA Film License • Script Supervisor 
It adds up fast. So please help out. And if we exceed our goal then we will pour every penny into making Hustle an even better production.

And hey, there are other ways to help, Ebenezer.
And by all means, if you can't help out now, we'll be your best friends if you forward our Indiegogo page along to your social media base. Any and all help is appreciated, and that includes simply helping us get the word out.

story:
THE DETECTIVES-ish

Hello, I'm R Freeman Sykes (a/k/a Robby Merritt).  I've only had one career goal in my life.  Some folks talk about having a calling.  Well, I've only had one call:  to be in show business.  I sidetracked myself for over a decade, then got "maintracked" for the best role of my life:  father to twin girls.  I was a stay-at-home dad and part-time videographer as they grew up.  Now they're in college, and I'm back pursuing my dream.  I've found some success in small films and TV shows, but this is--or could be--my big break.  

Phil Korz won his first standup comedy contest as a teenager and didn't stop there.  In his early 20's he performed in a national tour.  Having moved to NYC recently, he's expanding his career on TV, stage, and film.  

Please help fund this project.  It's not pie-in-the-sky, it's truly ready to go.  In fact we've spent $3500 of money we didn't have on the sizzle reel.  We're in debt with two full scripts and a season's worth of ideas; we have great actors ready to make them come to life. If we reach our goal, we may be able to shoot two episodes by mid-October. If the initial episodes help us find a big backer/producer, The Detectives-ish could find an audience large enough to keep rolling.

Check out our short trailer on YouTube through the link above.  It was shot with a nice camera, but with no crew except me and Phil.    We need pros to help us make this what it needs to be.  If you like the promo trailer, you should really like the full sizzle reel, which can be found on YouTube as well.  (Search for "The Detectives-ish")  If you're into it, and want this to become what it can be, please give.  We won't do you wrong.

Thank you for your kind indulgence, and thank you so much for any and all support.

      -Freeman

story:
Hi Everyone!

We hope you are safe and sane during these wild times!  Here we go!  It's IT GIRLS ON THE STOOP Season 3!  We are so excited to bring you HALF of season three coming early next year.

This campaign will cover expenses for these first 6-8 episodes which includes many It Girls Co-hosts including Hillary B. Smith, Michael Sabatino and many of our Daytime friends!  We are shooting everything virtually so we can all be safe but that won't tamper our cooking, drinking and laughing skills.  We promise a fun ride full of cool recipes (of the food and drink variety), fun conversations and, of course, CONFESSIONALS!!!  

As this season is virtual, we will have a lot of tech work to do so that's where our money is going as well as insurance and paying our amazing actor friends.   I'll buy the booze!  Please join us in toasting to a New Year!!!  It Girls on the Stoop! #EatDrinkLaugh

Be sure to tell your friends about IT GIRLS ON THE STOOP!

story:
What happens when a disgraced ex-beauty queen turns to her judge-y, estranged half-sister for support . . . and a job?  Welcome Imogen, the newest – and roughest – standardized patient at Pincus College of Medicine!  Standardized Patients, or SP’s, are actors for medical students who teach them communications skills.  So fun!  She’s ready to jump in, but swapping her evening gown for a hospital gown isn’t quite what she signed up for.  Her new boss of a sister seems determined to watch her fail.  And her other boss, disaster-boy Jake, needs to get his awkward crush under control.  Ugh, stepping outside her selfish bubble and thinking of others is, like, so much harder than she thought. This is the premise for a new comedic webseries, Mis(s)Communication!

Mis(s)Communication was created by Amanda Yachechak, Sam George, and Robin Fusco and springs from our combined 20+ years of working as Standardized Patients - actors who portray patients for medical students as they practice history taking, physical exams, and interpersonal communication skills. The work is rewarding and valuable to the future of medical care, but it can also be downright hilarious as students practice the skills they need - from learning to use a reflex hammer to how to respectfully take a sexual history - to become successful doctors. Mis(s)Communication is our way of sharing this world with you.

 

Meet the Mis(s)Communication Team:

 

Amanda Yachechak - Co-Creator, Writer, and portraying Imogen Riley   

Amanda is a stage and film actress,  ​a coloratura soprano, and a classical ballerina and Irish dancer.  She has appeared extensively in theatre, film and television, and as a concert artist throughout the US and internationally.  Amanda originated Gracie in HIT Entertainment’s Angelina Ballerina Off-Broadway and on tour, and played Mabel in Scranton Shakespeare Festival’s The Pirates of Penzance, co-produced by Douglas Carter Beane. She was most recently seen at the National Opera Center and on television as Lena in Lady of the Castle. She made her film debut in Last Days of Simon and starred in the award-winning Cancer and Cake. She is a graduate of Franklin University Switzerland, and the American Musical and Dramatic Academy. www.amandayachechak.com

 

Sam George - Co-Creator, Writer, and portraying Jake Reynolds   

Sam George is a stage and film actor, a writer, an improviser, and a voiceover artist. He graduated with a BA in theater from the University of New Hampshire and studied film/television at Weist-Barron. He has appeared in films and main stage productions, both regionally and off-off Broadway.

 

Robin Fusco -  Co-Creator and Writer 

Robin Fusco is a television drama writer known for shattering social conventions in her work. She creates characters who refuse to bend to society’s expectations and believes stories are a way of playing “what if” that, ultimately, spur change. Robin’s work has been honored by the WeScreenplay Television, Cinequest, Big Break, ScreenCraft, Diverse Voices, and Vancouver International Women in Film screenwriting competitions, and she's a 2019 NYSCA/NYFA Artist Fellow in Screenwriting. Robin holds an MFA in Writing for the Screen and Stage from Point Park University and a BA in Theatre from Muhlenberg College. She enjoys being able to instantly visit whatever world she chooses by simply creating it. For more information, visit her website at www.robinfusco.com.

 

Our crew will be led by Director Cynthia Granville with Will Copeland as Director of Photography and Molly Callahan as Assistant Director and Audio.

Cynthia Granville has specialized in new work throughout her career, and formed her production company, disOrienting Stage and Film, to help artists initiate their own projects, creating award-winning films, commercials, and music and promo videos. Most recently she directed, shot, and edited a series of training videos for a NY medical school with her team members Will Copeland and Molly Callahan, and she is excited to explore the fictional world of medical students and the standardized patients who love them in Mis(s)Communication.  Cynthia’s work has played numerous film festivals including SAG NY Short Film Showcase, Big Apple, New Filmmakers NY, Columbia Gorge, Action on Film. The feature film Smoke Screen, which she produced, is available on Amazon Prime Video. Recent stage directing credits include WHORTICULTURE at Dixon Place and You Can’t Play Barbies When Someone Has Stolen Their Heads, an HB Studio Rehearsal Space Residency project.

 

Where You Come In:

The first two seasons of Mis(s)Communication are fully scripted and ready to be filmed! We've secured locations, have a wonderful cast and crew on board, and a French composer, Jean Michel Vaicle,  has agreed to provide an original score. But, there are a lot of elements that go into a successful production. In order to bring you Mis(s)Communication, we need to raise the final $10,000 of our $40,000 budget. You'll be helping us:

  • Secure insurance to fully protect our cast, crew, equipment, and locations. ~$2,500
  • Provide catering to feed the cast and crew while filming. ~$3,000
  • Purchase medical props and wardrobe. ~$500
  • Cover actor travel expenses. ~$500
  • Market and distribute the series. ~$1,000

And most importantly, you'll allow us to hire a top-notch editor to turn the work into a finished project that you'll want to see - $2,500.

Mis(s)Communication will be produced by Firebird Productions, LLC

 

Cast:

  • Imogen Riley - 20s, plucky but self-centered. An ex-beauty pageant queen who accidentally becomes the medical school’s newest standardized patient after becoming the laughing stock of the pageant world and desperately needing a job. 

        CAST: AMANDA YACHECHAK

 

  • Jake Reynolds - late 20s, a well-meaning mess. The standardized patient program director. He lacks motivation, but his instant crush on Imogen has him willing to do anything to help her. 

       CAST: SAM GEORGE

 

  • Samantha Nicole Charles - late 20s, snobby and controlling. Jake’s right hand and the one who really runs things. She’s also Imogen’s estranged half-sister and, surprisingly, the one Imogen initially turns to for help. 

       CAST: MICKELE HOGAN

 

  • Dr. Judith Reynolds - 50s, powerful and she knows it. Jake’s mother and the dean of the school. She’s the one with final say over the program and his life. A womanizer who’s gotten away with it because she’s female.

       CAST: MELANIE LITTLE

 

  • Jessica Guber - 20s,  aloof medical student who struggles with empathy. 

       CAST: DIAMOND SENORA TAYLOR

 

  • Brett - 20s, detached and over it.  A medical student who thinks all SP's are out to get him.

​        CAST: CHRIS WOODY

 

  • Allison - 20s, a disaster of a medical student. 

       CAST: VERA KELMAN

 

  • Dave - 20s. A bumbling medical student who lacks confidence.  And a clipboard.  And his stethoscope....

       CAST: NICO KIEFER

 

Risks and Challenges:

All film productions have risks. We recognize this and have mitigated it by meticulously going through the current and future expenses we anticipate and consulting with experienced producers and other entertainment professionals. Additionally, while we are experienced SP's, we recognize that we are not doctors, a distinction we've made clear in our script. This is a comedic web series, and our first goal is to entertain.  The educational aspect we've included centers on the world of SP's and communication - not the specifics of medicine, any particular medical school, or how they run.

story:
Our Story:

When a group of astray actors pursues a low budget, sci-fi web series opportunity in Los Angeles for the summer, they're not prepared for how deadly realistic it will become, or how hard it will be to make it to the credits alive.

Four years after high school graduation, this group of actors is scattered across the grid. From working their 9 - 5's in electronics at Target to booking Versace campaigns in Italy, acting is on the back burner. When Marcus recruits his friends for an upcoming, experimental project, the gang reluctantly agrees. They soon realize not all is what it seems.

"Fear doesn't go away. The warrior and the artist live by the same code of necessity, which dictates that the battle must be fought anew every day."

- Steven Pressfield, The War of Art (2002).

Callback is a story of being a part of something bigger than ourselves. Growing up, making tough decisions, and holding on tight for the ride of a lifetime. As artists, we continuously live in the unknown. Our series will reveal the challenges that come with following our dreams. Funding will be used to film a Proof of Concept 'prequel' for the series.

 

Enigma Soda: What is it?

Marcus' fridge was fully stocked with Enigma soda 24/7. His mother Emma, worked for the company, Gemini Corp, when she mysteriously vanished. A few years later, Marcus applies for what he thinks is a random acting gig for the group. They get it. Soon after, they realize the show is sponsored by none other than Enigma Soda. What is going on?!

 

Meet our cast (from left to right):

 

 Karla Corona, 21, as Athena.
 

Currently finishing up her senior year at UIC, Karla is originally from Florida. Since high school, Karla has fiercely pursued her passion for acting; having her cast in many productions throughout her career.

 

 MarieAnge Louis-Jean, 21, as Sunny.
 

MarieAnge is an artist from Chicago, also attending UIC for her final year of college. She brings her beautiful energy wherever she goes; tackling any creative escapade that comes her way.

 

 Kobi Lyles, 21, as Jaques.
 

Kobi is an actor, model, and dancer from Chicago residing in Fort Collins, Colorado. Described as a gentle giant at 6'6", Kobi is following his dreams of modeling and dancing. His child-like energy leaves any collaboration he steps foot in more refreshing than before.

 

 Coda Marcus, 21, as Marcus.
 

From Chicago, Coda has grown up around artists. When he found ChiArts, he found a community of people who, 8 years later, is family. School has taken Coda all around the world, and this summer he finally landed in Long Beach, with his mom and grandma.

 

 Santi Troncoso, 22, as Ked.
 

Santi attended Shurz high school in Chicago before going to UIC with a major in music business. He/They are well versed in the arts, as well as in business. Santi works to financially manage + market talent. Funding their own online business and running ad campaigns are all within Santi's wheelhouse.

 

 Trell Winters, 21, as Gio.
 

Trell Winters attended ChiArts in 2012, before going to Santa Fe University of Art & Design alongside Kobi, and Coda. When the school got shut down in 2017, Trell took life by the horns and began patiently building his empire. He works and acts fulltime to support his boyfriend and their two dogs.

 

Catherine Grace-Young, 23, as Baley.
 

Originally from Louisville, Kentucky, Catherine is finishing up her BFA at SUNY Purchase in New York. Her deep curiosity for all art leads her on adventures of experience.

$1,000

 

AIRFARE: $200

A few of our team members don't live in Chicago. We will set aside a portion of our funding to make sure they can make it to set.

 

GEAR, EQUIPMENT: $300

We will use some of our funding to rent camera, lighting, and sound equipment, Luckily, we have the bulk of what we need.

 

CRAFTY: $500

Everyone's gotta eat!

 

Risks & Challenges

We are aware that there are many obstacles to overcome. On February 1st, we launched Callback on Kickstarter with a budget of $20,000 in hopes of shooting all 6 episodes of our series. After re-evaluating our project towards the end of that campaign, we decided to switch gears a bit. We're deciding to shoot an incredible 10 minute Proof of Concept short film rather than scrambling to make it all happen at once. This, fortunately, minimizes many of our previous challenges, such as booking locations and flying the team out to LA. We are ready to take on these tasks, with many options as a back-up.  Everyone involved in this project is conscious of the risks & challenges involved. We are ready to make this happen with your support!

 

 

With love, Callback <3

 

 

*Cover art by Alan Cortes*

Soon after, they realize the show is sponsored by none other than Enigma Soda. What is going on?! Meet our cast (from left to right):  Karla Corona, 21, as Athena. Currently finishing up her senior year at UIC, Karla is originally from Florida. Since high school, Karla has fiercely pursued her passion for acting; having her cast in many productions throughout her career.  MarieAnge Louis-Jean, 21, as Sunny. MarieAnge is an artist from Chicago, also attending UIC for her final year of college. She brings her beautiful energy wherever she goes; tackling any creative escapade that comes her way.  Kobi Lyles, 21, as Jaques. Kobi is an actor, model, and dancer from Chicago residing in Fort Collins, Colorado. Described as a gentle giant at 6'6", Kobi is following his dreams of modeling and dancing. His child-like energy leaves any collaboration he steps foot in more refreshing than before.  Coda Marcus, 21, as Marcus. From Chicago, Coda has grown up around artists. When he found ChiArts, he found a community of people who, 8 years later, is family. School has taken Coda all around the world, and this summer he finally landed in Long Beach, with his mom and grandma.  Santi Troncoso, 22, as Ked. Santi attended Shurz high school in Chicago before going to UIC with a major in music business. He/They are well versed in the arts, as well as in business. Santi works to financially manage + market talent. Funding their own online business and running ad campaigns are all within Santi's wheelhouse.  Trell Winters, 21, as Gio. Trell Winters attended ChiArts in 2012, before going to Santa Fe University of Art & Design alongside Kobi, and Coda. When the school got shut down in 2017, Trell took life by the horns and began patiently building his empire. He works and acts fulltime to support his boyfriend and their two dogs. Catherine Grace-Young, 23, as Baley. Originally from Louisville, Kentucky, Catherine is finishing up her BFA at SUNY Purchase in New York. Her deep curiosity for all art leads her on adventures of experience.$1,000 AIRFARE: $200A few of our team members don't live in Chicago. We will set aside a portion of our funding to make sure they can make it to set. GEAR, EQUIPMENT: $300We will use some of our funding to rent camera, lighting, and sound equipment, Luckily, we have the bulk of what we need. CRAFTY: $500Everyone's gotta eat! Risks & ChallengesWe are aware that there are many obstacles to overcome. On February 1st, we launched Callback on Kickstarter with a budget of $20,000 in hopes of shooting all 6 episodes of our series. After re-evaluating our project towards the end of that campaign, we decided to switch gears a bit. We're deciding to shoot an incredible 10 minute Proof of Concept short film rather than scrambling to make it all happen at once. This, fortunately, minimizes many of our previous challenges, such as booking locations and flying the team out to LA. We are ready to take on these tasks, with many options as a back-up.  Everyone involved in this project is conscious of the risks & challenges involved. We are ready to make this happen with your support!  With love, Callback <3  *Cover art by Alan Cortes*

story:
BAD VEGAN$

BAD VEGAN$ is an 8 part comedy series that follows the 'bat shit crazy' lives of Jess and Ciara; two millennial aspiring actors living in a property guardianship in London. Set in a dilapidated ex-care home, we see the girls struggling to make ends meet, whilst attempting to live a vegan, ‘holistic’ lifestyle. Along the way, Jess and Ciara come into contact with outlandish, bizarre characters and their morals are tried and tested.

We have an amazingly talented cast and crew on board, with the entire crew being either female or LGBTQIA+. This is particularly exciting for us and will truly be a dream come true to shoot in this environment, given that both face discrimination in this industry. 

According to the Study of Women in Television and film, in the top 250 films in 2018, women make only make up:

(The center for the Study of Women in Television and Film)

8% of directors

16% of writers

4% of cinematographers

26% of producers

21% of executive producers

21% of editors

After an extensive search we found aero statistics on LGBTQIA+ crew on TV projects.

BAD VEGAN$ CAST AND CREW

Marie Williamson - Producer, writer, actor 

 Marie plays the character Jess. Marie is currently studying an MA in Acting at the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland. She has most recently been in Abandon- Lyric theatre Hammersmith - Anne Louse Sarks, RUSH -Space Theatre, Without Boarders - Hull Truck - Sarah Brigham, Tom Bellerby. She was also in award winning short film Winston and Daisy.

Amy Rose Esdale - Producer/writer/actor

Amy plays the character Ciara. Amy Rose Esdale is a northern Irish singer, songwriter, writer and actor. Films Amy Rose has acted in have been part of film festivals multinationally and have been screened in venues such as The Barbican Centre, London and the Queen's Film theatre, Belfast. 

Reeta Varpama - Director / Editor

Reeta is a director and award-winning editor she began her career in the Finnish TV industry in 2007. Reeta’s headline achievements include editing the upcoming independent feature film Drive Me to the End and BFI-funded short film Lost Land Girl. She has just been signed on as picture editor on the sci-fi thriller Beneath. She also cut Untethered for Channel 4’s Random Acts commission and completed various post-production work on feature films Mrs. Lowry And Son, Starfish, The More You Ignore Me and Rise of the Footsoldier 3. Reeta edited and colour graded horror comedy Toll Booth which won 7 awards on its festival run, as well as being selected to screen at the BAFTA-qualifying Leeds Film Festival. Her directorial works have been screened at the likes of Norwich Film Festival, Cambridge Film Festival and Berlin Feminist Film Week, unDependence Film Festival and Manchester Lift-Off Film Festival. Her creative ambition is to make powerful, meaningful and imaginative work that challenges and inspires to look at conventional perspectives and narratives in a new light.

TRAVIS BOOTH-MILLARD 

Travis plays the character of Moonchild 

Travis has performed in Feature Films including the July 2019 release of The Manson Family Massacre, as well as several short films and educational videos for BBC Bitesize

MATTHEW SHARPE - ACTOR 

After completing a successful year in Spain with Touring company Interacting Theatre Company. Matthew now performs in Local theatre in Belfast, shows including Othello as well a tour of Strung Out, a devised theatre piece around young offenders. As well as this he was worked along side BFI Academy in short films, "Dre" a RTS nominated short, BBC TV show Soft Border Patrol and finished shooting a Feature Normal People starring Liam Neeson.

:) 

We are so humbled that everyone involved in this project are working for free, purely because they believe in the future of BAD VEGAN$. So far we have acquired the majority of the locations for the shoot and the cameras and lighting equipment. 

Where your money will go...

  • Food & Coffee - A three day shoot will be intense, with early mornings and late nights. We need to ensure our cast and crew are alive and in good spirits, whilst performing their roles to the best of their ability. Everyone involved is giving up their time, skills and energy for free, so snacks, coffee and daily catering is essential for a happy team. 
  • Travel Costs - We need to pay for our cast & crew to get to and from the shoot easily, Over a period of three days, this really adds up, given that not everyone is based in London. We will also reimburse crew for expenses to and from meetings before the shoot. 
  • Art department - This covers costume, hair, makeup, and most importantly in our case; set design. All elements are integral to the story-line and creating the BAD VEGAN$, millenial world. 
  • Location Hire - For one scene in the pilot, we need to hire the space, which isn't cheap but is important to the plot.  

In supporting this project you are supporting Female / LGBTQIA+ creatives. 

Can't donate right now?

That's cool - we understand. Here's some ways in which you can help us out:

Sharing on social media.

Sending to friends and family you think might donate. 

Telling everyone about BAD VEGAN$ :) 

 

*** OUR BAD VEGAN$ THEME TUNE WAS WRITTEN BY THE AMAZING SPENCER ENOCK OF PYNCH @https://www.facebook.com/PynchBand/ 

Give them some love <3

Press shots by the incred Emily Auldyn <3

story:
Short Summary

Our modern world is so full of division, anger, hatred and pain. Our common response to pain & adversity is 'fight or flight'. But at Panacea, a non-profit media company, we are doing the opposite, by showing the power of confronting pain with an open heart. 

In December, we've been rolling out 31 daily videos around these narratives—all of which share Baltimore stories of empathy, healing and human connection. These stories can inspire others to find healing and transformation in themselves.  Throughout this campaign we have learned that these stories truly do inspire others to find deep healing and transformation in themselves -- and we have so many testimonials and comments that confirm this.

In our first video, a Baltimore resident named Hekima Amiri apologized to his son for not being in his life, and for being in prison for so many years.  In the first two days of its release, Hekima’s apology garnered more than 110,000 views on IGTV. Throughout the month, 1000s of people have commented with unadulterated support, while others have chosen to share their own stories, expressing newfound urges to turn their own resentment into forgiveness. 

Through reposts, our videos have gathered over 1 million views—not just from Baltimore residents, but from people all over the country. The overwhelming feedback signifies the extent to which Panacea's mission resonates with others, and how much these stories of forgiveness and healing are needed in today's world.

What We Need & What You Get

We want to continue creating new content, so that we can record as many follow up dialogues as possible. These efforts are made possible by individual donations. At Panacea, we’ve been so grateful for the generosity displayed by our community and supporters. Our supporters enable us to create, to heal communities, to share more stories. ​

Invest in this campaign. Invest in changing individual lives while millions watch creating a ripple effect touching millions. To see, witness, and to connect on the deepest levels of our shared humanity is the most empowering, the most freeing, and the greatest chance we all have to improve our world.  Violence, drugs, broken families—these will only be fixed when there is true healing. We know, because we have been doing this for years and have seen countless lives change. ​

This is the real change that is needed in our world.  We need your involvement, your investment.   

We are a 501c3 non-profit media platform. (contributions are tax deductible)

story:
Ben Deane and Andrew Laino have been best friends for over 13 years, and in that time we have both come out to one another, dealt with love and relationships, explored our individual sexualities, and most importantly: we have found a sense of community and family within our queer friends. 

We have also always been creative people, from the time we starred in a middle school production of Beauty and the Beast to the time we decided to start our own web series! Although both of us are actors, getting into the world of writing and tv production has been a thrilling journey for us thus far, and it is allowing us to tell the stories we want to tell, with the characters we want to see in modern media.

Who The Eff Are These Guys? is our attempt to create a style of queer media representation that is not defined by the struggles of queer folx, instead focusing on the joys and sense of family that can be found in the LGBTQ+ community. Our show is uplifting and funny, while providing complex characters within the rainbow spectrum - characters that delve deeper than the tired Hollywood stereotypes. 

We believe this show can help young queer people feel validated in their identities & their hope for future friendships/relationships/family, by defying stereotypes & providing accurate representation of queer people.

OUR PLAN:

Our plan is to create six episodes, including our already-released Pilot episode: Two Boys In Heat. Although the Pilot was limited in terms of budget, cast, and quality - we are excited to be improving on all aspects for Episodes 2-6, which are already outlined and/or in various stages of writing.


Each episode will release in 3 smaller parts, with one part debuting monthly (approx.), for more bite-sized adventures that form a cohesive, half-hour comedy narrative when combined.

 

You should, of course!!

The Problem:
Our biggest obstacle in creating the show so far has been lack of funding. Without sufficient funds, we cannot pay the artists involved, or get the necessary licenses/equipment/insurance/etc. that comes with filming in a major metropolitan area.

Show Costs:
For the show itself, we need funds to pay for:

  • Costuming
  • Sounds
  • Props
  • Filming Locations
  • Equipment (Camera, Microphones, Editing Software)
  • Insurance (for equipment and/or cast & crew)
  • Marketing (Posters, flyers, social media ads, etc)
  • and Much More!

Stipends:
We will be filming about 2-3 days of shooting each month. This will let us provide content to fans once per month. It may not sound like much, but that's just shooting. We need roughly 10 people working to coordinate schedules, equipment, etc - so it adds up.

We believe these artists should be paid for their hard work on the show; right now it is a passion project for us all, with all funds going into the show itself.
 

The Rewards:
Obviously, you'd have our eternal thanks for supporting the show.

But we can do even better! By supporting us, you can have your name in the show or the credits, receive a poster/exclusive "backers" tee for the show, or many more great rewards!

Please check out our rewards section for a detailed breakdown.


If We Don't Reach Our Goal:
If we don't raise the funds we're asking for, we will still be using every penny we raise to put into this show and the people dedicating their time and energy to helping it come to life. We will make as many episodes as we can, and cut whatever we need to in order to get things under budget.

 

Queer People:
We believe that queer people should have access to content that truthfully represents them, as more than cheap Hollywood stereotypes; people in the LGBTQ+ community should not have characters that represent only the struggles of their life, but characters that have a real sense of family, of identity, and of belonging.

Every queer person has had a moment in their life where they saw another queer person "living their truth" - being out, proud, and fully in control of their identity and sense of self - and it reassured them that it was okay to strive for that too. It's a validating experience, and whether it's through a real life individual or media representation, we believe that showcasing queer people as powerful and real individuals is important to help young queer folx accept themselves.

Everyone Else:
As much as we love our queer folx, we truly believe that the themes of this show: comedy, family, friendship are recognizable to every person, regardless of sexual and gender identity. Though the show is largely made by and for queer people, anyone with a best friend can relate to Ash and Oliver's journey, and the situations they find themselves in. There's banter and levity, and real heart beneath it - like any friendship worth having. We hope the audience becomes friends with these characters over time, as we've fallen in love with them all.

 

IN CONCLUSION:

We truly believe that Who The Eff Are These Guys? has the power to make real impact in the lives of queer people and their representation in modern media. We have a team of passionate people who have been working with little to no budget to even get this far, and who all want to come together to create something special and make people laugh. With your help, you can be part of that goal, and an invaluable member of the #WhoTheEff team.

Thank you for your time,

 

Note: This campaign is our second campaign. Our first campaign (Click Here) allowed us to bring on new people to the #WhoTheEff team, build our audience, and outline/script a full season of episodes, while looking into hiring Crew and organizing shooting schedules. Thank you for the funding thus far!

story:
"The theatre beats me, starves me, and forsakes me... But I love it" Stage Door.

I once told an acting professor, "If I knew it was going to be this hard, I don't know if I would have done it".  I was referencing the acting program that I was a part of.  It was my sophomore year of college and I was on probation in the acting program, and wasn't sure if I had it in me.  

This particular program started with 60 BFA acting students, and four years later only 18 of us graduated with that coveted BFA. Now, years later and working in Hollywood, I look back on that conversation and wonder: why? Why didn't I know how hard it would be? 

It occurred to me, actors are payed to make us believe a story is real. There for, we do not talk about how HARD it is to make something look so seamless.  Actors don't want to share how many times someone told them their work was shit. 

So I decided it was time to talk about it.  Time to show people all the work that goes into simply trying to be an actor.  

"Do It Better"  follows young actresses Carson and Lana on their journey through acting school; and all the pain + self doubt that accompanies it. 

Their professor, Darren, pushes the girls past their breaking point over, and over again.  He demands honesty in the girls work, and is relentless with his tactics in bringing it out of them. 

But how far will the girls be willing to bend over backwards to meet their teachers lofty expectations? How much will they give up in order to become everything they hope to be as artists? Everything is at risk-- friendships, jobs, boyfriends... even their own self respect. 

This series is a slice of life, and we know it will resonate with young artists everywhere.  It is honest, it is shocking... It's a peak inside an unexposed world. 

What We Need 

We are lucky, we have a team of actors and filmmakers who have been motivated to make "Do It Better" since it was only an idea.  Because of the passion behind the project, we have been able to get access to beautiful cameras, amazing locations, and PHENOMENAL actors for a very small price. But there are somethings that will cost a pretty penny, no matter how we slice it. 

  • Production Insurance 
  • Production Sound
  • FOOD
  • Lighting Packages

WE ARE SO CLOSE

We are stretching every dollar as far as we can and already have two thirds of the funding we need to make this first leg of the series, but we need this final push to make it happen!  

You are not only giving a voice to artists around the world when contributing to this project, but you are creating a huge opportunity for WOMEN in the film industry.  We are a predominately female cast, with a female director, and have created  a piece where we talk about something other than dating! (Thats kind of a big deal). Bet that makes you feel good about donating, huh?

Risks & Challenges

Being a female in the film industry is hard... it can be exhausting and testing.  And asking for the help to make this dream project happen makes me feel VERY vulnerable! But the actresses in this series, our director, and I are tired of waiting for projects that portray us the way we want to be seen in this industry. Making this series is a challenge in itself, but its worth all the reward. And I promise to use this incredible experience to keep fighting for a voice in this industry as a female and as a serious artist.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate this time? That's okay! Give us a share or like on Facebook + Instagram! The more people we can reach, the better! 

 

Clips of: Marymount Manhattan College's department of Theatre Arts, and actresses Alexandra Johnston, Madeleine Dean, and Jade Albany's show reels.
story_txt:
"The theatre beats me, starves me, and forsakes me... But I love it" Stage Door.
I once told an acting professor, "If I knew it was going to be this hard, I don't know if I would have done it".  I was referencing the acting program that I was a part of.  It was my sophomore year of college and I was on probation in the acting program, and wasn't sure if I had it in me.  
This particular program started with 60 BFA acting students, and four years later only 18 of us graduated with that coveted BFA. Now, years later and working in Hollywood, I look back on that conversation and wonder: why? Why didn't I know how hard it would be? 
It occurred to me, actors are payed to make us believe a story is real. There for, we do not talk about how HARD it is to make something look so seamless.  Actors don't want to share how many times someone told them their work was shit. 
So I decided it was time to talk about it.  Time to show people all the work that goes into simply trying to be an actor.  
"Do It Better"  follows young actresses Carson and Lana on their journey through acting school; and all the pain + self doubt that accompanies it. 
Their professor, Darren, pushes the girls past their breaking point over, and over again.  He demands honesty in the girls work, and is relentless with his tactics in bringing it out of them. 
But how far will the girls be willing to bend over backwards to meet their teachers lofty expectations? How much will they give up in order to become everything they hope to be as artists? Everything is at risk-- friendships, jobs, boyfriends... even their own self respect. 
This series is a slice of life, and we know it will resonate with young artists everywhere.  It is honest, it is shocking... It's a peak inside an unexposed world. 
What We Need 
We are lucky, we have a team of actors and filmmakers who have been motivated to make "Do It Better" since it was only an idea.  Because of the passion behind the project, we have been able to get access to beautiful cameras, amazing locations, and PHENOMENAL actors for a very small price. But there are somethings that will cost a pretty penny, no matter how we slice it. 

Production Insurance 
Production Sound
FOOD
Lighting Packages

WE ARE SO CLOSE
We are stretching every dollar as far as we can and already have two thirds of the funding we need to make this first leg of the series, but we need this final push to make it happen!  
You are not only giving a voice to artists around the world when contributing to this project, but you are creating a huge opportunity for WOMEN in the film industry.  We are a predominately female cast, with a female director, and have created  a piece where we talk about something other than dating! (Thats kind of a big deal). Bet that makes you feel good about donating, huh?
Risks & Challenges
Being a female in the film industry is hard... it can be exhausting and testing.  And asking for the help to make this dream project happen makes me feel VERY vulnerable! But the actresses in this series, our director, and I are tired of waiting for projects that portray us the way we want to be seen in this industry. Making this series is a challenge in itself, but its worth all the reward. And I promise to use this incredible experience to keep fighting for a voice in this industry as a female and as a serious artist.  
Other Ways You Can Help
Can't donate this time? That's okay! Give us a share or like on Facebook + Instagram! The more people we can reach, the better! 
 
Clips of: Marymount Manhattan College's department of Theatre Arts, and actresses Alexandra Johnston, Madeleine Dean, and Jade Albany's show reels.

story:
About Gym Life...

Hello everyone! My name is Ashley Grezbien and I'm one of the creators, writers, and actors in Gym Life. You can watch Season 1 here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rF2asygreXo&amp...

What is Gym Life? Well, besides being an award winning comedy web series...It's a single camera mockumentary style show, taking a look at the culture and day to day inside of a small local gym as told through the lenses of three gym employees. Season one follows Terry, the over animated, over motivational, and overly personal, small time gym owner who hires a college student, named Helen, to join him and his grumpy right hand man, Josh, in making their gym bigger and better, or fail trying.  The group puts forth initiatives to improve the gym and interact with the diverse crowd that walk in for a workout.

Everyone who has ever stepped foot in a gym, accepted a free membership trial that they barely used or just walked by a gym has a story...that's how Gym Life was born. With the help of an incredible group of talented people we put together a series that aims to show you what really goes on in a gym in the funniest way possible. Season One is almost finished and with your help we'll not only officially complete the season but we will put forth efforts to reach an even bigger audience.

Why Donate?

We've had an amazing response already! Winning Best Web Series and Best Web/TV Pilot at the Top Shorts Film Festival as well as Bronze at the Independent Shorts Awards for Best Web series/TV Pilot with an Honorable mention for Best Comedy Short is just the beginning. Now we are asking YOU...families, friends, friends of friends, or anyone who stumbled upon this page...we want to involve you! All donations to this campaign will go toward the completion and promotion of Season 1.

It can get pricey creating a show, thankfully we've already done half the work. Now we just need your help to bring it home and spread the word. Your donation will go toward:

  • Production of the rest of Season One
  • ​Social Media marketing via Facebook and Instagram

Surpassing Our Goal?

Should we surpass our goal we will do the following:

  • Actors Salary - Page after page, line after line. Our actors dedicated their time, gave up weekends and many precious sleep hours not to mention getting on the 405fwy during traffic hours just to bring you some laughs. 
  • Crew Salary - The muscle behind the project. Our small but dedicated crew lugged equipment to set each day and when we called cut their job doesn't stop there. Their dedication and commitment is endless.
  • Season 2 - We are beyond thrilled to have season one almost completed but we don't want to stop there. We wanna hit the ground running and dive right back in for Season 2 and it will be bigger and better than ever. 

Gym Life Thanks You...

It's never easy to ask for a donation nor is it something that we take lightly. The first half of season one is completely self funded and for anyone just starting out, you understand that every penny matters. So I, on behalf of my Gym Life family wish to give you our most sincere THANK YOU! Whether you donate or not, thank you for taking the time to read our story and watch the show. We hope it continues to bring you a little laugh each week. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to donate for whatever reason, but still want to help support Gym Life, here's a few ways how you can help!

  • Share the campaign with friends and family!
  • Follow us on Facebook, Youtube, Instagram or Twitter at @GymLifeShow
  1. Like, Follow or Subscribe
  2. Comment
  3. Share

Thank You for all of your support!

story:
Hi!  I'm Stewart Wade, an award-winning filmmaker known for features such Coffee Date, Tru Loved,  Such Good People, and the just-completed Say Yes.  Last year, I also released Coffee House Chronicles -- The Movie, which is all of the first season of this web series edited together with brand new footage.  You can see the trailer here.  You also can read a review, if you are interested.

Anyway, we are now about to start shooting the second season!  I love working on this series because it allows me to explore serious issues within the LGBTQ community -- but in a fun, comedic way.  

While LGBTQ characters are increasingly common in mainstream entertainment, too often we're presented as stereotypes or relegated to the sassy best friend role.  CHC presents our community in all its myriad variations -- warts and all.

For Season 2, I will be working with Vivian Tam, an independent producer who helped launch my career when she produced my first short film, Coffee Date, which went on to play at over 35 film festivals worldwide.  She was also a producer Say Yes.

We have eleven episodes scripted for this season.  We plan to release them as we finish them over the next two years or so.  We have already cast and will be shooting the first two episodes in late-July.  If you can help in any way (food, services, as an extra, etc.), please let us know!

story:
"Love At First Site," a romantic comedy web series. Synopsis: Julien is a young, hopeless romantic who spent his college days with his best friend Carmen. He always depended on Carmen setting up dates for him. After graduation, Julien moves to LA and becomes a Senior Talent Manager at an agency in Hollywood. There, he reunites with Carmen as she has successfully finished her internship and became a Senior Publicist for the same agency. Now, Julien’s lifestyle is changed in a way he isn’t quite used to. One day, when he scrolls on the Instagram app, he runs across a Dating App (hopefully Clover) where he matches with a beautiful girl. Unfortunately, that date turns out to be someone who’s he isn’t actually interested in, leading to Julien witnessing a revelation – he finally realizes that his true love has been sitting in front of him this whole time...

 

HOW YOUR DONATION WILL HELP

Paying our cast and crew - We are committed to fairly paying every single one of our cast and crew members for their hard work on this project.

Sanitation and safety measures - Our production is contingent on the health and safety of our cast and crew. We will only proceed with shooting days as long as small indoor gatherings are permitted. Additionally, we will be providing every possible on-set safety measure such as masks and sanitizing materials.

Music - We are reaching out to local Los Angeles artists to help us create a unique soundscape for the series. We want to ensure that all of these talented musicians are paid for their contribution to the series.

Securing locations - Shooting on professional tennis courts and locker rooms will help us to tell a story that visually challenges the preconceived notion of these spaces.

Equipment rentals - We can’t shoot a web series without gear! Your donations will help us to make our vision a reality by using the necessary camera, lights, and sound recording equipment.

On set meals - That’s right, where there are people, there must be food. We want to ensure that no one on set goes hungry or uncaffeinated!

story:
Help us get our show onto television! Normal People Explain Things to Me is a comedy series about an autistic family written from an autistic point of view. TV shows today with autistic characters are written by neurotypical people and don’t represent autistic people the way they actually are in their variety, and certainly they never portray autistic people from their point of view.

 

I am an autistic actress and writer with 20 years’ experience in the industry. I created this show because I could not relate to the autistic characters I was seeing on television nor did they resemble autistic people I knew, such as the ones in my family. I aim to show the world the humanity of autistic people and create a very funny show that anyone of any neurotype can enjoy.  This will be the first show written from the autistic point of view on television.  My goal is to get this onto a streaming network or premium cable channel.

 

To this end, I’m shooting a trailer next month as a proof of concept to network executives and to also attract a producing partner. And this costs MONEY. I’m asking for $10,000 but ANYTHING you donate will go to defray production costs, such as equipment rental, catering (I have lots of hungry actors and crew to feed), and post-production. I have so many people who are donating their time and talent to this project. I would love to be able to pay them.  But whether or not we reach the full amount I am trying to raise, we will shoot this trailer beginning on March 9. This trailer will be posted on YouTube and Facebook for public perusal. Like Normal People Explain Things to Me on Facebook!

 

The crew is already assembled and we have already started pre-production. We start casting on February 9. I have produced a number of things successfully, but this is my largest project yet. One thing I have always been good at is surmounting obstacles. My director, Jamila Brown, is also an experienced director whom I’ve worked with before. I am so excited to work with her again.

 

In the video above, my director, Jamila Brown, and I, discuss the project.

 

Thanks for your help!

 

Pamela Ehn

Executive Producer

Pink Elephant Productions

 

 

And if you can’t donate, please share this campaign! Thank you so much for your help!
