story:
The Story.

Victoria's last night of kinky passion has put her in an awkward situation forcing her to reface her cheating ex-boyfriend.

 

Short Summary

HELLO ALL! Thank you for visiting our campaign!

Now, ready to create again, and this time with something to bring you A LOT of laughter, inspiration, adventure and entertainment (something we all need after the year we've had)

This pandemic has proven more than ever how much we really need stories, inspiration, adventure and laughter, as these important factors contribute to healing our minds, allowing for us to feel emotions and experience new journeys.

BUT I NEED YOUR SUPPORT!

As your contribution will not only help to bring alive this incredibly funny project, it will grant opportunities to other creative workers, moving everyone a step closer towards their career ambitions. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Filmmaking is a vital and time consuming task that takes care and explanation. 

Our budget for Victoria is to raise an additional £5,000. With the funds provided by amazing donors and contributors like you we can allocate the amounts to designated areas of the production: Location, crew & cast wages, travel expenses, food, wardrobe, hair & make-up, post production (editing, color grading, music, sound editing, graphic design and credits) & campaign fees.

We already have the credible Imotions Production team ready to go and now it's my job to raise extra funds to support in the areas mentioned above and to find a VERY FUNNY actor to star alongside!! - Hmmm where could he be?!?!

If we exceed £5,000 then 10% of the raised amount will be sent to the Children's Society.

 

Perks for your donation include:

 

£10 - A thank you on social media on The Road to Hollywood

 

£25 - A copy of the script emailed to you and thank you on The Road to Hollywood

 

£50 - A signed by cast & director script & thank you on The Road To Hollywood 

 

£100 - A digital copy of the poster, a signed by cast, director & producer script, a personalised Victoria designed T-Shirt and thank you on The Road to Hollywood

 

£250 -  Associate Producer credited on IMDb, a personalised 'Victoria' mug and a thank you on The Road to Hollywood.

 

£500 - Executive Producer credited on IMDb, a personalised gift hamper and a thank you on on The Road to Hollywood.

 

The Impact

Contributing to an independent film is a magical thing. You help support the art and the vision of people who want to project their message to the masses. It gives opportunities for creative workers, helping them to connect with others and lead them on to more possibilities.

 

Risks & Challenges

Of course risks and challenges can happen with embarking on any journey. There can be setbacks, technical issues, drop outs, mistakes and much more, but through our combined filmmaking experience, collaboration with others, reliable talent, plus with the additional support provided with through University, I am confident in ensuring that any obstacle and challenge can be overcome so the project reaches its destination. You will be able to see weekly updates which will be viewable on my 'The Road to Hollywood' journey (uploaded on Instagram, YouTube and Facebook) so you can keep up-to-date to see that everything is always moving forward.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that in the time of the pandemic money may be tight or hard to come by. Other ways you can help are by blasting this campaign all over social media, through word of mouth to your friends and family, and networking with individuals who may want to support in the same ways or through contributing. No amount is too small and every second uttering the words to help fund Spin is a step toward success. 

And that's all there is to it.

 

THANK YOU!!!

story:
i. the story

We have successfully filmed the first two episodes that tell the stories of JULIUS, a self-proclaimed "Renaissance man" who uses sex and luxury to cover his pain and JAMES, a lonely skater boy lost in his own head. Currently, we are in production of the final two episodes that focus on MADISON, a transfer who finds herself in too deep while pledging a sorority and FRANCES, a jaded upperclassman who enters a dicey relationship with a grad student.

In the episode "Hazed and Confused", Madison is a new transfer to Beckett University looking to start fresh, make friends, and become a part of something...so she joins a sorority. But during the pledge process, she finds herself submitting herself to extreme tasks of vile humiliation. All of the other sorority pledges seem to be fine with the hazing for the sake of the sisterhood, but Madison can't help but question if it's all worth it. As the sorority continues to play tricks and games with her mind, Madison's life becomes even more complicated when she learns that somebody knows her dirty little secret... Will Madison persevere past the pledge process to feel a part of something? Or will she find more surprising answers to what she really wants in life?

In the season finale of Dorm Dayz, "The Graduate", Frances is a guarded upperclassman who's too cool for school. After another unfulfilling college party, Frances finds herself annoyed on the streets of Cambridge where she meets Adam, a grad student from a prestigious university. A seemingly casual night at his apartment turns into something else... But as a major surprise pops out of nowhere, the relationship turns into something Frances hadn't expected. Has Frances finally found someone to open up to? In this special episode of Dorm Dayz, new connections between the four characters are revealed. A final shocking reveal leads two characters to a dangerous dance near the edge of death. 

 

ii. the characters

(Charlotte Horan)

Madison (played by Charlotte Horan) is a transfer from a Ivy League-like school who comes to Beckett University in Boston for a breath of fresh air. She wants to be a part of a social crowd, she wants to make friends, she wants to feel connected to others. Her desire for belonging leads to her joining a sorority. Diving into the pledge process, Madison soon realizes that being a part of this sisterhood bears a price. Madison struggles deciding if the in-group, tribal nature of the sorority is really what she wants in life.

(Taylor Zavala)

Frances (played by Taylor Zavala) is a neurotic, jaded upperclassman who feels stuck in Boston. She hides her emotions under a pair of sunglasses, which she wears almost everywhere. She holds up this persona of "I'm too good for you and anyone else in this world." However, underneath this callous mask, there is a deep vulnerability. When she meets Adam, she begins to finally open up and believe that she's capable of love again. But being vulnerable leaves Frances in new emotional situations she never some coming. 

 

Supporting Roles from "Hazed and Confused"

(Anna Edwards)

Krysta (played by Anna Edwards) is Madison's closest friend through the pledging process. She's comforting to the other pledges and extremely passionate and dedicated to join the sisterhood

(Deanna Drennen)

Sage (played by Deanna Drennen) is the sorority's "It Girl" who holds a lot of social power in the sisterhood. Sage puts Madison in a compromising position when she tells a fraternity brother to flirt with her.

(Pedro Espinola)

Rocco (played by Pedro Espinola) is a flirtatious fraternity brother who tries to seduce Madison as a part of a game with Sage.

(Lauren Brooks)

Annabelle (played by Lauren Brooks) is the sorority's biggest gossip girl. She's very dramatic and when she sees the opportunity to spill tea on Madison, she takes it.

 

Supporting Roles from "The Graduate"

(Alex Hughes)

Adam (played by Alex Hughes) is a graduate student living in Cambridge. He's charismatic, suave, and friendly. Frances is initially attracted to him because he's not a college undergrad. He's older, thus, hopefully more mature. While everything might seem perfect about Adam, he hides a secret that might send his relationship to Frances spiraling down.

(Angel Perez)

Benson (played by Angel Perez) is Frances' best, and only, friend. They frequent a coffeeshop to gossip over espresso. He's easy-going and non-judgmental, as he supports Frances even when she can be a bit impulsive.

(Mika Wiley)

Alex (played by Mika Wiley) is a free-spirit who Frances meets in an unexpected moment.

 

iii. the world

Julius, James, Madison, and Frances all attend a fictitious liberal arts school in Boston, "Beckett University." The college is set in an urban landscape. Boston gives us a beautifully rich backdrop. We thought it was appropriate to set the story here because after all, it is one of the biggest college cities in the world. Boston also has that "small town" city vibe, since you can run into people you know wherever you go. For this reason, Beckett University and Boston can at times, feel like too much of a bubble for our characters, who want to burst out, explore life, and ultimately find out who they are.

 

iv. the look

From the beginning of writing Dorm Dayz, creators Will D'Epagnier and Tori Fabio wanted to produce something raw, beautiful, dark, stylized, and honest. The initial pitch to fellow classmates was "American Horror Story meets Skins." We want to blend realism with surreal lighting and captivating editing.

Director Taylor Zavala on the look of the Madison episode: "Crisp but at times, unsettling. Because we will be in such close contact with the eye of the protagonist we're going for a look that represents both worlds, Madison's, which will appear in certain tones of color, and the world that everyone exists in, which tones will be adjusted. The palette of the sunrise will be representative of Madison's true self. While more harsh cutting colors, such as red, will emulate other scenes."

Director Sydney Rae Chin on the look of the Frances episode: "Dark but also times of color and warmness." The dark, colder colors will be symbolic of Frances' facade and disconnection from emotion, while the warmness will symbolize her opening up herself to others.

 

v. the music

We don't want to do what many college students and simply use royalty-free music, or worse, use music we don't have the rights do. Instead, we are collaborating with several independent musicians, many of them students, to produce soundtracks right for each episode. 

Madison's episode is dreamy and hypnotic, representative of her drifting from a dazed mindset to total chaos during her pledging of the sorority.

Frances' episode has more darker electronic beats, jazz, and an overall, femme-fatale feel. The tone will change to more soft, mellow music as we get closer to the inner vulnerability of the character.

vi. the budget

While we have access to equipment and other necessities, we still need your help to make this all possible! Much of our budget will go to craft services for our cast and crew, followed by our detailed and stylized production design/wardrobes. We need all the help we can get to make Dorm Dayz the best it can be!

vii. the dorm dayz fam

We are a collective of students, artists, young professionals, filmmakers, actors, and more than anything, storytellers. This is an independent passion project! We aren't submitting this for class assignment, though we hope to submit it festivals. We are here to tell a story that means something to us. 

(Will D'Epagnier)

(Tori Fabio)

Will D'Epagnier and Tori Fabio are Producers and the Co-Creators of Dorm Dayz. They met at Emerson College, became close friends, and late 2016, wanted to collaborate on a story. They both expressed frustration with lack of truthful storytelling when it came to college kids. Both of them being lovers of character-driven stories, Will and Tori wrote the Dorm Dayz series outline in less than a week. They were going to produce the project through a school organization, but ended up falling in love with the idea of independently producing it to increase their creative control. They have loved collaborating with friends and also giving opportunities to other classmates, including freshmen new to media production.

(Taylor Zavala)

In addition to playing Frances, Taylor Zavala is a Producer and the Director for the Madison episode: "Her story is about committing to one's self while searching for a satisfaction that really becomes torture. I want to expose Madison's perspective through visual detail, pulling the audience out of the chaos, as Madison pulls herself out into a world that is all her own. With focus on a true, personality, I want to strip common tropes of their glamorized masks, creating an experience both stylistically enchanting and emotionally raw."

(Sydney Rae Chin)

Sydney Rae Chin is a Producer and the Director for the Frances episode: "The story I’m telling is one of loneliness and emotional distance. It just happens to have people of color in all the roles without making their identities the main plot point. I’m approaching it by emphasizing how hookup culture can make one feel lonely. Like the cast, our crew is mostly composed of people of color. It’s important that representation is changed within a white heterosexual male industry."

(Anna Abbanat)

Anna Abbanat is a Producer for the Frances Episode and the Assistant Director for the Madison episode: "One thing that’s really great about this project this project provides the opportunity for underclassmen to take on key rolls in the crew. This allows the underclassmen a chance to learn and develop their skills on this set. Often people forget that everyone starts somewhere. Underclassmen are just as capable and have been proving themselves valuable assets since the beginning of this project."

(Dan Nevins)

Dan Nevins is the Director of Photography for the Madison episode: "As the DP on the episode 'Hazed and Confused,' I️ am working closely with the director to create a unique and exciting visual experience. Through the use of colors and camera techniques, the nuances in the story will be reflected in a way people might not think. I️ think that we will produce an episode that speaks volumes!"

(Dimitrie Flores)

Dimitrie Flores is the Director of Photography for the Frances episode.

(Izzy Kingstep)

Izzy Kingstep is the Production Designer for the Madison episode.

(Amaia)

Amaia Rioseco is the Production Designer for the Frances episode: "Our sets and costumes for 'The Graduate' are going to aim at being hip and stylish with the goal of representing the college students of today and their daily lives and struggles. I'm very excited to work on this set to get every detail to be what the character's lives would actually look like. The story is so real and relatable that the sets and costumes should match as well."
story_txt: i. the storyWe have successfully filmed the first two episodes that tell the stories of JULIUS, a self-proclaimed "Renaissance man" who uses sex and luxury to cover his pain and JAMES, a lonely skater boy lost in his own head. Currently, we are in production of the final two episodes that focus on MADISON, a transfer who finds herself in too deep while pledging a sorority and FRANCES, a jaded upperclassman who enters a dicey relationship with a grad student.In the episode "Hazed and Confused", Madison is a new transfer to Beckett University looking to start fresh, make friends, and become a part of something...so she joins a sorority. But during the pledge process, she finds herself submitting herself to extreme tasks of vile humiliation. All of the other sorority pledges seem to be fine with the hazing for the sake of the sisterhood, but Madison can't help but question if it's all worth it. As the sorority continues to play tricks and games with her mind, Madison's life becomes even more complicated when she learns that somebody knows her dirty little secret... Will Madison persevere past the pledge process to feel a part of something? Or will she find more surprising answers to what she really wants in life?In the season finale of Dorm Dayz, "The Graduate", Frances is a guarded upperclassman who's too cool for school. After another unfulfilling college party, Frances finds herself annoyed on the streets of Cambridge where she meets Adam, a grad student from a prestigious university. A seemingly casual night at his apartment turns into something else... But as a major surprise pops out of nowhere, the relationship turns into something Frances hadn't expected. Has Frances finally found someone to open up to? In this special episode of Dorm Dayz, new connections between the four characters are revealed. A final shocking reveal leads two characters to a dangerous dance near the edge of death.  ii. the characters(Charlotte Horan)Madison (played by Charlotte Horan) is a transfer from a Ivy League-like school who comes to Beckett University in Boston for a breath of fresh air. She wants to be a part of a social crowd, she wants to make friends, she wants to feel connected to others. Her desire for belonging leads to her joining a sorority. Diving into the pledge process, Madison soon realizes that being a part of this sisterhood bears a price. Madison struggles deciding if the in-group, tribal nature of the sorority is really what she wants in life.(Taylor Zavala)Frances (played by Taylor Zavala) is a neurotic, jaded upperclassman who feels stuck in Boston. She hides her emotions under a pair of sunglasses, which she wears almost everywhere. She holds up this persona of "I'm too good for you and anyone else in this world." However, underneath this callous mask, there is a deep vulnerability. When she meets Adam, she begins to finally open up and believe that she's capable of love again. But being vulnerable leaves Frances in new emotional situations she never some coming.  Supporting Roles from "Hazed and Confused"(Anna Edwards)Krysta (played by Anna Edwards) is Madison's closest friend through the pledging process. story:
Executive Producer

Michael DiMartino has been producing events for 30 years. These events range from small cultural arts related events to large international festivals including Mexico, Brazil, Egypt and Morocco. He also founded Global Rhythms, a world music radio show that lasted for 3 years in the 1990's and GAIA-Vision, a TV show dedicated to performing, visual and healing arts that ran in 12 cities in New England for over 4 years.

Michael also worked for the Robert Frost library in Amherst Massachusetts as a media assistant and over the last 30 years he has also produced two full length musicals and over 20 different Cd's for various musical talent. Mr. DiMartino also founded World Beat Ensemble an educational program that has presented in over a hundred different schools, institutions and venues. In the past he has worked for the Massachusetts five college system doing music related support for the dance department. He currently works part time for the University of California Dance & Theatre Department in Santa Cruz, California.

Summary

The Golden Road TV & Radio Show

Vision:
We believe in a conscious, positive, peaceful, inclusive and sustainable future, honoring the wisdom of the past and the creativity of today.

Concept:
*Weekly two hour radio/television show online and on the regional independent stations. Magazine format showcasing regional and national performers, experts and educators.
*Content will be streamed online, and via podcasts and with mobile access through a dedicated Golden Road Radio Hour App.
*Ongoing live-audience broadcasts with music, performances and educational content.
(Portion of ticket sales go to nonprofits supporting the Arts and Youth)

The Golden Road TV & Radio Show is currently broadcasting two hours of weekly content on multiple platforms online and in 9 counties, on cable TV. This includes Nevada County TV, Truckee Tahoe Access Television, Butte County Access Television, Auburn/Placer Community Television, Access Sacramento and Shasta Community Access, Calaveras/Amadour and Siskiyou County . We also Broadcast Live on YouTube and our Ustream Channel. Our audio version is available on KVMR 89.5 FM in Nevada City, KUBU 96.5 FM in Sacramento and our podcast on iTunes. http://www.GoldenRoadRadiohour.com / http://www.GoldenRoadTelevision.com

What We Need

On average a two hour live stream production will cost from $1500-$2500 per show. Golden Road Productions is able to produce a weekly show for $500/show or $2,000 a month. We have a flexible team of professionals who know the production process and work with efficiency and effectiveness. We need $24,000 for the 2018 production year to cover costs and keep the momentum going.

Please help support the golden road TV and radio show. The world is changing fast and conscious and enlightened and educational independent media is crucial for our community. We have covered over 100 different individuals and organizations over the last year and have done almost 40 live broadcasts.

1) go to our Facebook page & like comment & share. https://m.facebook.com/GoldenRoadRadio/?ref=boo...

2) make a donation on our Indie gogo campaign even one dollar helps https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-golden-r...

3) submit content or come on the show. We also have a free podcast app on iTunes and you can listen to us. www.GoldenRoadRadioHour.com

Other Ways You Can Help

    •    Ask your friends and folks to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
    •    Follow us and Like us on Facebook
    •    Share on Instagram, and Tweet about the campaign
    •    Tell your friends to watch us on YouTube
    •    Download the podcast on iTunes
    •    Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
KingPin Fan Series

 When Wilson Fisk kills his mentor Don Rigoletto he begins his reign as New Yorks top crime boss. The series will follow Wilson Fisk aka The Kingpin as he rebuilds the Rigoletto crime syndicate as his own. He believes what he is doing is the right thing, but there are others who see it in a different light. What the Goal of this campaign ultimately is to make the best fan series we can, all the money we ask for is to rent the best equipment we can, pay for any fees and location rentals needed to create the best series we can, and feed our cast and crew as well.  The best part it will be free to view on Youtube!

story:
***** ALSO PLEASE CHECK OUT THE UPDATES SECTION TO SEE THE VIDEO FOR MY 3 TIER INCENTIVE PROGRAM SO YOU CAN SEE WHAT YOU GET BACK WHEN YOU DONATE.

 

Who am I?

My name is Barrett Shuler and I'm an actor-writer-filmmaker-musician.

Hyphens make me sound successful.

I have been acting for a while and making films on my own for sometime.  This is a project that I am very passionate about and I would love to make it. 

I've been playing in bands since I was 13 and I've always wanted to make a show about a band from my perspective.

Here is a list of some of the bands I've been in that you probably have never heard of:

A LOST CAUSE

NINE MONTH ANNIVERSARY

BROTHER BEAR

TASTE THE WINE

SKELETWINS

LATE NIGHT FRIENDS
 

What We Need & What We Have.

As you know shooting anything is expensive from a web-series to short films to features. I don't have enough money to pay my crew and get locations and whatnot. So I need your help.

I have a DP, AC, Gaffer and Sound, but I need to pay them which is where the money is going.  I also have a bunch of talented actors and musicians who I need to feed to keep alive.

story:
Short Summary

Modern Pioneering is the new show that fans of my show "Wild Food" have been asking for. Nearly all of the elements are in place to make it happen -- American Public Television is extremely excited about the show, the episodes are filmed, and a top-notch producer and crew are on board. I just need to raise enough money to pay for the distribution costs that will allow the show to reach U.S. households nationwide, giving free access to everyone regardless of whether they can afford cable or Netflix -- and your support can help make it happen! 

If you believe in the importance of small businesses and learning to create with your own two hands, not just in your own life, but for our society as a whole, I know you will feel good about sponsoring this quality show. 

The minimum goal of $30,000 will fund the closed captioning and distribution costs and get the show launched. We plan to deliver the show to American Public Television as soon as that goal is reached. The stretch goal of $70,000 will fund that plus 7 more episodes. Once these goals are met, the show will be accessible to everyone nationwide.

So many people have told me they are fed up with most of the lifestyle, travel, food and cooking shows on TV today. They are tired of all the extreme eating and contests, and they wish there were a show that reflected the way they really want to eat and live, that gave them inspiring and practical recipes projects and skills, for living a better life. 

Modern Pioneering is exactly that. It's a show that hits the sweet-spot where inspiration and self-sufficiency meet -- filled with incredibly inspiring unsung heroes who are making the best with their own two hands and preserving traditions, all the while sharing useful tips, recipes, and knowledge that you can apply to your own life.

In each episode, I visit a community and meet their artisans, farmers and makers. In some cases I teach, in others I'm the student. I will bring you into my own home and garden as well to teach you my favorite homespun techniques and recipes. I will help you create ideas and solutions for a healthy joyful life.

What You Get

In exchange for your contribution, you will get one of the many perks listed here. Click through each perk listed to get further details.  The more you contribute, the perks will combine and increase.  In a few of the perks, we'll have the opportunity to meet and cook together, where you can ask me your pressing cooking questions. In one of the perks, I'll do a virtual book signing and book talk, and if you're an aspiring book writer, we can talk about the book writing process. Any of these perks would also make an amazing gift for someone you love! If you want to back this campaign without receiving a perk, simply click the pink "Back It" button at the top and contribute any amount you wish.

The Impact

You will be the reason these values are on television. In supporting the distribution of this show, you're making a valuable contribution to the world by sharing the stories of small businesses that need the exposure more than ever right now. You're also creating access to free quality content on Public Television for people nationwide, regardless of whether they can afford cable or Netflix.

Risks & Challenges

Once this campaign is funded the only reason the show would not be distributed is if American Public Television disappeared, which is very unlikely. Any additional funding to meet the stretch goal would go toward producing more episodes and getting it to as many PBS stations as possible around the country. Since each station is individually operated I cannot guarantee the show would air in your area, but since it would be made available on-line right after it airs on TV, everyone will ultimately have a chance to view it. Eventually, after it has had the chance to air on public television, we will distribute it to on-demand platforms.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please help me get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • You can use the Indiegogo share tools to help share this on your favorite social media platform, and even better, send an email or text message to 10 people right now with a link to this campaign and why it matters to you. Here is a simple message you can copy and paste:
    "Hey Friends, join me in supporting the launch of this new TV show on Public Television. If you believe in the importance of small businesses and learning to create with your own two hands, not just in your own life, but for our society as a whole, I know you will feel good about sponsoring this quality show."

 

And that's all there is to it!
story_txt:
Short Summary
Modern Pioneering is the new show that fans of my show "Wild Food" have been asking for. Nearly all of the elements are in place to make it happen -- American Public Television is extremely excited about the show, the episodes are filmed, and a top-notch producer and crew are on board. I just need to raise enough money to pay for the distribution costs that will allow the show to reach U.S. households nationwide, giving free access to everyone regardless of whether they can afford cable or Netflix -- and your support can help make it happen! 
If you believe in the importance of small businesses and learning to create with your own two hands, not just in your own life, but for our society as a whole, I know you will feel good about sponsoring this quality show. 
The minimum goal of $30,000 will fund the closed captioning and distribution costs and get the show launched. We plan to deliver the show to American Public Television as soon as that goal is reached. The stretch goal of $70,000 will fund that plus 7 more episodes. Once these goals are met, the show will be accessible to everyone nationwide.
So many people have told me they are fed up with most of the lifestyle, travel, food and cooking shows on TV today. They are tired of all the extreme eating and contests, and they wish there were a show that reflected the way they really want to eat and live, that gave them inspiring and practical recipes projects and skills, for living a better life. 
Modern Pioneering is exactly that. It's a show that hits the sweet-spot where inspiration and self-sufficiency meet -- filled with incredibly inspiring unsung heroes who are making the best with their own two hands and preserving traditions, all the while sharing useful tips, recipes, and knowledge that you can apply to your own life.
In each episode, I visit a community and meet their artisans, farmers and makers. In some cases I teach, in others I'm the student. I will bring you into my own home and garden as well to teach you my favorite homespun techniques and recipes. I will help you create ideas and solutions for a healthy joyful life.

What You Get
In exchange for your contribution, you will get one of the many perks listed here. Click through each perk listed to get further details.  The more you contribute, the perks will combine and increase.  In a few of the perks, we'll have the opportunity to meet and cook together, where you can ask me your pressing cooking questions. In one of the perks, I'll do a virtual book signing and book talk, and if you're an aspiring book writer, we can talk about the book writing process. Any of these perks would also make an amazing gift for someone you love! If you want to back this campaign without receiving a perk, simply click the pink "Back It" button at the top and contribute any amount you wish.

The Impact
You will be the reason these values are on television. In supporting the distribution of this show, you're making a valuable contribution to the world by sharing the stories of small businesses that need the exposure more than ever right now. You're also creating access to free quality content on Public Television for people nationwide, regardless of whether they can afford cable or Netflix.

Risks & Challenges
Once this campaign is funded the only reason the show would not be distributed is if American Public Television disappeared, which is very unlikely. Any additional funding to meet the stretch goal would go toward producing more episodes and getting it to as many PBS stations as possible around the country. Since each station is individually operated I cannot guarantee the show would air in your area, but since it would be made available on-line right after it airs on TV, everyone will ultimately have a chance to view it. Eventually, after it has had the chance to air on public television, we will distribute it to on-demand platforms.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please help me get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
You can use the Indiegogo share tools to help share this on your favorite social media platform, and even better, send an email or text message to 10 people right now with a link to this campaign and why it matters to you. Here is a simple message you can copy and paste:"Hey Friends, join me in supporting the launch of this new TV show on Public Television. If you believe in the importance of small businesses and learning to create with your own two hands, not just in your own life, but for our society as a whole, I know you will feel good about sponsoring this quality show."

 
And that's all there is to it!

story:
What is Well Fed?

Emily and Dana here, the creators and stars of Well Fed. What started out as acquaintances working at a local beer garden in West Hollywood, turned into a friendship solidified over the love for expensive dinners, craft cocktails, and talking in depth about what it means to be a “starving artist.” Tales of struggle and surviving on cheese sandwiches and ramen. The blood, sweat, and tears. Let's face it; everybody loves a good success story, but real success comes from having that hunger in your belly, that drive that launches you forward to succeed. We had an idea based off this play on words and created characters who are unapologetically not hungry–they're well fed. Metaphorically and physically well fed by food, companionship, and, most importantly, the journey to find themselves.

We are inspired by shows like Broad City, Insecure, and Girls because they show us millennials breaking the rules and living selfishly and freely for their art. These strong, female characters give us permission to break away from traditions our parents were taught, like the nonnegotiable importance of having a standard 9 to 5, finding love and getting married before 30, and popping out a few kids, all before knowing who we really are and what we want to be: our identity. Times have changed, and social media makes us feel that everyone has their shit together. It keeps us constantly comparing ourselves to this “curated reality.” We want to be a guiding light for our viewers to let them know: we don’t have anything together, and that’s ok! We aren’t born with answers, we find them through our life experiences, our tribe, and enjoying life in the moment, because life is already too serious.

 

The Team

Dana Shiree is from Westchester, New York and her greatest joy since moving to LA two years ago is that she never has to hear the word “upstate” ever again. Her dream was to be an archaeologist, but she settled for something a little more realistic. She took her BFA at Emerson and decided to leave everything she knows to live behind a curtain in Hollywood, work numerous background gigs, and get paid in food. She considers Well Fed her food baby. She thanks Emily for being able to take her unfiltered thoughts and words and turn them into art.

Emily Day Blackwell is from the coast of South Carolina, or, as some call it, the "Dirty Myrtle." She used to avoid that name at all costs but now finds it fitting. She dabbles in a little bit of everything! Over the past 3 years, she has produced and starred in two award-winning dramatic shorts but also enjoys making others laugh! You can find Emily studying at The Groundlings School, where she recently passed into the advanced lab level. Nod your head and pretend you know what that means! It's ok, she’s still pretty confused about it too! She considers Well Fed her love child with Dana, and thanks her co-creator for the millions of messages she receives each day, which cover everything from potential illnesses, vague stories about somebody Emily doesn’t even know, or the next great restaurant they’re going to… that they can’t afford.

Kim Burns is from the city of cheesesteaks and brotherly love.  She is an award-winning actress and producer with a feature coming out later this year.  She's stoked to be part of the Well Fed Series and hopes Emily and Dana won't just utilize her amazing acting skills. She's a hand model too, goshdarnit!

Teddy Purdy was destined to act; it was clear from the moment he stepped on to a Cape Cod high school stage to deliver 5–10 lines of The Crucible. Seven years and six cross-country trips later, he does improv and performs in the occasional short film in LA. Teddy does extensive research for his roles and has eaten every Instagram-famous food in LA to prepare for Well Fed.

 James Elwood started his career in Boston, studying and performing improv and sketch comedy. He recently moved to Hollywood to fulfill his dream of doing 10-minute improv sets in various strip malls across Los Feliz.

 

What We Need

  • $5,000: Cast and Crew Expenses. If we raise $5,000, we will be able to cover not only our “on camera” crew and their wardrobe, props, etc., but also our ideal “behind camera” crew and all of the additional costs associated with renting equipment, kit fees, and more. While some of our crew lives here in Los Angeles, a few live out of state. Being able to help them with travel and board expenses would be huge. Our biggest goal is to fairly compensate everybody involved for their hard work:)
  • $2,000: Food and Beverage. We provide our cast and crew with breakfast, lunch, and dinner when they are on set with us. We will shoot 6-8 full days and require another 2 weeks of post production. We’ve got a lot of mouths to feed! 
  • $2,000: Locations, Gas, and Accidentals. You never know what's going to come up on set, and since we film in Los Angeles (where parking, among other things, is ridiculous), we want to plan ahead and make sure we are covered for any potential problems or challenges we may run into along the way. 
  • $1,000: Marketing. To spread our message, we need to get Well Fed out into the world! Having a full marketing budget would allow us to cover the cost of submitting Well Fed to film festivals and introducing it to bigger platforms. It would also support the purchase of business cards and other necessary items so that we can show Well Fed to as many people as possible.

 

What You Get

  • Shout out on our Instagram page!
  • Customized Well Fed sticker!
  • Customized Well Fed enamel pin!
  • Hand-written thank you card from us!
  • Autographed script!
  • Personalized thank-you video!
  • Executive Producer credit!
  • Last but not least (drumroll please)..... dinner with us!  

 

Why Now?

Now more than ever it's time for real, gritty, female stories to be told. As women in this industry, sometimes the material we're given can pigeon-hole us a bit, painting us one color. We want to change the status quo and make something women from every part of the world can relate to and be inspired by. We firmly believe in the phrase "be the change you want to see in the world," and we believe in the power of film and storytelling. For us, that is exactly what Well Fed is. A step in the right direction, and a step toward a brighter future for all of us.

 

What Else Can You Do?

Share the LOVE! <3

If you can't donate, no problem! There's plenty of work to go around! :)

Go follow @well_fed_webseries on instagram!

Social media plays a huge part in crowdfunding success. So if you're asking yourself, what else can I do? Share, like, repost, forward, or comment on any platform, including Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, or Snapchat! 

So please, SPREAD THE WORD! We need YOU to make this happen. Telling friends, family, coworkers, and even neighbors about this project, and guiding them to our social media pages or Indiegogo campaign will go a long way. You'll also have the best perk—our eternal gratitude! 

We appreciate anything and everything you do!

story:
More about the story..

Richie's father, Danny, controls his online dating account. Richie's mother, Margaret, wants Richie to find a stable woman so he can move out and she can use his bedroom as her new 'she-shed'. Richie is nursing the heartache from a 'hot woman' who dumped him, so now he wants a 'Plain Jane' but Danny, his father, convinces Richie to hold out for a 'Super Hottie.'

The first time we see Margaret and Danny they are arguing if Richie took his condoms on his date with him. Yes, he is 45 and yes, this show is totally ridiculous while making social commentary on parents that smother their children, the shallow-ness of men and the dangers of vanity. 

A bit about my background..

My name is Rich Devaney and I have been making films and videos for 25 years. I am a hands on filmmaker who knows the ins and outs of production. This experience along with the help of a fantastic small crew allows me to deliver much higher quality than any project in this budget range... but let me tell you about the best part...

Great Actors!

My parents are played by Sondra James and Ray Iannicelli. To give you a little bit of their credentials let me just say they have both acted along side Robert DeNiro in the last year. Together Ray and Sondra have over 135 film and television credits. 

In the last few years Ray and Sondra have become good friends of mine. I am very lucky to have them as both friends and collaborators and after years of writing ideas with them in mind, #richieneedsawife struck me like lighting.

WHY COMEDY? my personal mission...

I have a 15 year old daughter and earlier this year we went through a rough patch. A couple months of arguing etc... Then she had a week off of school and I had knee surgery. Sitting on the couch and watching TV is all we could do. On Netflix we found Season 1 of Ricky Gervais's early show 'Extras' which neither of us had ever seen. We started watching and were both cracking up. That week we watched both seasons of 'Extras' and before I knew it we were buddies again. I thought what a gift Ricky Gervais just brought to our home. His humor eased all the tension between us. I have always made friends and strangers laugh and suddenly realized that I want to do what Ricky does, bring friends and loved ones together through humor. 

What and why we seek:

With your help we are producing the pilot episode. That along with the rest of season 1 being written will be what we need to pitch the Netflix & Hulu's of the world. Ray Iannicelli and I are executive producers of the show and we self funded the first 2 days of filming. Now we ask for your help to raise funds to shoot for 3 more days of filming and complete all the post production. These costs come to $12,500.00

Our Camera Guy is freaking awesome and he's Italian!

Daniele Sarte is our Cinematographer. With his help we are using a camera that is way out of our budget and our pilot will have the same quality of shows already on the air. His lighting is beautiful... did I mention he is Italian?

We also have some other killer crew members:

Sound - Jack Dixon

Art Director - Daniella Tudela 

Assistant Director - Elizabeth Gans

Assistant Camera - Luke Cao

Associate Producer - Afif Massih

PA - Anastasiya Sergienya

Editor - Paul Rummerfield

Gaffer - A tall, hard working guy named Phil who does not like to have his picture taken
